Just to put it out there, the food is great. However, the service is horrible. I ordered the fish and chips and unfortunately found a long strand of hair that killed my appetite. The waitress brought out another plate. When the bill came the fish and chips were still on the bill! You would think as a courtesy they would not charge me. Additionally, the manager John K came out (looking so unprofessional/unpresentable) he was extremely rude. He told me "we do not comp every meal that goes wrong". How rude!! He was so unprofessional. He did not even apologize. The least someone could do is apologize. Never coming back!!!

Decent place. Drinks are fine, prices matches its neighbors. Slightly cramped up, and if you are in large group, you wont like it much. My suggestion is, if its winter, and you cant chill outside, check the space availability before starting your party here.

I went here for a small business dinner.  They said we would be seated in about 1 hour, we got seated in about 30 minutes or so.  The service we got was very friendly and helpful.  Some of the people I went with had the burger, it was excellent and cooked just the way they asked for it.  I had the Maui Maui tacos, I would not get this again, it was not very good.  Based on the area, atmosphere, service and the other people's food, I would go back.  I recommend this place.
No comment

In spite of the poor reviews, I still tried this restaurant because the view was so enticing. Don't even waste your time here unless you are getting the Froze. 45min wait time if not longer. Only to get Service is terrible. Crappy quality food that takes over an hour to bring to your table. I Ordered the "specialty sliders " that came with three "different" types  and received 2/3 with just cheese and one with just meat  and bbq sauce. I asked if they were supposed to come with this way and our server said that the manager would bring out the remainder of what should have originally been on the burgers. Our server never came back and By the time they brought out my food the way it should have been to begin with, the rest of my party had already finished eating. Once we asked for the bill, it took another 25 mins for someone to come pick up our tab. There are no heaters on the patio seating so keep that in mind as well. If it's your first time to New York like it was mine I definitely recommend trying something different.

Two stars because it was a nice view . I had chicken for dinner it was expensive and nothing amazing...and then it started to rain outside, I was not provided with any alternatives except to finish eating in the rain. There was no wait and the place was not full by any means.
No comment
Great burger! The veggie birger eas tasty as well.. Albeit quite ricey. Very accommodative with the kids.. Waitress Christen was amazing and helpful.
The Cadillac burger was fantastic! Our waiter/bartender was polite and attentive. Fries were so so. We'll definitely be back!
Found this place after visiting the 9/11 memorial.  Great location with an amazing view of the Hudson, great food and the staff was extremely friendly!  Will definitely visit again

The burgers here are the best bargain.  You get a large juicy burger cooked to order with your choice of different types of fries for under $20.  They also have an oyster bar which serves up a nice platter of oysters on ice with assorted condiments.  Thursdays and Fridays after 6pm the decibel level at the bar is higher than a NYC subway station.  I couldn't even hear myself think when I entered.  Thankfully they have tables toward the back which are much less noisy.  The lighting is dim, so dim that I had trouble reading the menu at first.  I had to get acclimated to the lighting first.  Our server, (Jake), was friendly and attentive yet unobtrusive.  Their New England Clam Chowder is fantastic.  Minus 1 because the Prosecco was served 15min before the oysters.
No comment

We were a party of six; I had a serious issue with my meal that I brought to the attention of one of the servers. Shortly thereafter, David, the manager arrived at our table to apologize. He asked me what he could do to make it right and I asked him if he could please remove my meal charge from our bill. He agreed and insisted on providing me with the drink of my choice. The martini was a perfect compensation and I was completely satisfied. But that wasn't enough for David. He then delivered three wonderful desserts to our table. This guy went over and above to make us happy. I must add that the service was fantastic and the food was amazing. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Came here for Dinner on Sunday night Presidents Day Weekend with my family . The hostess was very pleasant and accommodating. We sat down to eat and they were out of everything: no seafood, no steaks, even salad choices were really limited. They substituted spinach for arugula in a salad without telling us they were out of that too. Everyone had to settle for burgers.  Everyone thought they were average. I know it was an exceptionally busy weekend because of the great weather, but we weren't the only ones to check a weather report. After running out of so much food, a drink on the house or a discount on another visit would have made it not such a bad experience. They even banged us out for our kids soft drinks. I won't make my way back anytime soon.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This restaurant is amazing! The food is great. The service is great. Ron is the best! All I wanted was a pickle back and while most places do not have enough pickle juice, Rob managed to get me a shot as I came back to my table from the restroom. It's a total warm family environment. 10/10 would recommend
Awesome lobster roll. I have traveled a lot and this place was great. The bartender David was a good dude and the service was really good. I will be back for sure.

I've been working in and out of this area for the last 25 years.  Last time I was in PJ Clarkes working above it was back in the late 90s.  I'm often visiting clients in the area and decided to have lunch with a colleague back at PJ Clarkes.  It's a great American pub style restaurant and the food quality has definitely been consistent and improved.  I'm pleased I went back.
No comment

I go to PJ Clarke's on the Hudson a couple of times a week with my kids. The food and waitstaff are great.  The floor managers are always so nice and accommodating. We absolutely love it. One negative that occurred recently was watching how a senior manager, I am assuming the General Manager,  treated a floor manager. On this particular occasion I witnessed the man yell at the floor manager and be extremely rude. I feel so bad for the people who work under him. It must make it impossible to work properly being yelled at like a child in front of customers. Hopefully this gets to the restaurant and a change is made.

My fiancé and I, have been coming to this location for three years now, and it has been a great experience. Not only is the food so delicious, but the service is top notch! We usually have their burger, the 100% angus beef. You can pick your toppings, and me tell you they don't hold back!! Zach is an outstanding manager who always makes us feel right at home. We couldn't be happier with PJC on the Hudson!

A friend's wedding brought us to the city and namely PJ Clarke's for the rehearsal dinner. We were sat in a backroom with it's own bar so my experience wasn't that of a typical patron I presume. The service was a little spotty but they did have two huge tables to serve. My entire table ordered the steak and I heard zero complaints. The wine and drinks kept coming along with courses to consume. Worth the trip in my opinion, especially for the view!

I started coming here about 9 years ago when I found out someone I knew bartender here part time. The place is pretty dingy which is surprising since it's in world financial center. The food and drinks are cheap and portions are big.

I was here for happy hour with a bunch of co-workers that were celebrating a farewell for a few people. I didn't have a chance to eat any of the food but the drinks were fine. I had maybe a few sweet potato fries but that was about it. The restaurant has fantastic views of the Hudson and that's what most people come here for. The outdoor seating is pretty awesome and during the summer it's very nice out. I think I speak for most people that this is more of an after work spot and no person in the right mind would come here any other time. The menu items are quite pricey unless you really have your heart set on PJ Clarke's, go somewhere else to eat.
I love this place. Great outdoor dinning with a view of the Statue of Liberty!!! Their seafood is amazing as well as their burgers. A must try if ur in the area or at the Freedom Tower.
No comment
The location by the waterfront is fabulous.  The food was fantastic and I  would recommend to anyone visiting the World One area.  A little on the laud side but the atmosphere was great.
No comment
No comment

Over. Rated. This is one of the go to happy hour spots in lower Tribeca mainly because of the location, view and space. But there really isn't aren't happy hour specials and this place gets PACKED. Extra points for the reasonably tasty sliders and outdoor space, and great place to host your bougie company sponsored team drinks, but otherwise, I'd skip it.
No comment

I have been to the other two PJ Clarkes establishments in NYC and this location does not hold up to the quality of the the Lincoln Center or Midtown East location.  Having dined in a PJ Clarkes before I ordered the burger.  What I was served was a diner quality burger with some basic fries...glad I didn't buy into the upsell from the waiter for cheese/avocado/bacon.  I ordered a Pimm's Cup that tasted more like water with herbs in it than a cocktail.  View of the Statue of Liberty was great but hostess tried to sit us smushed between two to other tables when there were plenty tables around the restaurant.  Very lackluster for the location.  There are better food choices in this area for the price.
No comment
No comment

Super overpriced American food franchise. Got the sliders to try out the diff burgers. Def would just get the reg full size bacon burger next time. I didn't rly enjoy the mushroom one (which was a bummer) and the reg one was just okay. The buns were really basic and dry. And hard to eat.
I had the mash potatoes and the bbq bleu Burger. I also tried the crab cake and the tator tots.  The food  definitely  needs flavor and texture improvement but the service was great.
No comment

Gorgeous view if you are sitting outside! But other than that, it's pretty blah. The first time I came was after visiting Brookfield Place, I got a table outside. My friend wanted to order something off the Specials menu but they were sold out. He then proceeded to order another dish and it was sold out again...SERIOUSLY?! I ordered the Japanese style lobster roll, but when my order came it was another lobster roll. I hate to complain (bc I don't want any spit in my food) and just ate the bland lobster roll. It was not good at all. My friend got some duck & pasta dish, he said it was alright. I came here again on July 4th, and decided to only get drinks. I asked the bartender for the cocktail menu & he handed it to me and added that the Sangria was the drink special of the day & he highly recommends it. Nothing on the menu really stood out so we went with the sangria...big mistake! It tasted awful! It didn't even taste like sangria & 2 glasses set us back $38 after tip. We asked the bartender if we could take the drinks to the seated area and he said yes, we just cannot go outside the restaurant property with the drinks. The seated area was rather empty so we walked to one of the empty tables (one out of 30 that were empty) and attempted to sit down. A Hispanic busboy runs over like we committed a crime & told us we MUST checkin with the hostess. We asked if he could just tell her and he said NO! We walk over to the hostess and ask if we could just sit down and finish our drinks and she said I needed to put my name on the wait list if I wanted to sit outside. I told her I'll be less than 20 min and she said No, the place was 75% empty! I really wanted to like this place but it looks like I won't be returning.

This place is just okay. The food is average food, nothing to write home about. The women's bathroom is a nightmare. That should have been my first clue but I decided to stay. Bad move on my part. The only thing this place has going for it is the view of the Hudson.

Amazing dinner with amazing staff. We ordered the Raw bar platter and a few salads and entrees. The hosts where all really pleasant as well. Definitely the place to be if you are shopping in Brookfield place or want a nice outdoor view. The pineapple cake dessert was delicious!
A nice location with mediocre burgers. At least the beer was cold.  Service was good.  A good place for outside dining, especially with a crowd, but I'd never go there for the food alone.

I have gone here at least 6 times with my husband, and absolutely love this place! The last time I went, a week ago, I was with my mom. The waitress Alita was so super nice and accommodating, I will make sure to request her from now on. Do not order the (Mezze Plate)Hummus dish, it is so Bad they should take it off the menu. The Baja fish tacos, and Greek salad were delicious! Their hamburgers look fantastic! Great atmosphere when you sit outside, which we usually do.  We did have a woman bartender inside recently, who was a bit of an airhead, and no surprise very forgetful, but friendly.
No comment

We came here on a Sunday evening - gorgeous weather made for a perfect night on their fabulous patio.  The food was great - burgers are amazing!!  But what makes this place is the service.  Server was great, but the manager's attention makes this place special.  Mazin came to our table and helped serve the food, came back to see how we were doing, and then came back and visited with our kids like we were the only table in the place (we were not - it was packed).  The location is amazing, the food is great, but Mazin made it uniquely special.

They had great and friendly service. They also had a great mussels dish in a white wine sauce, as well as cheesecake to die for. With a view over the water with the Statue of Liberty, this is my new favorite restaurant in the city, along with Numero 28 Pizzeria if feeling Italian. They also have half off tap beers while I'm here, which is a great deal for NYC.

Decided to have lunch here with my very good girlfriend (since she lives right in the area). Service was non-existent!!  It took 15-20 minutes for someone to acknowledge us, 5-10 additional minutes to get the menu we were promised and 15-20 more minutes to get our drinks, which is pretty ridiculous (where's Jon Taffer)!! I considered leaving but my girlfriend talked me into staying.  Once someone did attend to us, we received food and drinks seamlessly, thank you Lady!! My girlfriend and I arrived for lunch and ordered the beet/goat cheese salad app (which was really good), the crab cake dinner, so we could have one crab cake a piece and they were delicious, the tuna tacos were good but they were teeny tiny (bit size, a little bigger than a thumb tack, not much) and you only get 4 of them and they are laid on a couple of creative lime wedges for $18!! We ordered their onion rings and they came to us soggy and greasy. Lady apologized and put in another order for us, this time the manager brought it over and not only were they extra soggy and greasy, this time they were on the darker side.  I wondered if they put our previous order back in the fryer and tried to pass it as crispy because they were darker in color.  Manager apologized and said they were very busy and the fryer may not be hot enough (of course it wasn't).  We decided to order something else, which was the mini burger sampler and that was really good.  Drinks and food are really overpriced so get ready to put a BIG dent in your wallet/purse.  I would only visit again because the view is too hard to pass up on, but even then, maybe we will sit in the public area and bring our own lunch next time!!!

Decided to enjoy Lunch here on a Beautiful Friday after visiting the nearby malls. My Wife & I looked at the Menu & was sold. We decided to eat outdoors and was escorted to the BEST table for 2 with the perfect view! That definitely made our day! We had such a sweet & kind server who was visiting from Ireland for the Summer! What a good gig, huh? Well, we had a nice conversation about the beauty of Summer in The City! We ordered our drinks & entrees. I'm on my 10th day of not eating red meat so I was excited to try the fish & chips on my new diet of seafood & plant-based foods. Well, the fries were good but the bread of the fish was too oily that I couldn't enjoy it. I had to take all of the breeding off & eat the fish inside. That was no fun & that's what's the last start lost was for. Other than that, it's an amazing restaurant & next time, I'll try the Salmon Chopped Salad. Looking forward to it!

It's all about location, location, location.  This branch of PJ Clarke's isn't all that - the food is mediocre, the service is hit or miss, but the location is great.  Especially the nice outdoor seating. Only go back when I want to sit outside in WFC but want something nicer than Quality Burger.
Got delivery through seamless. Steak frites travel remarkably well. Chocolate cake was both stale and dry. Skip the cake.

My favorite place for happy hour. Beautiful views, great drinks and awesome staff. Hollis was our server last night and she was terrific. We had a large group but she kept the food and drinks coming. Couldn't have been more accommodating and we couldn't have had more fun. Thanks Hollis.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is a nice spot to sip some beer and that's it. Food, at least what I had was lousy. Crab cake was just OK. Had I gotten it at some fancy place, I'd send it back. The tots that people raved about were worse than crab cake. Don't know about other food like burgers or calamari but beer was good.
No comment
No comment

4 stars for the food but only 2 stars for the service. We came at lunch time and all outdoor tables were taken. So we made a mistake of staying at the bar rather than waiting for a table. There was only one waitress serving the entire bar area, and she just rushed through everything. She took away a bottle of ketchup from our table without asking, while we were still eating our burgers. When she collected the empty plates, she just sticked her hands out from my back without a word. So rude and unprofessional! Will not go back :(
Amazing lunch today! Kim took excellent care of us on the patio, and it was a beautiful day to sit outside and enjoy some yummy tacos. We will most certainly be back!

Great view, crowded and expensive I would have given a higher score, but my salmon was undercooked.  It was $29.00 for the dish, do when it was under cooked my husband wanted me to send it back.  We kind of had an argument about the meal, so it was doubly bad.  I did send it back but it ruined my fun, and it was too expensive a meal to have anything mediocre so I gave 3 stars.  Our server was great, the drinks strong views wonderful l.
No comment

Went for lunch today with four coworker friends.  They've changed the menu,  jacking up prices and significantly  dropping quality.   Paid $36 for a burger, fries and coke that was at best marginally better than white castle.  Friend ordered the shrimp salad and they placed just 2 shrimp on it.   Will now avoid for lunch, after work drinks and advise all to do the same.
No comment
No comment

Came here last week for dinner with some work colleagues. Fantastic atmosphere and great location. Our server Jolie was brilliant, highly attentive, very pleasant and helped one of my colleagues chose an item on the menu that was dairy free. Couldn't recommend the place enough and will definitely be back!

This restaurant was good! I would recommend the chicken paillard. They also had an amazing brownie with mouse! It was like a chocolate cake on crack. We also had an awesome server, Chris. He was very attentive and they kindly stored our leftovers when we had to leave and come back. The server was extremely kind to us even though the restaurant was packed. Thank you Chris!

My colleagues and I were having a small gathering for one of our co-workers. We didn't have anything planned, and just decided to show up. We met Walter Roeder and he provided the best service ever. He placed my colleagues and I in a room in the back where we were able to talk, laugh, listen to the music and dance. It made his birthday memorable and our time there awesome. We'd like to send a special thank you to Walter, and if you're every in the area looking for a place to go please stop by and visit this location. Thank you again, Walter for all your help. You went above and beyond.
One of the best views of nyc not to mention the awesome staff!! Mazan is an amazing host! Experience was  he made it one of our favorite places in this neighborhood!!! Thank you Mazan!!!!
No comment
No comment
My caesar dressing was a little fishy ... but you can't beat the outdoor seating along the Hudson with gorgeous views of the Statue of Liberty.
No comment
No comment
Amazing location and views. Food was awesome and most importantly staffs were super nice.
Kitchen staff not able to handle clients with life threatening food allergies.

I would recommend this restaurant for a a relaxing meal after work.  The outdoor atmosphere is very relaxing. I didn't have a reservation but was seated promptly but was denied a table by the water even though there were open tables (but to their defense the tables were 4 tops and we were a party of 2.  The waiter came promptly and took our order.  I asked for a glass of White Zinfandel, which I was told they didn't have then I asked for a glass of Rosa.  The experience went down from there.  Our orders were taken and our drinks delivered. I ordered Chicken Club and my son ordered calamari and French fries.  My food was delivered on top of the menu's which were never taken off the table I had to ask for them to me removed and they took up the whole table.  My son's food came without his French fries and I had to try to get the waiter while he was off taken other orders.  My son loves French fries so I needed to give him mine while waiting.  My chicken club was very good but the calamari was not good and was very soggy to say the least and was left and was not eaten.  The waiter had to be called for the check after long being done with our meal and plates being taken of the table.  Our meal cost $80 for a chicken club and 1 glass of wine and French fries. I probably will not order calamari if I was going back to this restaurant.
Had the chicken Caesar salad with anchovies but, I couldn't find mine. I guess it swam away!

This is a great atmosphere to have dinner and drinks. We had a table that faced the river and the Statue of Liberty. The beers on tap were great, the service was impeccable and the food was delicious. For a restaurant that started in the late 1800s, I have to say I'm glad they are still around servicing food and drinks. If you have the chance, try the Cadillac Burger with Sweet Potato Fries!

Best place to stop by after a stroll along battery park. They are dog friendly in their outdoor space, food is great and the service was wonderful. Kimberly our server was the best! Ask for her! Order the burgers, can't go wrong.

My friends and I had a great time. Our waiter was named Kim and she was absolutely amazing! Smart friendly and efficient. She suggested food and drinks and checked in often. The food was just as great as the service. Perfectly crunchy and soft fish and chips and delicious  buffalo wings.

Meh.  This place has the advantage of a great patio dining area overlooking the marina, but otherwise it is not special.  We had brunch here recently and while the food is serviceable and the portions are large, it is not inspiring in any way.  The waitress forgot two of the items we ordered and seemed peeved that we brought this to her attention.  This might be more fun at night with a lively bar crowd. On a rainy Sunday it was a little depressing.

Service was slow, the waiter never checked to see how our meal was. I ordered Mahi Mahi Tacos which were tasteless except in the middle of the taco where there was enough sauce for one bite. My plate was $22 and because it was so bland that I couldn't finish it. My husband ordered the Chicken Pillard which was was comparable in flavor and texture to a piece of plywood and cost $24. We ordered an Old Fashioned and Mojito, the Mojito was done right but the Old Fashioned was missing all of the other ingredients, so it ended up being a whisky on the rocks. This experience was a complete disappointment to say it as kindly as possible. They had an excellent view of the Hudson River.
Amazing view of the marina, outside seating, great service and good food. Price is moderate.
No comment
Sliders were ok, service was slow to begin with and then got a little better, if you order a drink on the rocks you'll pay $2 extra for the ice
Great food was outweighed by unbelievably inattentive service. If you don't mind waiting, and waiting, and waiting, the lobster fried rice is great.
Went with a group of 20+ lovely family members and we were accommodated beautifully. The food and drinks were to die for. Sadmani was a great server and very friendly
No comment

One good experience then one very poor, 15 minutes our group sat with no service no water no nothing. Asked the maitre de for service, another 5 minute wait nothing another 5 minutes nothing so we left. My friends were in from London and it was simply embarrassing.
No comment

Food was mediocre. The worse part is that the waiters up-sell you on Bacon $3, Avacado $2 and Garlic on fries $2.  When the waiter asked about these "extra" items, he made it seem like they are part of the dish and he was simply being courteous in asking for our preferences. The point is not the $ but the tactics they use to squeeze out a couple of extra bucks on the bill. This place is good for tourists who probably wont visit again but for locals, its a "no-go" on my list.
No comment
No comment

Kimberly, our waitress was on point with everything!!! She helped us decide what to order and was so knowledgeable about every choice on the menu. She recommended the shrimp rolls to start that were superb! She also helped me order the fish and chips and assured me the batter wasn't too overwhelming! Everything was amazing! Thanks Kimberly! See you again soon :)
No comment

It's the usual post office crowd fair. The drinks are all right and your best bet is a pitcher of beer. Eats are OK. With all the new places in the area folks just go there more out habit than anything else.

I had a lovely experience here with my boyfriend. The food was delicious, waitress (don't remember her name) was so amazing and attentive. The sun was setting and we sat outside, and it was so romantic and pretty. Definitely come here.
No comment
Food is horrible. Very expensive, total rip-off. Do not go to this place. Very disappointing food. But service is good!

We all had a burger of some sort from the menu and they were all delicious, but the pricing is steep for a burger. The iced teas they offer are just mediocre and taste more like water. We also ordered a side of Parmesan tater tots which where heavy and bland. You are paying for the view.  Service was excellent. The food was good, but not great.

I would give it a 5 star for the view and ambience but the food is just average . The crispy chicken breasts weren't crispy at all . The fish was too oily . Burgers were average . The only thing we liked apart from the amazing view was the onion rings . Price was pretty good compared to the location . Would go back only for the view !

You can get a better burger and fries at McDonald's and Burger King. The owners/management simply do not care . Those buns that are equivalent of wonder bread . Mealy tomatoes . Horrible quality meat . Almost every restaurant in nyc uses pat lafrieda. Ok for $26 you can get a better burger . But that this is the best they can serve for $17. The owners do not care because the Wall Street bros come there anyway after work. The drinks are ok. But avoid eating there . The steak is terrible also.
I'm going to miss working in this area. The seaport has some of the best views. The starter wings and sweet potato fries were bomb and they have fresh oysters to feast on as well!

Service is simply awful... food was utterly average... and prices were crazy expensive!!! Tl;dr go to the place on the other side of the water instead...There is a dark skinned large African American woman serving as the outdoor hostess with a terrible attitude. She will simply ignore requests. The service is otherwise slow with waiters frequently sitting and chatting while they pretend not to see patrons waving their hands attempting to be serviced. A lighter skinned large African American woman that served as the waitress was similarly slow and rude but not as rude as the hostess. Do not come.

Average. Overpriced. Usually a ton of functions going on so difficult to sit outside if you're dining in a small group. Skirt steak is really good and so is tomato soup. I've heard burgers are pretty good but again for the price they're only average. Lobster roll is not good. Fishy. First time I got it, ice cold. Second it was hot and still fishy. Nothing special. Better than the other two restaurants next to it with same view.
Ordered steak frites for lunch and it was so fatty I couldn't even eat it.  Average restaurant with a nice view I guess.

Came here for lunch on a beautiful summer day. Ate outside. The environment was very lively and very New York. We ordered the raw sampler and all the oysters and shrimp were delicious and fresh. We also got the yuzu lobster roll and fish tacos. Also, both yummy. Only complaint - pricey!!!!!!

I initially thought this was a touristy Bistro and had very minor expectations about both he food and service.  Boy was I wrong!  I had an awesome experience and the wings were the bomb, the drinks were good and stiff and the wait staff were friendly as can be!  I urge you to check it out - sit outside and enjoy the people watching opportunity!

I had the blue cheeseburger here. It was a recommendation from a friend who said that the food was great. He was right. The hamburger almost melted in your mouth. Wonderful.
Great location and outside tables on the Hudson food was not that great and service was slow
Service was great but the food was terrible. Soggy bread, mushy chicken and the tater tots were not cooked all the way.  Not my favorite meal in the financial district.

This was a very average restaurant experience. I sat outside by the water which was nice. My boyfriend got the shrimp cocktail, which we expected to come with more than 5 shrimps for the price, but the taste was good. I got the fluke ceviche which was really refreshing and flavorful, but it didn't come with bread or crackers, which I thought was weird. I ultimately asked for some bread to eat with it. For the main course, I ate the swordfish which was full of nice greek flavor. However, my boyfriend ordered the brick pressed chicken which was horrible. The chicken was not "pressed" at all, it was barely crispy and the skin was light. The potatoes were crunchy raw. When we brought this up to our server he was very apologetic and gave us a complimentary dessert, but never even brought out cooked potatoes. We also ordered a side of crispy brussels sprouts.. they were not crispy at all. They were actually too hard to eat. We heard another table send them back twice to get crunchier and even still they were not crunchy. We also got comped the sprouts because they came out 15 mins after the food. For dessert we ordered the chocolate mousse cake which was just fine, the best part was the espresso whipped cream on top and the ganache covering the cake.
Amazing water views. Food is absolutely outstanding!  Price is exactly right. Coming back!
No comment
No comment

i'll be honest. everything tastes great. the mini sliders are moist, the fries are cooked nicely with a crispy exterior and a soft interior, happy hour oysters are juicy and full of briny flavor, dip is good (although i dont like the little toasted bread pieces they serve with it). the wings are just whatever in my opinion and that bleu cheese sauce is like water. HOWEVER, wtf is up with the prices!? they overcharge for everything and it pisses me off bc your 3 stupid sliders are not worth $17.. not even close.

We had burger and fish and chips. Both were very good. Deserts were to die for. Great views of the Hudson. Recommend.
No comment
PJ Clark!!!! YAAAAAASSSSS...the best crab cakes on earth!!!
eh.   Food ok.  10 person table was awkward between bar and dinning.   Too loud for conversation.   crab cakes too much mayo.   maybe it was just a rainy night that didn't fit.
Decent hamburger...that's about it. Not worth the price. Fries are an extra $7 and aren't event hand cut. Cool atmosphere. Don't know if I'll eat here again.
Classic NY fare without the froof!  Large dining room with plenty of space.  Great service; attentive staff.

No comment

Crazy that anyone wouldn't enjoy this place. PJ Clarke's as a whole is a fantastic restaurant with wonderful American flare, and is a true New York staple. The Vesey location however is phenomenal; with a clear view of the Statue of Liberty and overlooking the yacht filled Hudson River. Everything from the burgers, steaks, lobster rolls, oysters, and everything else is delicious and well presented. That mixed in with the ambiance makes it for more than just a dining experience. The service we had was spectacular.. Kristen was so attentive and personable and really added to our night. There was no rush to just turn over the table for the next guests as we got to enjoy a beautiful sunset while taking our time with all the great food and drinks we ordered with a monstrous chocolate cake and ice cream to top off a great night of food and family. We come here every year with friends and family from out of town mainly in the summer. We live in midtown, and was shopping uptown and decided to jump in a cab and head down there vs just going to one of the many great spots in our neighborhood because of how great of an overall experience it is, especially when the weather is so good. If you don't have a reservation, you will have to wait 40 minutes to an hour for a table outside, but totally worth the wait, plus it's a great scene in that revamped area now with the shopping centers and views. A really great spot to spend an evening.
Bad service all around. I couldn't get my order without pulling teeth. Well meaning waiters look efficient but don't get things done.
The food, ambiance and customer service was good. I will definitely be back. Try the oysters, fish tacos and Waygu beef burger.

My boyfriend and I stopped in here last weekend for dinner. While we waited for a table, we took a seat at the bar. Our bartender, James, was excellent! He makes great drinks, recommended delicious meals off the menu, provided attentive service and was good company throughout our stay. Because of James' great service, we decided to stay at the bar for dinner instead of taking our table when it was ready. The food was as good as advertised. Before leaving, we met the manager, Claire. She was equally as friendly as James and happy to take care of us. Both of these folks deserve a raise! We will definitely be back and asking for James!

I work in the bldg so I've only been to this place for team lunches and after work drinks. It caters to the business crowd in the area so it's a little on the pricey side for a Friday's / Chili's type of establishment but if you're using the corporate card - WHO CARES?!?! lol. The crab cake is a good starter and the Cobb Salad is pretty good. There's a pretty good selection of Seafood and American food options. There's also outside seating which is nice because of the view of the Hudson. Psss...the restaurant is right near the dock where they shot the wave runner scene from Hitch! (Love that movie!) Oh and a hint on the location, it's actually inside the World Financial Center so you'll need to go in through that lobby to get to the restaurant.
No comment

No comment

Poor poor service. Got drinks with the intention of ordering dinner and 20 mins later no sign of the server. After asking another server for our bill and $30 later for 2 beers and an iced tea we left.
No comment
No comment

So disappointed. My daughter works in the building and said she heard good reviews. We came on Sunday night around 8PM and sat at the bar. The staff seemed to be more concerned about closing the place then their patrons. It was really cold and windy yet the staff kept coming in and out of the door right by where we were sitting. Each time it was so windy I would pick my napkin up off the floor. Staff saw but kept coming in and out the door. Food was ok but prices expensive for a burger without fries. My Guinness tasted flat. Our plates did not get picked up in a timely manor because the staff was busy taking manual inventory of the alcohol. This is 2016 and there is automation. Will not be back its a shame that all that history won't save this company.
No comment

Ugh, this place has a strong and unpleasant smell, a view of the water that's completely concealed by shades, drinks that aren't fresh (a margarita that's made with bottled lime juice and Sprite!?), and burgers that made both me and my husband sick to our stomachs, plus lots of dudes in suites.  For your own sake go somewhere else, anywhere else for that matter.  At least the staff is nice...?

The service was HORRIBLE. We waited for an hour and a half for our appetizer, which were oysters. They messed up the appetizer order so they took it back to change it. We waited for another 30 minutes for the appetizer. Then before the appetizer the main dish came. But the main dish was cold. They have a system where they make the main dish and keep it inside until the appetizer comes. This makes my burger, onion rings, and fries cold. When I asked the waiter to change it, he was very rude and demanded that my cold burger was fresh and that they couldn't do anything because it was already in the table. I ended up eating a cold burger.
No comment

I was really excited to eat at PJ Clarke's on Easter. I ordered the blue cheeseburger and the $18 bloody Mary, my boyfriend had a bacon barbecue burger and some garlic fries. We ended up spending $80 including tip for dinner, but the bloody Mary didn't even give me a buzz. And my boyfriend had food poisoning for about 18 hours (throwing up & major stomach pains.) My burger was great but I ordered mine. To be cooked medium rare, it came out medium well. I honestly don't care about how my burger was cooked it's just the fact I paid $80 for a bougie view and bougie service you would think that they would get the burger right. PS for real though they're bloody Mary wasn't shit. Overall I was satisfied with the taste of everything & it's definitely a very romantic place, just you could get better food for a fraction of the price I paid. I would recommend the patio but I wouldn't recommend eating dinner there unless you're trying to ball out.
No comment

I went to PJ Clarkes today for lunch and I had some issues with my order. Very little things but how the manager solved it was an amazing experience to me. This is absolutely impressive how He turned my disappointment to happiness. Tai, is a very friendly, respectful manager who really cares about his customers and to see this made me very happy and thankful to him! Absolutely a 5 stars employee who knows what is hospitality means. Renata
The view alone is four stars. It's beautiful in the summer time when you are eating outdoors.

Such an inviting place for eatery. My girlfriend and I came right off of the NY Ferry looking for something to grub on. We walk to the outdoor venue to place a reservation and we got seated in less than 10 mins! The waiters/servers are excellent! The food was amazing! We were blown away with how quick the food got to our table. It started raining mid-way through our meal and the waiters/servers gladly help us move indoors. If you're looking for a quick bite to eat, fair prices, and excellent customer service, this is the place to go!

I don't understand all the hate for this place. It's a nice bar with courteous service and good drinks and food (albeit a little on the expensive side). If you like greasy burgers, you're gonna love their sliders. I had five or six of them the last time I went. I definitely recommend going outside because the view is phenomenal: the World Financial Center, the Hudson, and the marina are all right in front of you.
No comment
Just awful. Overpriced. Bad service. Terrible drinks. Avoid at all costs. Go to the food court nearby
I ordered the Grilled Chicken Caesar Salad. The chicken was so dry I had to take a drink with each bite so I could swallow. Service was great and attentive.

Horrendous customer service.  There should not be a "seating option" for outdoor seating reservations on opentable if they are not going to honor the reservation. There is a difference between option and preference. If the reservation was listed as outdoor preference, I would understand. But the reservation was for an outdoor table. Will definitely be the last time I ever step foot in a PJ Clarke's. Way too many superior spots in NYC.
Delicious! Such a nice, pleasant environment! The King George's Shepard's pie was delish - very flavorful and perfectly portioned. I will definitely return. Thank you!
No comment

I've been eating lobster rolls on my vacation and this one was by far the best!! The lobster was sweet and tasty. The iceberg lettuce salad was a great presentation and the dressing was fresh. The person with me had a cheeseburger and said it was very moist and delicious. W would have given it a 5 if waiter was more attentive to filling glasses with water when empty and offering dessert without us having to ask.

Why is everything at PJ Clarke's so grossly overpriced?  Yes, this location offers some nice views by the water if you sit outside, but I don't think it justifies spending $24 on a lobster roll that is tiny and with hard toasted bread  or getting a $10 burger they call "simply on a bun" that is on a plate that is as small as a coffee saucer.  If you want either of the above-mentioned items, step right outside the restaurant and walk towards the Ed's Lobster Bar Kiosk by the water for a cheaper and better lobster roll or walk a few extra blocks to get your burger at Shake Shack.  Maybe this place is good for happy hour drinks, but I won't be coming here for food again!
No comment

PJ Clarkes is a household name in Manhattan where you come to expect a level of food and service that has gained itself a reputation for over a century. But this past Saturday's experience was a miss on a few fronts. It could have been the solitary served 'Cadillac Burger', which is actually not "the Cadillac of burgers", the $18 6oz. Dark & Stormy, or the waiter that over-poured my Laguinitas into my glass which then foamed all over my place setting. If your looking for lunch in Brookfield Place, keep looking.

Good food and nice staff. A nice place to eat at for lunch so you can see the Hudson outside. In my one dining experience here, i thought the fish tacos were excellent, however the mac n cheese was the highlight of my meal. Definitely worth a try if you are in the area, however it is at the back end of an oddly, laid out mall, so it is a little confusing to get to.

I would say it is just ok.  Nothing blew me away except for the bill.  bowl of soup and 3 bite sized tacos was over 30 bucks.  The service was terrible. When you are a single at a table the servers in NY treat you like crap.  they figure they won't get much of a tip so who cares.  Just a trend for place here.
No comment
No comment
Been here twice and was impressed In every way. Food, service and atmosphere all great.

I liked this place for the cheap happy hour oysters and the view. The fries were ok, too. As I never made it downtown that often, I would end up here a lot when showing out of towners the city. The other reviews are right about it not being great, but I thought it was passable. Ok. Nothing horrifying, but nothing great either.

The staff was amazing but really I'm not there to make friends . I was hungry after a long day in the city with my kids . I ordered the special which was a salmon burger . I couldn't taste the salmon at all and it was charred . Horrible .appetizers were great , and location amazing . Don't order the salmon burger , try something else
