No comment
There are better spots, nearby, for the same price. Food and service are okay. I kind of felt like they didn't want to serve me and they took quite a while to get me my drink.

Came to P.J.'s to watch a football game and sat at the bar with a group of friends. Jonathan was our bartender and made our day! He gave us a round of champagne to celebrate the day and for us coming in. He really made the experience so much fun for us, most being out of towners. Would definitely recommend visiting Jonathan at the bar :)
Took long time to drinks. Order a bottle of wine and took almost hour to get it. Had to request twice. Food order was delivered wrong. Asked for crane cake deliver a crab burger. Very poor service.
You can't really ask for more from a restaurant. The burgers are exceptional here. The location is unbeatable. And as an added bonus the servers are great. Pj Clarkes has itself a regular.

Basic burgers, most are better at a fast food restaurant, cold fries, slow service and High prices (for amount and quality).  There are MANY restaurants that serve better food at this price point so not worth going here
No comment

This atmosphere was out of this world! If you are shy of spending a pretty penny do not attend a meal here! But if you are not shy to spend a pretty penny and get a bang for your buck, so worth it! The seafood is to die for!
No comment

I went here to have a going away party for a co worker that was moving on to greener pastures. And I have to say I will never be back, I was there with my other friends who are both woman of color and we were never able to get anyone to help us at the bar. I constantly tried to flag down a bartender, just to be ignored as they served everyone around us. The only way I was able to get anything to drink is when I asked my white friend to try for me, and lo' and behold he was served immediately. It is 2015 not 1930, I was shocked that treatment like this still happens in this day and age. If you don't want people of color to go to your establishment, move it to a country where there are no people of color (good luck with that by the way, we are everywhere), Why be racist in one of the most ethnically diverse cities in the world???....it makes absolutely no sense....

Came here for a happy hour after work.  Except...they don't have drink specials, ever.  We decided to come here since the weather was nice (first time all season!) and the one redeeming quality of this place is the outdoor seating.  I had the perfect view of the statue of liberty and was getting a good dose of sunlight.  Drinks are expensive ($14 for a much to be desired martini) and the food was mediocre bar food at best (we only had appetizers but usually those are the easier win).

Greek salad consists of some reasonably fresh tomatoes, as well as some less fresh tomatoes. Hardly seasoned, it includes various chunks of celery and green onion. In all, there isn't even an attempt to make something integrated or tasteful or fresh. This costs some $11 or $12. Add to that cramped tables, a loud room, and servers that seem to ask questions as if they are issuing orders. Lovely place and great value too.
No comment
Food could have used more flavor in general, but the crab cakes were awesome. Service was good.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We had dinner earlier somewhere but wanted to have a few more drinks! The weather wasn't the best so we came into P.J Clarks. One bartender helped us then another was close by when we wanted a few more cocktails. The bartender who came over was great! He had an Irish accent and held great convo! His name was Mark and he only started working there a week or so ago.  He was super cool, made a quiet bar a lot of fun and he told us he will only be there until October so we plan on coming back for his company and high ability to shake up a delicious shot! See ya soon mark!

Meh aside from its proximity from our office, I don't see any real incentive in returning. Their french onion soup had no flavor and the burger was also pretty bland. We came in with a party of 7 and no one was really satisfied with their meal.

Tried to love this place, it's right by my office. After a couple attempts, (having $15 "medium well" burgers served raw, bartenders not knowing what "up" means) I'll have to move on. The search continues!
No comment

It's a popular happy hour spot in the Financial District. If I choose to catch up with friends downtown, PJ Clarke's is one of the bar/restaurants on the rotating list. I appreciate the fact they serve dinner- I like their Montauk Fish Tacos, but I've had better elsewhere. I haven't had the chance to come here during the summer, but I think their patio by the North Cove yacht marina would be a nice spot for a cold beer.
Food is always delicious but portions could be bigger. Service is good and it's  perfect for dining al fresco in warmer months. Lots of tv's at bar in case sports are on.
Got food poisoning here, but the sliders are so good it's almost worth it (but not when you get crippling pain on a 6-hour car ride to Ithaca).
Great view. Great Happy Hour Beer Prices. Often very packed so expect a wait for refills. Not too bad but just long enough to be borderline annoying.

It's obviously a local gathering spot. service was attentive. I had the kale and avocado salad and the turkey club sandwich. plenty of meet and avocado on the sandwich. I would go here again. plenty of inside and outside seating too

I needed a quick drink after a long unplanned walk with my pup one day (when the president is in town don't even think about crossing west st until he gets to his destination!). Stopped by PJ Clarke's, yes they could seat me and allow my pup in the outside seating area. The waiters were great! Recommended cocktails and oysters were awesome. I ordered the daily special (lobster mac and cheese) to go and it was excellent. They gave my pup some water. Loved loved loved the service. Will definitely be back.
No comment
Great burger and fries and ambience, but terrible ketchup, so.....no.
Very bad service average food. The waiter just seemed to not be interested in serving us. We left without deserts as they just did not arrive. The drinks had to be asked for three times.

Very unfriendly bar staff. Pricey and uninviting. With so many restaurants in the area you would think they would make an effort. My suggestion is keep on walking and discover some of the many friendlier places. They are plentiful! Good luck, great area of the City!

We stopped in for lunch this weekend and we were very disappointed. While the food was acceptable, the service was very very poor. There were a number of large groups in the room but we sat for more than 10 minutes waiting to place our order and except for when our food came we were never visited by wait staff again until I flagged someone down to give us a check. The waiter apologized at the beginning of the meal and the end, acknowledging that we had been ignored. Based on our experience, we could not recommend this restaurant to a friend.  PJ Clarke's has always stood for quality to me so we left quite astonished.

Over priced burgers. It reminded me of White castle. Greasy, stale bun, and flavorless. I got one slice of cheese and a half a piece of bacon on my burger. Only thing good and fresh about this place is the oysters. Service was terrible our server seemed pretty miserable working there. Don't waste your time.

Had a lot of fun with co-workers on a Thursday night. Weather was too bad to see the view but it is probably great in the nice weather. We had the best waiter who made sure we had everything we needed. Food is overpriced and it is noisy but that is par for the course in the busy parts of Manhattan with a young crowd

Weren't here after visiting the memorial. Service was very slow. Had to ask twice for our order to be taken. I ordered the "Cadillac" burger and to me I believed it was going to be something big and good. It came out and basically it was a slider. It was tiny! Cocktails were good. That was about it. Would not go back.
No comment
No comment
Was fun until they kicked us out of the bar for being drunk which was ridiculous because we were being very respectable and polite.  Choose someplace that's actually fun.

We had a wagyu burger and lobster cobb salad, both of them were yummy. The service was good and the terrace is lovely. So happy that we found this place on a sunny day, so we could sit outside and enjoy the marina.
Nice location good atmosphere  but the food was not so great.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The most interesting place to eat in WFC, its close to the water, if you come here during the day try getting an outside table during summer time, the atmosphere is nice and the food is not bad, but I must admit ive only had the crab cakes (and some finger foods from friends plates).  I used to work in this building and when happy hour begins the place fills up with bankers that go for the atmosphere, drinks, and to mingle a bit after a long days work.
No comment
No comment
A delightful experience, a wonderful burger and fantastic service. Not the best burger in NYC but good.

Perfect for a cold one after work in the summer. Right on the marina, tons of outdoor seating. Pretty good burgers too. During winter months, forced inside, the place loses much of its appeal - but is still an ok option.

my boyfriend and i found this place because of a spontaneous trip on the ferry. the waiters and waitress were so amazing. the view from this restaurant is breathtaking. we ordered burgers, the smoky bbq sauce is the most amazing bbq sauce i have tried. the flavors mix so well with each other, the onions were so fresh. the pickles had a distinct taste that ties the whole meal together. everything was great. it made our trip that much more special.
Just go for the view.  The food won't fail to disappoint.  Over priced is not the problem but the quality is just so poor.  When you can't even get a turkey sandwich correct, it's really sad.
No comment

What a great place for some drinks and dinner after work -- especially in the summer.  Attentive waitstaff, great menu, immaculately prepared drinks and did I mention... OYSTERS.  I love oysters and there is something extra special about being able to enjoy them in a restaurant that overlooks the water.  I can't think of any place in Manhattan that brings it all together with as much gusto as P.J. Clarke's.  My waiter suggested my oysters which were called Pine Island and they were absolutely fantastic.  You have to check this place out.
No comment
Portions are small, burger is pathetic. The only redeeming part about this place is the outdoor seating in the summertime.
great for drinks... gets a little crowded but for happy hour, it hits the spot!!!

Went here this past weekend for drinks and dinner. The drinks were great, nice atmosphere, nice view and outdoor seating and I loved the burger I got. I did a name my own with avocado and fried onions. Great place def recommend!!

Exactly as you'd expect. A tasty, greasy, cheeseburger with little fanfare and cold mugs of Sam Adams. For ~$10, including fries, you can't really go wrong. I wouldn't put the PJ Clarke's burger in the upper-echelon of the NYC Burger Pantheon, but it's still pretty damn good.
No comment

I went for lunch with my colleagues today and was disappointed. We were a group of ten, and I would think that being right on wfc, they'd be used to serving groups. Our orders took forever to arrive and it wasn't even packed. The apps came out maybe  half an hour after placing and then another 30 minutes for our burgers. I asked for a coke and they got me a fork. I asked for a mushroom burger and got a cheeseburger. The waiter eventually bought over a side of mushrooms for me to add on (seriously?) Then they circled the table repeatedly with a side of mustard to our table asking who asked for it when no one did. My "mushroom" burger was dry and average at best. Sweet potato fries that came with tasted like literally nothing. I literally can count the number of times in my life when I haven't finished an order of sweet potato fries and I didn't even eat half here. The best part of the meal was my dessert which we waited another 20 minutes on. It was a brownie sundae and who can mess that up? Definitely not worth the prices here.

We came to PJ Clarkes with my family and had a really bad experience with the food. Some family members ordered burguers which were Ok. My bf ordered fish and chips which was rather tasteless and it had more batter than fish. We ordered a side salad and the dressing was like eating raw anchovies. I ordered the Mahi Mahi tacos and they were absolutely tasteless and flavorless. In essence, we might come back for the views but we will only order Burguers and nothing else.
No comment
No comment

so this place is amazing if you are looking for a restaurant overlooking the water. the food is good, but nothing incredible. we started with the parmesan tater tots which were actually amazing. they were crispy and the parmesan added a salty taste and it was perfect with the spicy ketchup it came with. As the main, my boyfriend and I split the Cadillac (burger with bacon and cheese) and the mushroom cheddar burger (cheese, sauteed onions, grilled mushrooms). i thought they were both good but nothing i would travel far and wide for. i was surprised the burgers didn't come with fries. We also got a side of onion strings - they were actually really tasty. they are thin, fried onions and they are fun to eat as a side.
No comment

It is a typical bar, crowded and noisy in the evenings. Outdoors seating is quite good during the summer. You get a view of the Hudson and marina. They have a good selection of drinks. Some items in bar food are quite good. Tater tots and chicken wings are the best. Maze plate and sliders are all right. Service is good.
No comment

I was craving a burger , and being in the area I decided to try PJ Clarke's. The interior itself is very cozy. As I was being seated ,I asked for a tall table by the window and the host pointed me to one. As my friend and I sat there we realized that the area by our table was quickly becoming a stroller parking lot. We were surrounded by everyone's stoller and things quickly went downhill from there. The host should have warned us that where we sat is a spot for strollers and people chatting-and not a good place to sit or at least asked us if we wanted to move when he saw the situation. He surely had enough time to chat and laugh with his co-workers but no time to pay attention to guests. Now the waitress, no smile ,not welcoming. Took our order and went missing the entire time. I couldn't get another drink and had to wait forever for the check. Now the food- the burger was okay, average. The french fries were average as well, the onion rings were extremely oily. When you pay $22 dollars for some burger and fries ,you expect a bit of a better service and food. If I ever give this restaurant another shot it will not be this location.
No comment
No comment

Not sure what the appeal is.  The food is over priced and mediocre at best.  The service is slow or non-existent.  We have been twice, once for dinner, the other time for brunch.  I would put the food below New York pub standards, which is a shame as this is the closest thing to a pub in Battery Park.  Good thing O'Hara's is right across the West Side Highway.  Different strokes for different folks, I guess.

We went there on Valentine's Day and it wasn't very crowed and we were able to sit by the window with beautiful view of the 911 Memorial Park. The waiter was super nice and funny, the entree was pleasant, we ordered Third Ave Shrimp Salad, Hand Picked Crab Cake and Chopped Angus Steak; for dessert, the Warm Bread Pudding was very impressive! Thank you PJ Charke for making our night special,lol

Relaxing spot for drinks after work, especially when you sit in their al fresco area by the Hudson. Typically order their oysters and raw bar sampler, crab cake, burger, mini cheeseburgers. It's either here or Southwest for after work drinks at the WFC... and I prefer the stuff (raw bar!) here.

The food is like a half step up from TGI Fridays.  Yet the prices would almost indicate a four star restaurant.  A cobb salad a, plain hamburger with french fries cost me $42.  I guess what you're really paying for is the view.  Here's a helpful tip, go to Whole Foods across the street bring it back to right around PJ Clarke's is located and you'll find plenty of seating everywhere else around the Hudson.  I'm never going back, unless you're planning on paying for me.
No comment
Not bad food, great location if you're in the battery park area and want a bight to eat. Expect to see full NYC prices though for pub food.

Our meal today was easily the worst food I have had in a long time- so bad I felt compelled to write a review which I never do in hopes that someone there reads this and understands they cannot charge what they do for food this sub-par. I'll get right to it- we ordered the caeser salad and a side of shaved brussel sprouts. Sure you go to PJ Clarke's for a burger-  but a caeser salad is easy we figured this was safe. 1:50 minutes later possibly the most sad looking salad arrived at the table. I literally felt bad for this salad it was swimming in dressing and looked as though it had been sitting out for an extremely long time. The brussel sprouts came out and werent shaved, but cut in half extremely greasy and undercooked. The prosecco came and it was so flat we thought they brought us wine by accident. Whoever is in charge needs to get on top of this because it was actually perverse how bad this meal was. (We also got a bloody mary that had old olives in it and cost $18 bucks. Unreal.)
No comment
No comment
No comment

Decent lunch overall. If you're getting the chicken paillard, be warned, the dish can easily feed two. Yukon potatoes were good but with lots of oil sitting at the bottom of the dish. The Mac and cheese was good but some might not enjoy the crunchy green onion texture. Also, my friend got a burger and was charged $1.25 extra for a dollop of BBQ sauce on the burger...seems extravagant.
Terrible food and service. Had a turkey burger that came out mushy and disgusting. The bun was clearly bought at the local grocery store. The fries were ok and it takes forever to get any of it.

Weather was finally sunny and warm and we were looking for a place outside.  Found this after we were visiting the World Trade Center site.  Place was packed as it was Friday afternoon. Service was outstanding, staff was attentive to our requests.  We had a burger and a clam chowder, both were very good.  Although pricey, it is New York!, we enjoyed our time there.  After we ate we needed directions to the subway to Penn Station, the manager took time to help us, we appreciated that gesture very much.  Would go back again.

I wouldn't go to World Financial Center to go there but if I were in World Financial Center, I'd go there.  Decent beers and outdoor seating by the water.  The food is your typical bar food, and the indoor area has a nice feel.  Great for after work drinks if you're in the area.

You are paying for location, location, location. The food was nothing to write home and tell anyone about. I got a Caesar salad and I don't think there was any romaine lettuce, I'm pretty sure it was iceberg. The dressing was very bland, the worse Caesar dressing I have had in a while. Extremely overpriced, the view is amazing from the patio and its a good place to people watch. If I ever come again, I would only do drinks and appetizers. If you want good food, go somewhere else, if you want ambiance then this is a decent place.
Putting the raw onion underneath the hamburger bun is the stupidest thing ever. It makes the bun soggy. PLEASE don't do that.  Also get the food to the table while it is still hot please

Nicely done drinks, tasty bar nibbles, and plenty of space to sit and stand as well as lots of outdoor seating for the nicer months. Really looking forward to some Friday evenings here in the summer for the lovely riverside location.

when the high-end restaurants open in brookfield this year, pj will surely see a decline in business. the food is on the expensive side and uninteresting. come with the boys for a beer, wings and watch the game. maybe do a work happy hour, but not for dinner. if it wasn't so close to my office, i wouldn't have went at all. frankly, they suck.
No comment

Went here for my companys after party holiday party. Ive gone through WFC so many times before and never thought to step inside this place. Its huge! I can imagine during the spring or summer the views are awesome, as of now sitting near the window means catching a chill. Service was very attentive, I had snacked on coworkers french frires- they were tasty. Only thing i would change about this place, please offer hot water when you wash your hands, the water was fffrrrrreeezzzziiinnngggg!!! Aside from that I had a good time
No comment

I went for an company event for drinks.    Atmosphere is the best part of this place.  i love the americana feel when you step into the joint.  Food was whatever but i was really impressed by the sliders (GOOOOD!!!)
Nice place for a happy hour when the weather cooperates, but you pay a premium for the outdoor location.  Apps are tasty (love the short rib spring rolls), but service is spotty at best.

A quick sip while out and about on a increasingly drizzly Saturday close to the waters and Battery Park. The servers and bartender were very accommodating, our bartender was great and he agrees that there should be a Peet's Coffee in NY, but I digress, this place is good for a drink and a nibble. Their buffalo wings are zesty, their sliders are pretty damn good after a couple of Magners, and they have Magners. Enough said.
Food ok.  Grumpy waiter.  Nice to be able to eat outside and people watch or see all the boats.
Sadly, this just is not as good as the original, which I love dearly. I appreciate the great view and outdoor seating but there's something lacking in this spinoff.

I wouldn't even choose a star if I didn't have to. I had family in town this past weekend and we went to the location downtown near Brookfield place. We all ordered water, and one Diet Coke, burgers (which I think are the cheapest on the menu) and split fries, and our waitress looked very unhappy about how small our bill was going to be. Granted I understand that a place like this you expect to make big tips, but regardless as a waitress you should treat every customer the same and still work for those tips. I think she thought we were all tourists and decided to never check on our table unless we flagged her down to get something. Maybe she thought she had nothing to lose by not serving us, but what she didn't know is that I live here and have told every person about this experience. Read on it only gets worse. 40 mins later we still didn't get our food, so I asked her and she said she would "check", we noticed that other tables that got there after us had been getting their food already so that had us concerned (mind you they were NOT busy this night). She finally returned and said, "there was a disaster in the kitchen, so sorry guys." So we gave her a few more mins then ANOTHER table next to us got their food and had gotten there at least 20 mins after us. We had been contemplating just getting up and leaving if we didn't get our food but once that happened we decided F it this is ridiculous! We thought about leaving money for the DC but decided that it was utterly ridiculous to be treated the way we were. She saw us get up and said, "sorry guys" with a stupid little smirk on her face like she got her way. I'm still appalled at this experience. I didn't even get to try the food but the experience was so bad I would never return to do so. We ended up going to eat at Dos Toros and THAT is what I recommend, never had one problem with an order there!!
No comment
No comment

The location of this restaurant is great when the whether is nice out. There is a ton of outdoor seating. We wanted to sit as close to the water as possible so we sat alongside the fountain-type thing there --- not such a good idea when its windy! We ended up get spritzed throughout our meal. Every $.75 oyster special is great! Had the skirt steak and it was perfectly cooked and delicious! Overall the prices are a little expensive and this is definitely not conveniently located as it is so far downtown. If I was in the area, I would go back again.

Best attribute of this place - outdoor seating in the summertime.  It is nice to be on the water with a glass of Sauvignon Blanc.  That being said, food is really bad, service is not great.  Since the main reason one goes to a restaurant is the food, this place just does not cut it...

I had a great time, even though I give it 2 stars. Everyone in the city knows that PJs is for after work drinks, and they do that perfectly well. Plus, you can sit outside and watch sailboats and tourists bob in the water over an undersized $14 martini. Well, the tourists don't bob in the water, but there sure are a lot of them by ground zero.
Super crowded, but nice crowd and friendly waitstaff. Food is awesome, highly recommend the burger with bernaise sauce and the fried onions.

Really one of the only spots on the west side of the highway to grab a drink after work (with decent outdoor space). Nothing beats the atmosphere on a summer evening having some beers by the waterfront. Food is decent but a little over priced. Standard pub fare. Can get crowded.

I live in BPC so I've been here a couple of times. The view is, of course, amazing but the food is nothing but mediocre for the price. NEVER order skirt steak here. I've had it twice, and both times I was served a small chunk of burnt coal, not real steak. Southwest NY, five doors away, is a much better alternative.  But if you insist... come here for drinks, not for real meals.

I like the shrimp salad and sitting outside on the water- I think that the food is kind of mediocre, especially considering the name of the place.   I don't love how you have no choice but to order everything a la carte- and how there are very few healthy alternatives on the menu other than a steak (yes, steak is healthy).
Good burgers and a decent view of the Hudson and the yachts of manhattan's super rich.

I haven't eaten at this PJ's, so I cannot speak to the food.  HOWEVER, it is a good location for after work drinks in the summer time because you can sit outside with a view of the boats in the North Cove Marina.  It gets pretty busy right after work, but there is a lot of standing room both inside and outside.

Stopped by just before noon on a Saturday. Asked the cute hostess if they were still serving breakfast. Answered with a yes and walked away. To my surprise, there were only eggs benedict and a salmon omelette on the  menu. Not what I had in mind. Had the eggs benedict which were nothing special given the exorbitant price. I could have stopped by a food cart for an egg sandwich for a 1/8 of the price and been just as satisfied.

Worst place and worst burger  I've ever try. Mosquitoes flying around, tables are dirty.  Prices are super high.. If I was from health department I would shut down that place for sure... The people goes there because of the view but nothing else
Take your money else where. The food is fine, service was soooooo slow, presentation was horrific. I was served my burger in a plate that is basically used to serve bread at other restaurants...

Perfect meal. When I asked the bartender for Heinz ketchup, he readily produced a bottle. And even though the Diet Coke came in a small glass bottle, he quickly refilled my glass at no charge from another bottle of Diet Coke (multiple times)! Not mention a great burger and fries. Well, well, worth it.

Super underwhelmed by the service.  Confusing layout and the people who work here seem to go out of their way to avoid talking to you let alone helping you.  Very unfortunate as the location is quite nice.
No comment
No comment

Lots of things to love about this place. One is the outdoor seating. The views of the marina and skyline across the Hudson are great. The burgers here are legendary. They have a full bar with TV's showing sports an news. The seating is comfortable, the service is quick and courteous an the overall atmosphere is cool. I'm usually there for lunch but I'm sure it's great to eat outside in the evening on fair weather nights.

I went here last weekend with a groups of friends for a party after we took a sail ride on the Hudson. We arrived around 2:00 for lunch and drinks. We sat outside and enjoyed the nice view. The service could have been more friendly but overall it was a nice lunch. Very big place with alot of outdoor seating and you can also just hang by the bar inside. I got the burger with fries and it was good. It wasn't the best burger I got, but it hit the spot and they cooked it just like a asked. I would def come back here on a nice spring or summer day for lunch or a cold drink. The other 10 people we were with all enjoyed the food the atmosphere. If you are around this area of NY and are looking for a place to have a nice lunch while enjoying a drink outside, go check this place out.

The location for this place is awesome.  I went on a hot Sunday afternoon, The view of the boats, water and from a distance you can see the Statue of Liberty. When you're eating outdoors you are practically right under the Freedom Tower.  Your surrounded by so much history, it's amazing.  The food was good,  I had a turkey with swiss, bacon and red peppers.  Fries are separate.  A little pricey, but decent.  The service was wonderful.  Everyone was so attentive and pleasant.  I would love to go back on a cooler day so I can sit outdoors and enjoy the breeze.
No comment

FROZEN fries with an overpriced burger? forget it. If I want frozen fries McDonalds does it better. Making fresh cut fries is the easiest thing in the world and doesn't cost any more than a potato. I'm not asking for anything exotic. If PJ's is cool with having frozen fries, then I'm guessing they don't care about their food.
Wedge salad good...fish tacos very subpar...wings still to be decided...

First the positives... Very, very good calamari and great service. The people are super friendly. Now for the rest of the story...  My boyfriend hates restaurants with wide-mouth ketchup bottles. They are extremely unsanitary as children and barbarians can lick their knives and stick them back in the bottle.  Honestly, that was the least of our troubles.  In a nutshell, the shrimp salad was small, overpriced and had very little shrimp.  It also has so many slaty olives it's almost inedible. The chicken and swiss sandwich was so dry we had to take a drink of water with each bite to get it down.  Did I mention how overpriced this restaurant is?
No comment
No comment

PJ Clarke's on the Hudson left us all feeling neglected. Let's start with its pros: a fantastic location, with amazing views of the Statue of Liberty and the sea front. Cons: the place is SORELY understaffed and LOOOONG WAITS -- 40-60 minutes before appetizers? For real? It really bummed us all out. If you value your time, do not go here -- Shake Shake Battery Park does everything these guys do better, faster and will leave you feeling much happier than PJ Clarke's on the Hudson.
The food was better than expected and the view is great. Definitely worth stopping if you're in this part of town. Our server was exceptional.
Great little place with nice view of the water. Staff was attentive and friendly and the food was good.
No comment

They get an obligatory bonus star due to the great location, but this is probably one of the worst managed restaurants I've been to in the city. Both times I've gone (once dinner, once lunch) it took over 10 mins to get water to the table and 20 for our drinks to arrive...dinner ended up being a 3 hour affair! 1 time is a problem, 2 is a trend. If you're near the area in the afternoon - there's a couple open food stations that also sell beer and wine that's literally 50 yards away from PJs - save yourself the hassle and go there (tacos are real good). For dinner, Merchants is just a couple mins south and also sits on the water - do that instead. You can spend the extra hour you save pointing and laughing at the suckers @ PJs still waiting for their appetizers.

I like how this is spacious with a few big screen TVs. This location also has outdoor seating which is nice to have in the summer. Service here was just average and a little incompetent on the weekends.

I came here for lunch and was very pleased with the service and food I had. The servers are very attentive and our food came out much faster than I expected. I ordered the Hamburger Au Poivre and it was cooked exactly to my liking. I hate asking for medium well and being served meat that's too red or overdone. This was cooked perfectly and the fries were very fresh. Their house ketchup is organic and tastes awesome!! Definitely a must-go if you're in the area and looking for a great burger!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Impromptu pop in while in Brooklyn on a Monday afternoon, walked in with a semi large group not realizing the space is on the smaller side but staff were really accommodating. A couple of tables were placed together and we were set. Space was clean, staff were friendly, and food was delish! Faves: Grand Mimosa, fried chicken, cornbread, Mac n cheese. Ash was very attentive, really took care of our group and we appreciated his service to a T. 100% recommend! Thank you for your service :)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

A staple of my neighborhood in Bedstuy I come here for the Nashville chicken and catfish. I usually get it hot and with aioli sauce. The fries are crisp and good and so is the collard greens. When I dine in I enjoy a good cocktail. Truly appreciated this restaurant staying open during the height of the pandemic. I can't believe it took me this long to review it. One of my faves.
Great chicken sandwich and service! This place can fill up quickly on the weekends because of its size but well worth any wait time .

Actually ended up here because the Black Nile wasn't open at the time they stated on sign HOWEVER I'm glad it happened the food at Peaches Hot house was more than delicious. Customer service was awesome. I had the French toast with Catfish and it gave me life and a full belly. So much food I was full for the day. Please try the cornbread which did not disappoint at all moist and buttery like it should be. Yummy yummy
No comment

Always great food and drinks. The fried chicken is amazing and can be very spicy if that's your thing. The wait staff are accommodating and usually pleasant. They have a rustic vibe which is comfortable and quaint.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Peaches is a great small place right in Bedstuy. The waiters & waitresses are always friendly and help with whatever you need. The food is AMAZING. I usually get my wife the fried shrimp and my mother in love enjoys the chicken. We always get the sweet potato fries. Still haven't found a place that has better fries.
No comment

- This place is right around the corner from my Air Bnb and it is always packed! This southern restaurant has indoor and out door seating and is very quick to get food out to you. The chicken is stupid good. I tried the chicken sandwich and the spicy level was perfect and the chicken was incredibly juicy. I would not go here if you aren't very hungry because the portions are big and you need to be rolled out if you finish your plate. The margarita is also delish. The taste is fresh and very obviously not from a mix.

I have been here to eat before and decided to take out instead. I was disappointed at the quality of the food. The rice in the gumbo was almost mushy and it was way too salty. The collard greens tasted like they came from a can. The "jumbo" crab cakes were the most tasty thing but they were the size of two meatballs. Peaches you can do better!

Super packed on the weekend but we managed to snag a bar seat. The grit and catfish burger was so good! The bartenders served us the best ice tea I've ever had and we enjoyed a nice and relaxing brunch here
No comment
Best fried chicken in Brooklyn! Food was delicious. Service was great as well. Highly recommend!
Great fried chicken sandwich. Had a some fries and a glass a wine to lair with it. Fast friendly service. Another great neighborhood spot to hit while in BK.
Food was great drinks were great. Perfect spot for a sit down meal with what appears to be a full bar.
The chicken is very flavorful! Everything is fresh and hot, it comes in a good time frame. The ambiance is very chill and comfortable.
No comment
No comment
So good. My favorite friend chicken spot in NYC. Such welcoming staff and A+ service.

Love their salmon entree and brussel sprouts! Give a decent sized piece of salmon & make it just how I like it! :) Mashed potatoes are really good and filling and so is their salmon sandwich. Id go for the salmon dish entrée over the salmon sandwich. Ive only ate their once and I loved my waiter. He was great and made a great recommendation on drinks. Love when the staff truly knows the menu. I was able to sit at a table even though my guest was running a little late. I loved that. Nice spot, nice staff, and great cocktails & eats.
No comment
Peaches is delicious. I haven't been in a while but I'm sure the food still SLAPS!!!!

Excellent restaurant. Walked in on a Friday night and despite being crowded, they had a table for 2 available. Server was very nice, food came quickly, and was delightful. The shrimp was astonishingly good. Restaurants usually don't give shrimp of such good quality and quantity. I was too full to eat it all. The grits were good. Drinks were great. Took chocolate cake home and it was amazing though I was too stuffed to eat much of it. Music was all Renaissance, they definitely know and love their audience.

Cool spot to chill at but it is definitely busy on the weekend scene. Attentive waiter and wait staff - food is good as well
No comment

This review was long overdue. I came a few months ago and just forgot to leave a review. So I came here thinking I was coming to Peaches...what a big mistake. It's a fairly small space and they have a whiteboard that they ask you to add your name to since the entrance isn't large enough for a group of people to wait to be seated. The waitress was nice but the food was ok. The shrimp and catfish that we ordered spicy came out with basically seasoning dumped on top. While I enjoy my food being seasoned it was clear that it was not marinated or cooked together it was just dumped on top after it was done being cooked. We both ended up with stomachaches. My suggestion go to Peaches lol NOT  Peaches Hothouse...

The spicy fried chicken sandwich here is OK, but pretty bare bones.  I don't see any reason to really go out of your way for it but if you're in the neighborhood it's a decent spot.
No comment

Absolutely the best soul food in Brooklyn. But one thing to keep in mind is that when they say the food is super spicy it is super SPICY. I wouldn't recommend the Mac and cheese because it was pretty bland but the chicken and the sat fish was really good.
No comment

Since I've been a regular at Peaches I decided to try Peaches HotHouse. It's a beautiful sunny Sunday so I went for lunch with my girlfriends. The only complaint I have is the fact that they don't have any signage to identify the establishment. The wait time for a table was about 40 minutes but it went fast. The restaurant is small and cozy. We eventually were seated at the bar, which was fine. It was just 3 of us. The bartender and wait staff were friendly and accommodating. This place is known for their chicken sandwich so my friend ordered it. We also ordered the jumbo shrimp sandwich and the catfish sandwich with a side of the collard greens. These sandwiches come in a spicy version but we all choose the regular option. The drink of choice was the Brownstone Punch. The sandwiches are on the big side and comes with your choice of regular or sweet potato fries.  Everything was delicious and that rum punch was it!! I need to take a nap lol Anyway, if you're in the area I would definitely recommend you stop in for a bite. They also have outside seating. Enjoy

Peaches never misses! I went here one Friday after work with coworkers and we enjoyed it. The highlight of our experience was our waiter Steven who's shift was unfortunately over before we could pay the bill and tip him appropriately. He was sweet and attentive! My party of 6 had the fried chicken, salad, fried tomatoes, sweet potato fries, mac and cheese and cornbread. I had my meal with a Sister Rosetta drink which is like their version of a rum punch. 10/10 I definitely recommend!

I walked into the restaurant and was pleasantly surprised. The servers were blasting gospel and dancing. Everyone's plates had large portions of food. My husband ordered the spicy fried catfish and I ordered the fried chicken. We also ordered mac and cheese and collard greens as sides and fried green tomatoes as our appetizer. This was actually my first time ever having fried green tomatoes and it was really tasty. Pairing it with the pickled onions and aioli was perfect. When it came to the entree, I wish I had ordered the fried chicken with spicy seasoning. I had some of the spicy fried fish and it was like a punch to the mouth! Full of flavor and heat, but not too overwhelming. Don't get me wrong, without the spice the fried chicken was still crispy, moist, and delicious. The mac and cheese though?? SO good! Perfect mix of creamy and cheesy. I wish the sides were bigger! I enjoyed the entire experience at Peaches. The music and overall vibe was inviting, the servers had great energy and customer service, and the food was great. I will be back.
No comment

I was in town for a bachelorette party and needed a place for a quick bite to eat before my departing flight. Peaches hot house was in walking distance so a friend and I headed over. The food and service was very good. I got the hot chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries. The chicken was juicy, flavorful, and seasoned to perfection. The seeet potato fries were crisp and tasty. My only complaints are the resturant is VERY small and tight and I ordered a lemonade which the waitress told me they make inhouse to use for bar drinks. It wasn't very good. Tasted like bland lemon water. She did replace it with a canned drink. Overall I highly recommend peaches hot house for a quick lunch bite
No comment

Meh. I give it 2 stars for the Mac n cheese alone which was good, but you do not go to a fried chicken restaurant simply for the Mac and cheese. The servers there just gave us the food and did not follow up to see if we needed any other assistance. Fried chicken was over cooked, too crispy and dry. I did not say that I wanted dark meat, which I prefer, and so they proceeded to give me mostly white meat. Cornbread was also dry and crumbled to the touch. Not to mention there were other customers that were extremely loud in there which made us uncomfortable. I would pass on this one.

The worst Soul Food in Brooklyn. I ordered Today 04/02/22 Fried Chicken that was Luke Warm and Cold Mac & Cheese, Bitter Collard Greens. Cornbread crumbled to the touch. Wasn't worth $40.00 spent. Drive by this joint!
Food and drinks were awesome . Had the shrimp and grits even though it's not on menu . Amazing ! Will be back every time i visit NYC!
No comment
No comment
Their hot chicken is legit spicy! The chicken sandwich is fantastic and def worth a spot on the junk food rotation.

Really enjoyed this place. Pleasant environment and really good food. I ordered the fried chicken and French toast. The bread on the French toast was coated in what I believe is oatmeal crumb adding a very nice accent when eaten with the chicken and syrup. All in all it was a great experience and the wait wasn't to bad either.

I had the spiciest chicken they offered. To be honest, it was not that spicy. So don't be too cautious here. It was definitely most delicious! Also tried the fried green tomatoes, which were really good with just the right amount of breading to tomato ratio. Cornbread was a bit as well.
Love the food. Service is good too. It's a bit cramped from time to time, but it still feels really great when you get seated and get your food.

Lovely service, lovely food. The waitress Addy, is very sweet and always attentive when we need something a bit extra during our stay. I've been there so many times already that it's a regular spot for me and my family.

Food was good but the service was not. It took an hour for food to come out and we watched at least 5 groups come in after us and order food similar to our order, receive food, eat and pay before ours came out.

I got a table for two really quickly. Ordered the shrimp and grits, which I really enjoyed. I appreciated the bits of greens on the dish but the shrimp were bland. I would recommend this place for brunch/lunch.

A hidden gem in the neighborhood. This place is amazing, the staff are very professional and courteous. The food and drinks are amazing. I had the Jim Cade Breakfast their French toast was different as it's made with Granola giving it an extra sweet taste. It comes with Fried potatoes, eggs however you like and bacon. I love me some bacon, my wife and I went here for a quick sit down date and to talk. I'll definitely be returning to this establishment. Hopefully they take my recommendation and make the Jim Cade Deluxe special.
Their food is simply delicious! Everything! There is  a reason they have been in business for so many years and have several locations. Nothing more needed to be said!
No comment
Butter Pound Cake.. Out of this World.. I loved this.. ordered to bring home so glad I did!

Came here couple times before COVID and once for outdoor dining last month in COVID time. There are closed outdoor tents or booths, we opted for just the outdoor tables alone. Only complaint is our table is directly on the sidewalk, it felt as if people were walking on top of us and breathing on top of our food. All experiences overall pretty solid otherwise. Their drinks are strong and fair priced, the brownstone punch is a favorite. Shrimp sandwich is my go to, they also have nice sides like super garlic and tasty broccoli and Brussel sprouts depending on season for vegetarians.
No comment

For years I have seen this place, I finally went on a date and came here the food was GOOD AF it had flavor and I never order salmon but omg it was so good. I had to come back with mom n sis for my sisters graduation dinner and they enjoyed it too.
Love this spot. My niece put us on. She eats out all the time. My family supported me after I got baptized. We had brunch. Everything was delicious. Highly recommend
No comment

No comment
I'm kind with this 1 star. Hope it get better soon and for those who like it, more power to you.
Best chicken in BK, the collards are a meal and the cornbread. Wow. Just wow. Only think missing was Maroon Suasage

There's an art and a science in the creation of perfectly fried chicken - and they have mastered it here. Their batter and fry method makes for a perfectly crispy, but not greasy or overly thick, sandwich or platter.  The chicken and shrimp share this treatment and are equally delicious.  Cole Slaw = winner, as is the Mac & Cheese.  Wait staff is delightful.

No comment
Super fast service all while the food still being hot. Really amazing 90s hip hop and r&b playing in the back. The staff was extremely friendly. Came here on a whim and I'm so glad I did.
Always great - my favorite spicy chicken sandwich in Brooklyn  I usually order to pick up but the space itself is awesome too
Been going here for a few years now and it's amazing! They have great Mac and spicy chicken. They usually always have a wait if you go on weekends. They usually have people waiting for them to open!
Great place small and quaint with fish and chicken selections. Service was great fast and very attentive. I am so going back!
No comment
The best place ever, blueberry compote chicken and waffles is my favorite thing on the menu, and their homemade drinks are the absolute best

If you're looking for soul food without the soul, then this is your spot. My girlfriend found a hair in her food. They kindly comped her meal, but everything tasted, as if seasoning was not a thing. It also didn't help the location only had a handful of table salts and one black pepper.

Absolute best vibe! The service, the food & the overall ambient vibe just makes this place the perfect spot for any occasion! The owners are super friendly and make you feel right at home and the waiters are so attentive and really add to a wonderful experience. The menu for food and drinks is so different to anything you'll find anywhere in Pretoria, if I could give a higher rating I would!
No comment

I went during my trip and got the chicken and toast. absolutely delicious and came with maple syrup and blueberries. Customer service was also amazing and multiple team members checked on us to make sure we were good. Would definitely go again!
Delicious - Chicken was fried a beautiful color and juicy.  The greens, macaroni and cornbread made this meal a tasty treat.
Food and drinks are good! Love the brunch vibe here. Highly recommend! Come have a good time with your girls, family or Bae.. you won't regret it!
Good food ... good vibes. I had the gumbo, wings, breakfast and shrimp and grits.. all were great.

Took the family here and it was wonderful. The location is great. The service was handled well as there were a lot of us. The food was exquisite, was served well & hot. EVERYONE loved their dish. We even ordered some dishes to go. And this was our 2nd time here & the service & food hasn't declined one bit. It improved.  Excellent!!

No comment
Great soul food. Small neighborhood eats. Family oriented. The restaurant is also a great brunch spot on the weekends. Get there early so you wait isn't long.
No comment
This is a great place to have nice southern flare to the food. The catfish and grits is my go to here and it is solid. It is well seasoned. I also love the Mac N cheese. I am a regular here!

Saturday, October 8, I went with my mother. She ordered the regular fried chicken, and I ordered coffee, mac & cheese, and the hot honey chicken. The coffee was good. The server was kind enough to explain to my mother that she might want the cayenne pepper on the side; no explanation was given to me. Although the menu online specifies honey-smoked-ghost-chili-pepper sauce, this was not on the menu given in the restaurant. When I did not eat my entree, I asked the server how much cayenne pepper was put in the honey, and she replied "Oh, that's the ghost-chili-pepper sauce." I responded that it wasn't written nor conveyed. Her response: "Oh, I guess it should be." She did not offer to bring me anything else or comp my bill. Clearly, the cost of that meal was more important that retaining a customer.
No comment

Went in on a cold Saturday night with my husband & our two kids. Host was kind enough to call us when our table was ready, so we didn't have to wait outside in the cold. We started with the fried green tomatoes which were great! (Highly recommended!) We shared the chicken sandwich, fries, fried chicken, Mac & cheese & corn bread. (We had the extra hot dry seasoning on the side, since we were sharing with our kids). Everything was flavorful & perfectly cooked! Will def be back!
The chicken in the "chicken sandwich" is a piece of boneless, rubbery thigh, with the slimy skin still attached to it.  DISGUSTING! The fries were cold and soggy. The Mac & Cheese was aight.

Really enjoyed the short rib & grits. And the fried chicken. The place is kind of small so you may want to go when it's not peak lunch hour.

Absolutely delicious! Brilliantly, they have a limited menu which allows for piping hot food that comes to your table in minutes. Drinks are amazing too! I recommend this place to anyone who loves some good old fashioned country food.  Sooooo good!

We came here for my sisters birthday. This was a summer ending night so the weather was good. We reached and was shocked that it wasn't  a dine in spot. It's actually a grab and go with some seats and tables surrounding it. If you plan on coming here for your birthday it's way to casual. We decided to just grab a table outside and eat. The area isn't somewhere I'd sit again honestly. A lot of panhandling. Kind of scary. But overall the food was great. Chicken fried fresh and spicy. I'll come back but just legit grab and go. Or on drunk night to blend in with the neighborhood.
Great food. Ethical owners. Lover of spicy food will love it. Always get dark meat, juicier

Seriously the best hot chicken outside of Nashville! Even the regular is HOT and I'm totally ok with that! I love Peaches and if I could I would be here everyday but would probably need to run a triathlon every other day! Everything I've had has always been nothing but delicious. Their take on shrimp n grits is nothing I've seen before. They have these unbelievably sinful fried squares filled with grits and barbecue shrimp and I just can't get enough of this dish! Fried green tomatoes are out of this world! They are always a must when getting an order from PHH. Their sides are also great which compliments the chicken so well. The collard greens and Mac n cheese are my favorite!
Definitely a must try! The chicken sandwich was delicious, juicy and hot! Maybe I'll try getting it extra hot next time! Mac n Cheese was super good too.
incredible chicken, mac and cheese, and cornbread!! i love their spicy chicken sandwich and the entire staff is so friendly.

Sorry. No pictures. I totally forgot because my food was soooo good I just ate it. Loved this place. Service was wonderful. And the food. Got the fried green tomatoes and the chicken sandwich with a side of Mac n cheese. My daughter got the catfish and the grits. We both loved our food! That slaw though. Wow! So good!
They don't do reservations--add your name to the whiteboard upon arrival. The food is worth the wait.
No comment

Small soul food restaurant. There's normally a wait so pack your patience, they lost a star because on my part visit we were waiting on a table for 4, the waitress never asked if we were willing to sit separately. 5 groups of 2 sat and had dinner before we did. The chicken, fish and sandwiches are really good. The sides aren't great but they are a good compliment to the main course. They also have a bar and are right next door to another full bar if you need a place to hang out as you wait for your table.

Consistent comfort food! Food has always been on point. No matter what you get, the formula here is efficient and beyond satisfactory. Portions are just right! I've only eaten here three times but haven't been disappointed yet. Quick service is another great thing about this place. 5/5
No comment

Here's the ld. Mac and cheese was cold and the cheese coagulate. This clumpy texture and cold taste was very unappetizing. Had the fried chicken sandwich, although not the best it was extremely crispy which I liked but at the same time didn't because it was a bit too hard. The chicken itself wasn't moist but not dry either (except for when I had to reheat my left overs).  I tried my friends chicken dish and we had the same comment "why put seasoning on the top of the finished product?" Overall it's way better than the other peaches but not by much. It's worth munching on some fries if you are a local.
No comment

It's a vibe for Sunday brunch. Come hungry. Don't forget to have a cocktail with your food as well. Classic African American food with a twist. Reservations are recommended as this place is crowded all weekend long.
No comment
The customer service is not all that advertising very limited on food supply I wanted to order a crab Burger couldn't get it food overall pretty decent though
No comment
The wait can be a bit long sometimes. However the food is phenomenal and the service is great. I would recommend this place to anyone.

This is a busy place and intimate restaurant. The staff are friendly and were helpful. I ordered the shrimp and grits and the grits were very creamy and had great flavor. The shrimpy with the vegetables were nice as well. There was a nice balance of the shrimp with the vegetables. Filling dish but didn't feel heavy. I would recommend this place.

Amazing fried chicken in a little restaurant in bedstuy. I am a true lover of spicy food... & fried chicken in any form. So this place was a dream. To top it off their drinks were great, I got the bourbon sweet tea & wow so good, exactly what you want with the hot chicken. I got the regular level of spice & it was good, definitely has a kick, but I am excited to try the extra spicy next time I'm in. The place is small so expect a wait, we were just two people & were able to get a seat at the bar pretty quickly.
No comment
No comment
Possibly the best breakfast I've ever had in nyc in 12 years of living here. Seriously incredibly good.
No comment
No comment

Amazing Delectable Scrumptious! The flavors were all there (as with any Peaches restaurant)! I am never disappointed with dining at any of these locations. Any dish I am confident in trying without a blink. From their drinks to their food menu, it'll take your taste buds on a wowing trip. Not to mention, the service is superb. On this specific visit, we ordered the fried shrimp & fried (hot &spicy) catfish with the sides: mac & cheese, spicy broccoli and collar greens. Every bite was mouth watering enough you couldn't wait for the next one. The spice on the catfish was just enough to flavor the underneath well seasoned fish. It paired well. The mac & cheese is just your favorite southern side dish as it should be, CHEESE IN ALL THE RIGHT PLACES! The collard greens were smoked to perfection, tasting the meat with every bite and the broccoli was not your average. I ordered the watermelon frose for my drink, and it was the perfect "I'll give you a buzz" to a sweet delight with my entree. I will be coming back!
No comment
By far the best southern food in NYC. Definitely get the Mac and Cheese - it easily holds up to the mac and cheeses you'd get in the South (FL, GA, AL).
No comment
No comment

Decent fried chicken, but it is *not* Nashville hot chicken - there's no spicy oil that the chicken is dunked in which is what defines the food, and the heat level doesn't come anywhere within the realm of Hattie B's. Extremely disappointing.
Delicious food. They were very accommodating when I needed a last minute catering order. I was so pleased by how good everything was. Can't wait to try more things here.
Peaches HotHouse has one of the best fried chicken sandwiches I've had in my life. The chicken is so crispy and juicy! It's topped with a tasty orange sauce and tangy red slaw. Highly recommend!

I used to go to the Peaches off Lewis for their extensive menu - I now go to the HotHouse on Tompkins because of the love they put into their food and service. Our server not only accommodated our vegan diner immaculately, the food was prepared quickly with a full house as they were knocking out a large amount of pickup/delivery orders (it makes sense why locals order take-out from here often). I commend anyone who can remain calm and collected within chaotic environments and their team does just that!

The best cornmeal crusted catfish...ever. I mean, EVER! Perfectly seasoned, crunchy outside, moist outside. Huge portion.
No comment
No comment

Mostly vegetarian but got a hankering for fried chicken out of nowhere. My usual (very rare) indulgence of this genre is Bob White in Alphabet City (dear God they are good across the board just not as accessible). Ordered the hot honey special and was transported to God-level. The sides were a disappointment but who cares, you go for the chicken.

We stumbled onto the patio! We were pleased to be seated right away! There was seating for 4 and they were very accommodating to our children! We ordered catfish, Mac and cheese, collard greens, fried green tomatoes, spicy grilled broccoli, and fries. We also had a brownstone punch. All the food was delicious with some slight spice so keep that mind for children. The spice is available on the side! The punch was great just like a rum punch! I'd recommend this place for a night out with friends or family!
The food here was bleh  but I did order takeout by the time it came the fried catfish was soggy the fries were soggy so my delivery experience was not very good.

No comment
Though hard to get a table, it's worth the wait! Great food portions and food is truly delicious
5/5. Best food you'll ever have.  Just try it and thank me later. You won't regret it
Drinks were strong! Chicken was crispy and juicy! Service was great and the mac and cheese was to die for. Can't wait to come back soon, highly recommended

My friend and I stopped here to get take out. We ordered the impossible burger and Mac and cheese with grits. The food was really good. No complaints on anything. Can't wait to try more food on the menu

An update to my original review. Kudos to Peaches Hot House for being available for home delivery. The chicken still delicious, and my lips still tingling after having my favorite extra hot fried chicken. Thank you Peaches Hot House!
Definition of "Hole in the wall". Food is delicious. Drinks are mason jar amazing. Staff is super friendly. Just loved it.

Ordered food to go. Wings were saucy but over cooked and dry. The white sauce was like a thick and flavorless mayo. The chicken sandwich was ok, but nothing to write about. the BBQ fries were surprisingly the only good thing we ordered. I would only go back here IF i were in the area and it would only be for the bbq fries. If you want soul food, this ain't it.
No comment
No comment

This is my second time eating at Peaches, the first time was pre-pandemic. The chicken sandwich was as juicy as ever, all their chicken is! Sweet servers and decent outside seating. My friends and I loved everything we ordered, including the fried catfish sandwich, chicken sandwich, hot fried chicken and original fried chicken, and the sides of fries, cornbread and Mac n cheese. Their drinks are nice too!
No comment
No comment

I visited this location in the middle  of the week..August 2021. So this is a late post. It was still summer so I was comfortable sitting outside. I did go inside  briefly  but it was a small amd quaint space with a bar top area I recall. Wait staff was polite. I ordered the Jim Cade breakfast with the scrambled eggs, bacon,  and French toast.  It was a huge portion so you will be satisfied.  Everything was tasty. My favorite  item was my drink. Whewww chile!!! It was a rum punch  of some sort. It definitely hit the spot and I was tipsy. Very delicious  and actually had the liquor it claimed to have in it. There's nothing I hate more than an alcoholic beverage without alcohol in it.   I  can't find the pics I took that day to give better visuals but it was all a pleasant experience. You won't be disappointed.  I would go back as well as visit the other locations. Advice: if you are going on the weekends, go early.  Its gets packed and I don't know if they take reservations.

We live nearby and come here regularly. Excellent fried chicken to be sure (whole family asks for it way more than we actually eat it, which says something). The other sandwiches, shrimp and fish in particular, are in my opinion just as good, particularly with the sides and dressings. I am salivating at the thought just writing this.

Ordered a chicken sandwich via DoorDash. I was eating the sandwich and about halfway through it tasted weird and rubbery. The sandwich was raw in the middle. I love supporting small businesses, especially Black owned. Thus, I wanted to just send them a message privately. However, after politely messaging them, no response was given. I was left on "read" by whoever runs their Instagram account. I'm so disappointed.

Came in on New Year's day. The bartender/waiter was helpful, and very attentive. I got fried chicken, collard greens, corn bread and macaroni and cheese. I am very picky with my soul food and everything met my standards. Will deff be back!
No comment

This place has been on my list for ages and I finally made it out. The fried chicken and Mac and cheese is excellent, as are the mashed potatoes. Easy to get a table on a weeknight and the atmosphere is very chill. Prices are good too.
No comment
No comment
Awesome spot to eat, I had the best chicken sandwich ever, Mac n Cheese, and the spicy broccoli. Everything tasted great, and the staff was really friendly. I would definitely go here again.
No comment
No comment

Their food is bangin'! We ordered the catfish and shrimp house specialities, one with the standard salad and for the other we substituted in the grilled broccoli -- it was all exceptional. Our waiter was helpful, attentive and genuinely enjoyable to chat and banter with. Would go back in a heartbeat
No comment
Get the loaded grits ! Best juicy crispy fried chicken ! If your not good with spice go with regular fried chicken , it's still got a little kick !

I had one of the nicest lunches ever, here.  I was walking the neighborhood on a beautiful day and saw some open seats.  I was greeted warmly by a lovely waitress who let me seat anywhere.  She even brought out a bowl of water for my dog.  I ordered the cat fish sandwich with a side salad and it was pure perfection.  Just the right size, flavor, crispness.  The salad dressing was so good, too. I wish I could find out the recipe.  The prices were very reasonable as well. I will definitely be back.

column3: Rolling Hills Ranch, Chula Vista, CA
column6: We got here at 2:40-2:45 there was open seating but didn't get seated until 3:40 it is currently 3:53 and we have yet to put our order in. Will update when the food comes out which could be next year

My local spot for connecting with my friends. Great menu and hard to decide, so share your plates--friendly and helpful staff.
No comment

Came here for breakfast with friends, ordered one thing didn't realize that I got something different. Waited an hour + to sit inside with 4 adults and 1 kid. I wasn't told to get the chicken but everyone else did, the breakfast was okay. The French toast was thick but yummy. My husband got the mild chicken and his tongue went numb so if you don't do spicy stick with regular crunchy chicken. The sweet tea was good and for all of us the bill was about $90.00 without tip just FYI.
No comment
By far one of my fav spots to visit!, the fried chicken will always be my staple go to every time!.
EXCELLENT- had the blackened catfish with the Grids side salad and cornbread - even better than my grandma cooking

Went to peaches on a whim because I was craving fried chicken, and I'm pleased to report that this place did not disappoint. There's minimal decor and a very plain ambiance, but with southern food that delicious I guess they don't need to worry about anything else! The fried chicken is simple but great!

Customer service was  great .Got seated pretty quickly.A very nice scenery with great food .Everything came on time and was very delicious definitely going again

The hype about this place is crazy. Bland mac and cheese. Fried chicken is regular. Nothing special
