No comment
What a fun experience. There are several food vendors and you can get anything you want and bring it up to the roof to eat. Must try - everyone can get exactly what they want!

This market is such a great spot to visit when in Brooklyn. They have a variety of restaurants to choose from and local small business you can support. They sell arts and crafts, candles, clothes, so many beautiful things!

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

The variety of incredible options in such a nice space close to so much happening makes this an absolute winner. Classics like Jacob's pickles and sugar hill creamery as well as less known options ranging from Thai to street Indian. Lots of seating options too

Boy do I wish we lived closer to time out market or at least there was a Chote Miya in New Jersey. The atmosphere and location are spectacular and so is the choice of food you can pick from. Sandra and the girls had pasta dishes that were all reasonably priced and all delicious. I ordered from Chote Miya and so glad I did. The chili fried cauliflower is spectacular. The flavor and perfect amount of heat is incredible. The chicken khurchan is also delicious. Perfect amount of heat and flavor. They fry/cook mint leaves-OMG so good. Overall it's a very clean place with very friendly people working there and plenty of options that are priced reasonably for what and where it is. We had a great time and will definitely be back. Get there. Enjoy
No comment

Super cute food market in Brooklyn with lots of options. Was disappointed that the main reason we went (Bark BBQ) was sold out for the day but was able to enjoy a few other vendors. They have options for any palate. They offered many American, Indian, Ramen, vegan and Thai cuisine. I did wish to see more dessert options as when I went on a Saturday night, they only had one dessert option open, but can't complain because the cannoli's were amazing. They also have one of my favorite restaurants in there, Jacobs Pickles. The lines can be long, but they move fast.
No comment
No comment

This is my go to spot when I am in Brooklyn as there are a lot of options and so many seatings every time I go! It's a little pricey for what it's worth, but that also is just typical New York. Would love to try th other vendors in this place! It's also so nice to be able to just walk around or go upstairs to hear live music/the views (:
No comment
No comment
No comment

I recently had lunch at Tie Out Market New York with breathtaking views of the waterfront. PAT LAFRIEDA dish I had was cooked to perfection and served with their premium prime cuts. The service was friendly and attentive, making for a relaxing atmosphere. The stunning scenery made the meal even more memorable. Overall, highly recommended for a delicious meal with a view.

Great spot to spend an afternoon. So many different food options to choose from. I would compare this to a much smaller version of Chelsea market with more seating options. Communal seating is setup throughout the market and on a nice day the rooftop would be the perfect spot to hang out. I dined at Fornino Pizza and ordered the Calabrese Pizza. Pizza was tasty and made with fresh ingredients! Would love to go back and try more restaurants. Honestly one could spend breakfast until dinner here. Highly recommend checking this place out. Tip: Evil Twin Brewery is a few minutes walk away. Make a day of it and explore more spots in Dumbo!
No comment
No comment

There are things I like and hate about the market. It's overcrowded beyond belief. Or at least when I came in this past Saturday afternoon. But there also was a holiday market going on as well as the World Cup so maybe that had some factor. Everything is a little bit over-priced. It's hard to figure out what you're getting the most bang for your buck but I guess if you circle enough times you'll find something worth indulging in. I didn't check out the roof top but I'm sure the views are worth it. It was pouring rain and I hastily ordered my food to dine in on china-ware so I figured out the hard way that you can't bring glass up to the roof when trying to meet my friend. Anyway, I ended up getting Jacob's Pickles' buffalo mac and cheese for $15 plus tax plus a heavily insistent that I tip, even though it's self serve. Oh well. I was torn between that and a ramen spot because that seemed like a hefty portion for $20-ish dollars and a great day for a huge bowl of it. But the portion size for the buffalo mac was hearty and huge. Enough so that I saved about half for today's lunch. My friend tried Bark Bbq that's brand new. I trust people with how delicious the bbq is but man are the portions small for how much you spend. She ended up getting 2 ribs, a piece of cornbread, and like 3 or 4 plantains for $21 or $22. Everything she said tasted great but maybe not the price tag. Ended our meal with Sugar Hill Creamery. They let us sample a few flavors before deciding. I went with the Harlem Sweeties which was a salted caramel ice cream with butterscotch and brownies and the other flavor I got was the peppermint bark ice cream cake. Man, both were great. They also serve your ice cream in a legitimate huge ass cone that doesn't cost extra. We will have none of those garbage tasting cones nonsense. Thank you. Giving Ample Hills a run for their money. It's convenient for having tons of options if you're with folks that don't want to eat at the same spot but seating is really hard to knab. Got to be at the right time and place and I guess that makes me a deer in headlights and annoys me. Dumbo desperately needed this though because it's been destitute of good bars and spots to eat for awhile.

Very nice place with plenty of space to sit. If you get take out you can even go up to the rooftop park (not bar) & eat with a view! Love that you have access all the well known restaurants in one place. Great for those visiting New York. For those from NY, the prices here in my opinion is too much & with limited options. For me I got three Al Pastor tacos with a lemonade from Ivy Stark Mexology & that came out to be $25. Travel down to Sunset Park on the N and you'll have more delicious authentic tacos for 1/4 the price. My husband got 2 small sliders also for $20 (no drinks, no sides). It was good, but not worth the price good. Otherwise, very trendy place. Will visit at least a year later when I'm feeling rich $$$ .

Really cute market with a lot of different cuisine options! I specifically tried some wings from the Thai place as well as the garlic tonkonstu ramen. They both tasted good but they both didn't really stand out in any way. The ramen was very good and it was a decent portion - I liked the broth and texture of the noodles. As for the wings, I wasn't really expecting the flavor but it was still good and it was very crispy. Overall, I'm glad I was able to finally try some of the food from the market. I also ended up getting a prickly pear lemonade - not my favorite because I didn't really taste the pear and it was too tarty for me, but it did come in a pouch which was cool!
No comment
It's very cool nice food court and rooftop which has a stunning view! The food is good but pretty pricey. Also there were so many people there!

Such a great spot to eat at in the area. There are multiple restaurants sharing the building and there is something for everyone. A bonus is the rooftop which has an amazing view. We tried Wayla and were very satisfied, I especially liked their shrimp chips and thai tea, would definitely recommend.

We stopped by Time Out Market for breakfast and coffee when we were in NYC/Brooklyn for a long weekend a few weeks ago. While it's not the best spot for breakfast (only two vendors open early enough for breakfast), it's a great spot for later in the day. Tons of vendors: Clinton St. Baking Company, Little Neck Raw Bar, Pat LaFrieda Meat Purveyors, Fornino, Sugar Hill Creamery, Bubusan, Jacob's Pickles, and on and on... We got bagels from Ess-a-Bagel and took them outside. And that's really the highlight of Time Out Market - the view!!! There are lots of outside tables (and apparently a rooftop, although we didn't make it there) - and the view of the East River and the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges is fantastic. It's a great market. Stop by if you're in the area, try some of the food or get drinks at the bar, and check out out the great location and view.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite spots in the city. Brooklyn Bridge Park is a gorgeous area with cobble stone streets and incredible views. Time Out Market is conveniently located right in the middle. Amazing food, drinks, views and free wifi Time Out has it all. Don't forget to checkout the rooftop for more seating and restaurant options with better views or go for drinks at sunset.
No comment
No comment

I love that the market is located on the shores of downtown Brooklyn right along cobble-stones streets with a beautiful view of the water. The market offers a wide variety of food options including Thai, sandwiches, burgers, Indian, salads, and more. While there is seating scattered throughout the market, it may need to be expanded a bit more for those crowded days. I had a cheesesteak from Par LaFrieda and thoroughly enjoyed it, and was even quite full off of it. Overall a nice place and a good time.

We arrived hungry after walking over the Brooklyn Bridge. We decided to eat at the Clinton Street Baking Co. We waited about 20 min since we arrived before opening hours and we were not disappointed. I had the seasonal apple waffle and it was phenomenal. My mom had the brioche French toast which was equally delicious and we shared a side of bacon. My only disappointment was the specialty coffees could not be made due to an issue with a machine. I opted for earl grey tea and it was good. I would definitely go back!
No comment
No comment

Such a great market. Walked over the Brooklyn Bridge and in a very short walk came to Timeout Market. I grabbed a bagel and went up to the top floor to get another amazing view of the bridges. Can't wait to go back and try more drinks and food.
Amazing area, I loved it I took a ton of pictures, I lucked out with parking, I won't tell my secret. Definitely need to visit again with a friend.
Finally walked over the Brooklyn Bridge and came in here for lunch! There are are a lot of shops and options for food and drinks. Seating is limited so get there early.
No comment

Super cool food hall! I wish we had more time and bellies to try so much more of the foods. There are so many options to choose from and such a wide variety of different types of foods - sushi, chicken, thai, pizzas, bagels, etc. We loved the upstairs area where there's a full bar that made very pretty drinks. It's such a good place to hang out, super good vibes. While we were there, there was a performance with Brazilian dancers and that was really fun. The upstairs rooftop gives a great view of the bridges and the waterfront of NYC.

I love the markets in nyc bc it's a nice way to experience lots of different kinds of foods from top restaurants in a really cool environment! This market is right next to the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges so the view can't be beat. I wish there were more restaurants but the ones that are there are great! We loved our Ess a bagel especially the most!

Really cool concept! It's basically a food hall that was curated by Time Out NY to bring together some of their top rated food spots in the city. I always love stopping by here when I'm in the area. Easy to bring a group and all get different foods. They also have a cool rooftop upstairs with outdoor seating
No comment

Indoor food market with a big variety of food vendors, both on the first floor and rooftop!! Types of food range from Thai, to Indian, to Italian, to American, to anything and everything in between. I like that most of the food vendors have a display case on the end of their stations to display popular items on the menu. Definitely try out this food hall- it's a lot like Chelsea Market, but way less packed!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great hide away with a warm and inviting atmosphere and a wide selection of food vendors.

While in Dumbo, we were starving after sightseeing and found Time Out Market. My son wanted Mexican food and so we chose Ivy Stark Mexology. My son got carnitas tacos that were delicious and I got an amazing chicken salad! And the prickly pear lemonade was so good! The market and some great options, something for everyone!
Loved the atmosphere here! The great food was a plus. I found most of the places to be a little pricey but was expected.
No comment
This place is huge! I liked it more than Time Out in Chicago. I got a salad at the Mediterranean place. It really hit the spot!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Spacious food hall in Brooklyn, right by the Brooklyn bridge and DUMBO area. Lots of stalls inside and plenty of seating. Make sure to visit the rooftop which has stunning views of the city and bridge. Food is a bit pricey for the portion sizes, so be prepared to spend about the same as you would at a restaurant. Ordered the Paneer Khurchan at Chote Miya. The paneer was very tender, loved the flavors in it! Quite spicy as well. It was a bit pricey though for the portions.
Crowded and overpriced.  Went last Sunday at 1130 ver crowded and too cold to eat outside.  Ended up walking another block and getting excellent Pizza at a quarter of the price

I thought it was so great!  The view is beautiful.  Additionally they had Irish Dancing by the Brooklyn Irish Dance Company perform for free for one hour.  It was very professional and well organized.  The place is clean and well kept.  Would recommend the place mostly to tourists but really just anyone for a relaxing few hours.
Great variety of food options, ambiance is intimate and elegant -- a feature not seen often in food courts. Highly recommend Time Out when you're in the Dumbo area!
Very crowded. Understaffed food vendors. Long lines. Gave up ordering anything due to long waits. Many food vendors had only one employee who both cooked and rang up the orders. Underwhelmed.

Ate a honey glazed chicken biscuit sandwich and Mac n Cheese at Jacob's Pickles. Food was delicious, portions were huge, and wait was not too bad. We were able to find a seat fairly easily, and then explore the roof top at night. Definitely recommend this place for a fun, cheap thing to do for tourists and locals !

Wait a minute? Where have I been? Ohhh, inside.. COVID . The last time I was in this area, this did not exist. Time Out has an array of eateries all under one roof. There's some restaurants on the main level and then there's others upstairs. I walked around and there is a lot of variety. I saw a burgers and fries, chicken places, pasta place, pizza, ice cream, Asian food, Mexican food and a bunch of choices. I settled on Thai food and my friend got a vegan bowl. My plate was about $20 and I gave a tip. So my bowl of noodles ended up being $26. I went on a Friday and it was very crowded. A lot of people were inside and outside along the water line looking at the bridge and taking photos. They also a lot of people upstairs on the roof deck area. There's also a carousel near. There was a wedding party taking a wedding photos there. It is a cool outing to get some food and also to take in some of the visual delights. Just be prepared to open up your pocketbook a little bit wider than you normally would.
So many options to choose from! I had the pork belly bun in the ramen place. Great food great view but too many people
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Awesome place, so many selections with a lot of vegan options.. highly recommend.. no need to go to a fancy restaurant..
Porsha at Dough is AMAZING! She dealt with me being indecisive for nearly 20 minutes and helped so much

Great views and selection of restaurants. There's also a rooftop bar with amazing views of Brooklyn/Manhattan bridge. Definitely a great spot to spend the afternoon to eat, drink and hangout. Food prices are tad bit on the expensive side.
No comment

A bustling food spot for bustling New York. Filled with tiny stores giving a taste teasers for New York has to offer in terms of food, energy, and happiness. We tried the bao buns and they were incredible.
Lots of restaurant choices. You can eat everything from Mexican, Italian, Japanese and more. They also have beer and a nice view if you go on their rooftop.
Great views and great selection of restaurants. I tried the oysters, Indian place, Arab Latin place, sushi and ice cream. Be prepared to spend a lot of $$$$$!
Very upbeat place with great drinks!! Live music, beautiful sunset view, and some nice NYC lights
No comment

Absolutely loved this place! Such a good place to get something to eat if you're not sure what you even want to eat, or with someone who wants something else than you! Such a great vibe to even walk around & see amazing views of the Brooklyn Bridge!

I love this place!! It's a multistory market that over looks brooklyn bridge park and the Ferris wheel. We came on a Sunday and it was kinda packed but worth it! We went upstairs to grab drinks from the bar and go out on the rooftop and found that we arrived just in time to enjoy a live band perform. They have an awesome seating area upstairs with large windows that look out toward the city skyline, East river and bk bridge. It's sooo beautiful and it was such a nice vibe. This place is especially awesome in the summer when you can enjoy the rooftop outside and then come back in when it gets too hot (instead of sweating in the park for a picnic ... been there.. not it). Can't wait to come back here!

Man oh man the pancakes are a must! I mean a must, so fluffy and delicious. They egg scramble was good but the hash browns were a bit hard. The wait was a little long but the pancakes will get me every time.
No comment
such a fun spot to grab food and hang out! all of the staff were so helpful and friendly
No comment
No comment

This place feels kinda touristy, and it might be a little over-priced, but the views are very much worth it! I recommend taking a trip to the top floor, where you can overlook the Brooklyn Bridge! There is also a bar and adequate seating, although on a weekend you should get there early if you want a nice spot outside. The downstairs operates as a huge food court, which a variety of shops featuring food by local chefs. There are also a couple of bars and an ice cream spot. I opted for some Thai food--a curry-based bowl and a side of edamame. Delicious but also fairly pricey for being a food court. Overall I really recommend this place if you want great views but don't want to dine at a fancy sit-down restaurant. It's also great if everyone in your party wants something different to eat--so many options, like Italian, Thai, and BBQ, for example.
No comment

I love this market!! My favorite spot is Wayla. I recommend the goong Yang (shrimp skewers) and pad Thai. I was also really impressed with chote Miya. The samosa chaat was awesome as was the honey chili cauliflower. I can't wait to come back!
Went to Bubusan Sushi and it was delicious! The staff was very friendly. I would definitely come back.

Great place to spend a Saturday morning! You can grab some good food then visit all of the different vendors. There's a lot of jewelry and clothing vendors.  The outside terrace provides spectacular views of the bridge and water.  I would definitely recommend trying this spot out if you are in the neighborhood.
No comment

Loved the location in Miami therefore wanted to check out the one here in NYC. The drinks at the bar are to die for ! I had the Oaxaca Pasión, very fast for those who enjoy spicy. I just wished there was more lighting in there and that you can bring your drinks up to the rooftop but besides that pretty cool!

When I yelped this place I didn't notice it wasn't just one business. So that was a shocker. There are many businesses under one roof it really is like an adult cafeteria but super cute, with good food. There are seats upstairs in a roof top and down stairs. I am defiantly going back.

The Time Out Market has reopened and was well worth the wait.  My friend and I went to Clinton Street Baking Company as I love their pancakes.  I got the blueberry pancakes and he got the latkes with lox and eggs- surprisingly a delicious combo.  The portions are huge and priced reasonably.  The only downside was the lukewarm ridiculously small cup of OG.  Definitely check out both floors as occasionally they have events upstairs.  All in all, Time Out Market has great food options for everyone.

A food hall offering a variety of fare to choose from. A good variety of ethnic foods available including Italian, Indian, Thai, Japanese and Mexican. My main two choices to eat at were PAT LAFRIEDA MEAT PURVEYORS offering hamburgers and steak sandwiches or JACOB'S PICKLES offering southern comfort food. I changed my mind eating at one of those establishments feeling I would be stuffed with a meal and unable to eat anymore. I wanted to check out some other spots in Brooklyn too. So I was gonna get a dessert. DOUGH donuts were there and hell no I'm not buying another  $6 donut. LA BELLA FERRARA had a variety of cannolis but they were so miniscule for  $5 a pop. SUGAR HILL CREAMERY offered ice cream at a ridiculous price. So I left without eating anything. However, theTIME OUT MARKET is a good place to check out. I know there are locations in Miami and Boston supporting local vendors.

This is one of my favorite spots in the New York area! There's an amazing view of the water and city and just an amazing area. There's lots of variety in terms of food in the market including the best pancakes in the world. Love the vibes and be sure to eat outdoors so you don't miss the amazing view
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place was so fun to visit. There's so many different food options and make sure to go to the second floor. We ended up getting a crab fried rice at Wayla, and a mango lassi and chickpea curry at the Indian place a couple stalls down. All of the food was delicious, but I would say pricey. You're definitely paying for an experience. The place is nicely decked out for Halloween and there's lots to see around. It's right on the water and there's a merry go round for your kids. Fun experience overall!

The rooftop patio is a great place to grab a drink and watch the sun go down over the east river. Drinks were nice and well balanced and decently priced for a happy hour. The only prob you might have is finding a seat outside. It may take a minute but it's worth it
No comment

Trying out the Italian bakery La Bella Ferrara, we came to the one located inside crowded Time Out Market nearby the DUMBO. Got the peanut butter cannoli (covered in chocolate). Taste wise it had just enough hint of the peanut butter even though it was a bit too sweet for us. Breaking down the components, there were the peanut butter part, thick chocolate layer covering the cannoli and inside of it was this cream part. And the combination of them was too sweet for us. Texture wise, it was good: this bold crunchy and the hardened chocolate layer amplified the crunchiness adding a very contrast sensation when munched. But overall, it was not the best cannoli we had though.

If this place wasn't here my work lunch options would honestly be kind of tragic. Just the amount of variety present is noteworthy alone, but so far all the stands I've tried have had very good food as well! I love the stand that says Bombay to Brooklyn on it, biased as I may be because that's pretty much my hyper condensed biography, but the ramen and cheese steak stands were also great. Upstairs on the 5th floor is one of my favorite happy hour spots as well. The bar has some nice classy cocktails, as well as an amazing view of the waterfront from the outdoor area. The staff are super friendly and keep the place very clean. Highly recommend!
Average meal at Clinton's coffee was good. The atmosphere & proximity to the Brooklyn bridge & Dumbo is great

The place has a good variety of food but what makes it better is the outdoor rooftop amazing view towards the city and the bridges that connect them. Enjoyed the the view with my steak sandwich. Perfect spot for quick bite with a nice view.

I could've sworn I reviewed this spot, but apparently I forgot. We stopped by here on a warm, balmy May afternoon last year and got some tall, frosty sangrias to go. We imbibed on the spacious rooftop with gorgeous panoramic views of the Brooklyn Bridge and East River. There were so many puppies up on the roof--between them and the alcohol, it was one of the best summer NYC days I've had in a while (even if the sun was blistering).
No comment

Walked across the Brooklyn Bridge, and strolled some parks along the water. This serendipitous strolling allowed me to find this market and their Mexican stand. Which had absolutely fire prickly pear lemonade and chicken quesadillas.

We took the ferry from midtown Manhattan to rendezvous with family members at the DUMBO park carousel and playground. Time Out Market is conveniently  located nearby as a lunch spot. It boasts a large number of eateries offering many varieties of lunch food choices including Tacos, ramen, pasta, burgers, Thai and Indian. They all look so tempting; making it hard to decide even after walking around several times! There are plenty of tables/benches  either inside or outdoors in the surrounding areas. Two gripes: long line waiting for unisex restrooms and it's hard to find trash receptacles.
No comment

The Time Out Market was more than I expected! I can not recommend coming to spend some time at this gorgeous venue! My son and I enjoyed a bagel and scallion cream cheese at Essa-bagel, then split an order of pancakes and latkes fromClinton Street Baking Co. We saw so many rave reviews about the pancakes and though they were good, it just wasn't something I've never had before. The latkes on the other hand, we're outstanding!!!
Looking for a cool spot in the Dumbo area to grab a bite and a cocktail after your iconic IG pic ... this is the spot! A 3-5 minute walk from the iconic Brooklyn bridge infamous pic spot!
We really enjoyed.  Lots of choices on food options. Wonderful views and drinks !  Would definitely return.

We are at Clinton Street Review.  I had Ladtka Eggs Benedict & Brioche French toast w/ a side of smoked bacon & their refreshing lemonade on this hot muggy summer day.  Glad I chose this place my eggs Benedict were made with salmon talked with caviar and they were delicious well worth the money spent

I have been there twice, and both times, everything was great!! The drinks at the bar or the food. Everything was fresh and the staff was also very polite and helpful. Definitely a great place to visit if you are visiting to just sit with friends and family and have some drinks and enjoy the food!!!

It's somewhat painful to sit and write this as I'd like to distance myself as far from Bubusan Sushi and Sashimi as possible, but in the spirit of martyrdom I am hopeful this review steers others away. First of all, the whole market is a zoo. It's an overpriced mall food court crawling with tourists and food workers who seem so stressed that they may break at any moment. The chaos of this place had me in a chokehold gasping for any semblance of peace. I waited over 35 minutes for sushi that had me dreaming of a nice 7/11 roll. I'll be spending the next hour unwinding and trying to get this place off of my mind.
Great service, super friendly staff, delicious drinks. The view is an added bonus. We will definitely be back for more!
A cool little market in Brooklyn. They have a variety of different foods including Asian (Thai, Japanese, sushi), southern, breakfast style, and a bar etc. It's new and clean.
Been to a couple of these Time Outs and the I love the environment here. Wish there were more restaurants but understandable with Covid. Ate at the mexican restaurant and loved it!

The space is really nice and it was fun to have so many different options in one place. Ultimately, it seemed very expensive for counter service. A few people in my group got Thai food. It was good but not amazing and cost about $75 with tip and no drinks. Two others got Italian and thought it was very good. It was about $50 with tip. I liked the concept but just didn't love it. Great location to all out and have great views of the Brooklyn Bridge.

Stumbled across this place while hanging out in Brooklyn. It's a great food hall with plenty of options to choose from. I went here late afternoon on a Sunday and it was pretty crowded and slightly difficult to get around. However, it was so fun to check out what food vendors they have. They have a nice rooftop area with views of the Brooklyn Bridge and the Manhattan Bridge! I didn't end up getting anything to eat but will be coming back when I'm in the area!!
Didn't used to have such good options right near the bridge. The Brooklyn bridge is one of my favorite spots in New York and this is a hidden gem for good food! Will 100% go again and again.
No comment

Time Out Market is a great place to come for some fantastic views of the water and Brooklyn Bridge. It's a food hall spread out over multiple floors that seemed to have some yummy offerings but we didn't partake in any. They have a lovely rooftop bar which would be the perfect place to pop in for an afternoon beverage and take a break from the day amid a lively atmosphere. It's worth a visit if you're a tourist in the city or are looking for a quick and casual meal.
Yummy ramen for a early dinner at Hana Noodles. The pork is super tender and full of flavor, super aromatic and great for a cold day.

Timeout has a lot of great food options, don't have to go far to have an array of selections. Indoor and outdoor dining is available! There's also an app you can use not order ahead of time as well.
Love this place. Spectacular views and amazing assortment of food. A wonderful destination after you cross the Brooklyn bridge. Highly recommend it!! Especially at night

TimeOut market is a cool place to try.  Came here on a warm sunny day and had to go to the rooftop. A great view, a little small, felt they could have capitalized more on that.  The rooftop bars have some good options.  They had many different options to eat, wanted to try many, maybe next time. We did stop at the Clinton St. Baking Company and got the Apple Pie Waffle(caramelized apples, Apple cider glaze, vanilla whipped cream, cinnamon streusel topping). This was amazing!  The market was very spacious with lots of seating. Definitely worth a stop if in the area

Fun place with many choices to eat and drink, outside seating is amazing, cocktails are delicious, pizza place is pretty good. Definitely a great spot for an afternoon snack and drink with friends or coworkers.

it is what it is...very expensive but gorgeous.  Some of the food is great, some mediocre, BUT there's no other way to hang out by the water in Dumbo at that price point!  The bar is awesome, but it gets crowded.

Stopped by here one bright sunny day and had a pretty good time. The rooftop deck is not all that large but still nice with great views. Overall a nice spot and will definitely be back.
Tons of amazing options. I went to the Thai restaurant and it all tasted great. Everything was fresh, food came out pretty quickly

Great views.  Crowded on weekend!  Come early...lots of menu choices to fit  many appetites.  Full bar.

This was in August 2018 summer walking in Dumbo and stumbled at this cafe..on. Saturday morning walk across Brooklyn Bridge and first place we found at ate outside with friends visiting me in the City..everything was tasty as i remember peach waffles and Sid did turkey sausage it was the daily special ..so you'd sit outside on patio and take in the Brooklyn view of downtown NYC ..must see when city opens back up

Time Out Market is such a cute spot if you're hanging in Dumbo! There's a ton of food options to choose from and the views are to die for. It's pricey, but keep in mind you're paying for the experience. They had live music and a ton of seating when we went. We decided to try Fornino and the pizza was AMAZING. It cost us $18 + tax and I haven't stopped thinking about it since. The service at this particular place we went to wasn't great (not sure about the others), but the views definitely made the overall experience worth it.
Super cool space with a great view of the city skyline. So many great spots inside to eat at and accessible public restrooms.

Food is average and meant to be out quick.  Place is very understaffed and people's trays and plates are taking up the few dining places to eat.  There is a huge line for the 5 (men/women) bathrooms.  I don't recommend this place if you want to have a relaxed lunch/dinner.  Better to order to go and eat somewhere else.  Go eat someplace else in Dumbo!

EXTREMELY overpriced and over rated. Basic Tonkotsu ramen (not including egg) after tip is over $25 per person.  Broth is completely tasteless, and soup is filled with fillers (bean sprouts to look like noodles). Ramen at some of the top Ramen restaurants in NYC do not even cost this much!  Pad Thai was so sweet I thought it was dessert, it was supposed to be with egg, but could hardly see even a hint of egg mixed in, after tip over $18!

This is a straight up tourist trap. Stars for the view but food choices are limited. Folks behind the counters really seem unhappy and not trained very well I believe this is what leads to terrible wait times even for simply things like a bagel with cream cheese. Some key places closed permanently so take a look before you go. Better places in brooklyn and the city to spend an afternoon in my opinion.

This is a beautiful food hall and although there weren't too many places to choose from to eat they had pretty much the basic top 5 places . Pasta , burgers, asian , chicken sandwiches and seafood and a bar. You can go in and order the regulate how many people at a time and the bar will serve you and you can drink outside. They have a decent amount of seating or you can find a  rock outside or a space on the grass to eat and enjoy the beautiful view of the city . Pricing is average $20 or more at each eatery and they take CC no problem.

Amazing selection of food. It was our first time here and loved it. Definitely coming back!! Delicious!!!

I normally like my fried pickles in chip form but the way they cut them is cool too :) also i like the crunch of the batter. Margarita pizza from Fornino was DELICIOUS!! The Samosa Chaat from Chote Miya was definitely my favorite with the added pomegranate!
Great hangout place to have food and drinks with friends and enjoy beautiful skyline at the rooftop. Tons of vegetarian food options. Our guests from California loved this place.

Really liked this place! Saw some tik toks about it and had a fair share of opinions on both sides but this is definitely a must see if you're in Dumbo. There's a variety of food to choose from and the main bar at the rooftop level has some great drinks! Highly recommend if you're stuck on where to visit while in the area. The view is unbeatable and the music/atmosphere is definitely a reason to visit.

The TimeOut Market is sort of like the food hall in the Chelsea Market, except it's bigger and since it's located in DUMBO, it offers a better view! I liked that they took our temperature and contact details before we stepped in (haven't seen a lot of places doing that). They also have a nice rooftop area where you can eat and chill. Sadly, when I was inside the market, most restaurant outlets were closed so I didn't really have a lot to choose from. I wasn't really hungry so I just ordered a hotdog from Pat Lafrieda Meat Purveyors, which wasn't the best but wasn't bad for a quick bite. Would love to visit again and hopefully try out some of the other food shops.

Clinton st baking co never disappoints, I've visited the one in the lower east side but decided to try the one out at the time out market in Brooklyn, it was a little pricey but the food was delicious.  Can't wait to go back and try more dishes.

I haven't eaten at any of the downstair restaurants, but their rooftop bar rocks, one of the best views of Manhattan from Brooklyn. Right above the water. They have a lovely selection of locally crafted beers. Grab one and throw on your sunnies, stretch out and enjoy the vibes
Loved it! Great way to explore the foods in NYC without going all in different areas. Nice outdoor space as well for roaming around with food and drinks

Clean and spacious food court. The stalls were all decently busy but processed orders timely. Food was great - we did jacobs pickles! Lots of good options and variety. Would love to come back and get some food to go and eat by the water!

This review is for TIKI CHICK in the Time Out Market location THURSDAY JULY 14th-I have been to the UWS location and had great service, great food & great Pina coladas. While in the TOM I realized there was a Tiki Chick, so we ordered 2 pina coladas(10$ each)& 2 single chick sandwiches($5 each)-when the guy rang us up it was 44$(?), I was alittle confused & I ask the cashier, he pointed at the chalkboard at idk what & didn't say a word(?), so whatever I paid & tipped. When we got the receipt it said "2 Combos", 15$(?)each and extra 5 each for the Pina Coladas(?), ok whatever AGAIN. When we received our COMBOS WE DIDNT ORDER & our pina coladas. WE REALIZED HE GAVE IS THE WRONG FOOD! Went back up to the cashier & he just took food off another tray & put it on our tray-NO WORDS SPOKEN AGAIN(?) So then, we realized there was no alcohol in our drinks(?), so we went back up again to the cashier and asked if there was alcohol in our drinks, HE POINTED AGAIN AT THE CHALKBOARD(?!), no words again & with a nasty attitude(?)-IN SMALL PRINT ON THIS BUSY CHALKBOARD IT SAID "we do not serve alcohol", WOW!!!!!? We then decided to leave. I went up to get a to go box. THIS PERSON THEN ROLLED HIS EYES AT ME, slammed the bag/box on the counter(?)...I said thank you, he walked away & leaned on the wall & was texting on his phone(?). This was the worst service I've ever had in my life. And sorry Tiki Chick YOU SHOULD MAKE IT KNOWN IN BIG LETTERS THAT YOU DO NOT SERVE ALCOHOL! Because by the end of all this bs, we felt totally ripped off & disrespected by your employee. I wish I could give ZERO STARS

I went to the Time Out Market Place in Brooklyn, New York today for the first time.  My boyfriend and I ate at Felice Pasta Bar. The food was delicious and prepared in a timely manner. The staff was friendly and the seating area was comfortable. I really wish that bread/ garlic bread be added to the menu as an option. As an Italian, my family always had bread or garlic bread with every pasta meal. This could also bring in additional cash flow for something small.  Overall, I enjoyed the entire market. The layout was good and there were plenty of dining options to choose from as well as indoor and outdoor dining. I will be back for sure!
Choices ! choices! choices! All  types of food, great prices, large portions, great service. Nice seating. Every restaurant is good.

Was here on NY Eve. The rooftop has great view of the water, bridge and lower Manhattan skyline. Sat at one of the cocktail bar and the drinks are very good. A good place to stop by and hang out if in DUMBO area.

Great place to spend a Saturday morning! You can grab some good food then visit all of the different vendors. There's a lot of jewelry and clothing vendors. I tried Mr Taka Ramen and Clinton Street Bakery -- both were good. The Sugar Hill Creamery had really good ice cream (get the coffee ice cream!) . The Felice pasta bar wasn't good so I wouldn't recommend. The outside terrace provides spectacular views of the bridge and water. Would definitely go back because it's such a cool vibe!

The  rooftop view is cute but most of the food does not taste good but overpriced. The guy working in Ess a bagel was racist. While you get a very nice view of DUMBO on the 2nd floor, the food is not good and overpriced. Would recommend skipping the food/drinks at the market and just enjoy the sunset.

we went there on a August sunday, perfect summer day, there's plenty of outdoor picnic table right outside of the market. Going in thru a narrow double doors and led us to ventors lined out in street grid patterns, the hallways were pretty narrow as it was packed w crowds on sunday brunch time, we navigate thru ventors and reached to the end of the grid which ended w a bar, an elevated goes to the rooftop, and the cecconi's restaurant. we opted for fusion indian place chote miya and ramen from Mr. Taka ramen. the lamb burger was abit too gamey, very flavorful though, did not come w fries but you can order additionally as you please, samosa chaat was very good too, it's rich and flavorful. however, I was very disappointed w ramen, there's barely any noodle in the huge bowl, and the soup base flavor just simply bland. did not make it to the roof, and at the time we went, many ventors were not open, but for brunch, there's plenty of choices to select from, including dessert, beers and cocktails.
Great little place from where you can see the Brooklyn bridge. Awesome views. A lot of options inside for good non expensive food.

Time Out Market in Dumbo was a great idea for an outing. My friend and I tried different dishes from Jacob's Pickles, Nur and a Asian restaurant offering pork belly buns so we had a little bit of everything. We also had cocktails downstairs and up on the terrace. They were delicious, strong and not very expensive. It's a perfect place to go when it's on the warmer side, but can also be crowded. The views were incredible and there was a little something for everyone!

I liked the layout of Time Out Market more than other food halls I've been to. Maybe it's that everything is similarly branded and less busy-looking? It just feels way more cohesive and it didn't make me feel like I had to be studying each menu. The toughest part is seating, especially during the colder months when we went. But honestly there's a lot I'd love to try here, so I'll take the seating challenge. I ordered spaghetti and butternut squash soup from the pasta vendor. Both were delicious and multiple people stopped to ask where I ordered the dishes. Sadly I couldn't remember the name, but it was the first vendor across from the drink bar at the main entrance. Then, I indulged in dessert from dough. If you want to eat to your heart's content, there's probably something for you at Time Out Market.

Super excited about this Time Out Market in DUMBO. The one in Lisbon is amazing! Anyway, went on the opening weekend and wandered a bit, slightly bewildered by the number of options to choose from. It's nicer than some other food halls I have seen and I like how you can sit at the bar of each vendor on comfortable bar stools. I recommend you come to DUMBO, walk around the area for a bit, take tons of pics, maybe have a beer at one of the outdoor rooftops, then come here for some bites. There's so much to choose from and the pricing is very reasonable overall!

Open but no indoor dining! Came on a Friday night and there's plenty of seating outside. About 1/2 of the businesses are open, including Fish Cheeks, Jacobs pickles, Bessou , a mexican stall, a pasta stand, Pat la Frieda, and the bar. I've been here pre covid and it took us forever to find a table and waiting for food took a while so it was nice to get high quality takeout without the stress of finding a seat. It's a good time to visit, businesses need patrons now more than ever!

Went to this place last Thursday. It was a nice place, a good variety of restaurants to pick from, and has happy hour starting at 4 or 5 on selected cocktails and beers (recommend the sangria). Definitely go to Clinton for the pancakes and poached eggs. Went up to the roof top and got a table before the 5:00 rush and saw the sunset. Definitely recommend this place for a chill vibe time.

The rooftop Is a hidden gem! On a nice day, grab a drink from the bar (They're pricey at $14, but tasty and super aesthetically pleasing) and sit in the outdoor area on the 5th floor. The views are gorgeous and you can get some great pictures.

This place sure gets crowded on the weekend!  The line for the bathroom was longer than the club I went to the night before. All the food choices looked good and the set up of this market is great but overall, it's still overpriced food court food. I ordered the pork belly ramen and it was very underwhelming. Also tried my friend's honey chili cauliflower from this Indian spot and it was just Ok as well.

When in NYC I try to hit all the hot spots and thanks to my cousin and a great family outing we all took a little trip to DUMBO and got to experience it together for the first time. I was overwhelmed by all the food options, yet super excited at the same time. In the end I decided to get the fried chicken at the Jacob's Pickles stall. Overall, it's delicious, however my only gripe is that my chicken, which was the honey chicken and pickles they drenched it with honey and that over powered a lot of the chicken and the biscuit. So I had to eat the parts that didn't have that much honey. But when I'm back in DUMBO, I'll definitely try the other stalls. And rejoice Boston, we will get a time out market of ours as well very soon!

I can only speak for the Japanese  place this was a special it was fried chicken with two sushi rolls with crunchy rice. I really enjoyed the taste of the crunchy rice, how can you not like fried rice.

Amazing food vendors! each vendor has a limited menu to focus on bringing folks quality over quantity. The chicken karage in Japanese homestyle cooking was the star of the show. So juicy on the inside and crunchy and chewy fried batter on the outside. Seasoned with spicy mayo and seaweed on top. The view just took my breath away. End the fabulous day with a scoop of ice cream from the market as you walk along the pier and carousel near by.

Had such a corny and disappointing experience at Time Out Market in Dumbo. Neglected allergies, slow service, and the most tight-fisted teacher's discount I've ever experienced. My 68 year old father literally apologized for taking me out there.

Absolutely amazing! I had the buffalo Mac & Cheese from the Southern food station and it was sooooooooo delicious! Wow! The best that I've ever had! This place is basically food heaven! Anything you can possibly imagine and dream of is here! I would definitely recommend checking this place out.  I actually went here during my trip in the water taxi.  This is one of the last stops.  I went here during the week and there was a good amount of seating.  I bet this place on the weekend gets super packed though! I recommend grabbing a seat first and then getting drinks at the bar since the tables fill up rather fast! I had a black cherry mule at the bar and it was awesome! Made with Mezcal and had the perfect amount of sweetness.

When I heard about Time Out Market and the many food vendors they had recruited, I was excited to check it out first hand. The market does not disappoint. On the bottom floor some food vendors include Fish Cheeks selling delicious Thai food and fresh oysters, Bessou with their fried crispy rice topped with sashimi, Alta Calidad and their variety of tacos, among many others. The layout is appealing with plenty of tables to enjoy whichever food you choose. We split some tacos at Alta Calidad, but I had I gone to the rooftop first, I definitely would have gotten food there instead. The rooftop has beautiful views of the river, an impressive bar, and additional food vendors including Nur. However, it is clear Time Out has vetted all of these vendors, carefully choosing the best. All options seem good and it is a place that will require many return visits to try the many places.

So much fun!!!! The ambience and views are breathtaking. Great pizza!!! I'll be back!

So many food choices-- not much seating since social distancing because of covid but better to be safe. Temperature checks! I got Bessou - tuna bowl was amazing and so was the crispy rice with salmon on top.

My family and I have visited the Time Out Market in Lisbon (which I highly recommend everyone visit). So, we decided to try the Time Out Market in NYC. Overall, I enjoyed our experience but Lisbon's market was better. Since worth visiting though... Bon Appetite!

This was my first visit to the Dumbo Market. The view from the rooftop was amazing. Great atmosphere & fun ambiance. We enjoyed a pesto pizza and some cheesy fries as well as some drinks from the bar. The pizza and fries were good. The drink was mediocre to say the most. It had waaaay too much toppings so that I wasn't able to enjoy the drink itself.

There's really nice ambiance with the indoor and outdoor seating. A great selection of brunch, dessert, appetizers and main courses! Also great dietary restriction friendly options, I.e. vegan & gluten free. I love the outdoor seating upstairs with an amazing view of the bridge!

Loved the rooftop area. Outdoor seating and great views of the city were the most important part. The drinks were solid. I'd definitely return here.

5 stars for location 4 stars for food and price 2 stars for dining and drinks logistics issues. Great location right next to the Brooklyn waterfront by Janes Carousel. Plenty of good food options from ramen to sushi, chicken and biscuits, sandwiches, oysters, and plenty more. All players seem to be around $8-$10 appetizers and $15-$30 entrees depending on which establishment you go to and where you order. The only downside is that indoor seating is very limited with a small counter at each stand and a dozen or so communal tables by the main entrance. There are  park benches and tables outside but because the food is served in actual plates that becomes a lot of weight to carry when you're trying to find a table and also not drop anything. The biggest issue however is drinks. Food vendors do not sell or serve drinks and that includes water and soda not to mention Alcoholic beverages. So in order to get a drink you now have to carry your food to one of the many bars and order it there. Seems like an unnecessary step. Also when you're done eating you have to bring your plates and utensils back inside otherwise it'll just pile up on the outdoor tables and no one will be about to sit.
Fun place to hang out and eat at. They have plenty of vegan options and a nice rooftop seating area with a bar.

From my point of view, this is my kind of attraction, 3 stories worth of fine food and drink all tucked neatly under the Brooklyn bridge. Nod of thanks to my friend James Walker for directing me to check this place out. Since its tight on parking, i suggest you arrive and depart in an Uber or Cab. To tough thing about this magnificent collection of food kiosks is making a choice- You want to get a steak sandwich from Pat La Frieda, Oysters from Fish Cheeks, hit the David Burke tavern, hang out on the rooftop bar and deck with stunning city views. Okay, it's a little touristy, but who cares, I'm a tourist that day. Fugetabout those vain hotties on the roof deck from Singapore, or Japan, posing and snapping selfies with the bridge and skyline in the background. My point is, there is something exceptional for everyone here. You can come in, eat and get out or hang out and people watch and eat for hours, either way it's time well spent.

A wonderful surprise!!! The view and the food was worth getting lost.  I instantly noticed how clean the market was and how friendly the staff behaved. We walked around reading the menus from different vendors.  The art that was displayed throughout the market was interesting.  We ventured up to the rooftop where we enjoyed the amazing view, sipped on Margaritas, ate brownies and sweet potato tarts before we decided to eat dinner at Cecconi's Dumbo.

So you're playing tourist in DUMBO and want a quick and convenient lunch option, and Juliana's is too packed to wait? Try Time Out Market New York! Like its cousins in Portugal and Miami, this Time Out Market includes a couple dozen eateries, bars, and retail spaces. The market is on the 1st and 5th floors. Explore your options before settling on one. Check out Juliana's Pizza upstairs (much less crowded than the original Juliana's a few blocks down). There is outdoor seating on the 5th floor with great views. Check it out!

This is a great food court addition with a selection of food stalls.  If you go to the highest floor of the building, there are a few more food and bar selections with a free rooftop seating area that is facing the Brooklyn Bridge Park.  Definitely a nice place to hang out especially on warm summer nights.

Can't tell you enough how much I loved this place! So many food options! I ended up getting Juilianna's pizza and ate it on the rooftop outside. There we had an AMAZING view of Manhattan and both the brooklyn bridge and manhattan bridge. This place is a must when visiting NYC!

Loved all the food options, especially Clinton Street. The rooftop was by far my favorite. I will definitely be back!
Super fun "food court" to go to with many many different choices. Gorgeous views of dumbo, the bridge, and the water. A great spot to come during the holidays for cute decor and atmosphere.

They have it all! We were lucky to be just ahead of the lunch rush and find a seat upstairs. Everyone was able to get their choice food and meet back at the table. The place was crazy busy by the time we left but probably still worth the waits.

Great place to come where everyone can get what they want. It's very crowded on a Saturday and difficult to find a table, but the food options make it worth it. Plenty of vegan options- the quesadilla I had was super yummy!

Very cool concept in having well known restaurants in NYC to serve their most popular dishes. There variety makes it difficult for me to choose! The wait for food though can be quite long. In this food court like market, you will see all the already pretty well-known local restaurants all in one place. While this is convenient, they are all a bit expensive compared to the original places. The seatings are usually limited on the weekend, you need to find your own place just like you would have to do in the food court. The lines are usually a bit long on the weekend. I would still recommend this place as they still have pretty good vendors and it's kind of hard to find things to eat around DUMBO. Overall, a mediocre place and a tourist attraction.
Second time here only for drinks but they were awesome! My favorite is the "Southside". The service was on point and fast
