I wish they had more places to sit and if you need to go to the bathroom- forget about it ladies. You better hold it because the line is out the door.
No comment

I was excited to see all the press they put out announcing their reopening with new vendors. Came on a Memorial Day and the hall was not as advertised. Only about 6 vendors open on the ground floor out of about 20 stalls, and the 6 were completely overwhelmed. Despite the empty stalls, the layout of the market makes for very tight spaces with very low ceilings, not the best when you are still in a pandemic, waiting 20 minutes in line to order and another 45 minutes to receive supposedly "fast casual" food. And the pricing is insane: $13 for a very mediocre Mac and cheese, $27 for a salad with shrimp. Much higher than the pricing for the same food at other locations (like jacobs pickles and Clinton st baking company). I'm guessing the vendors charge higher prices to cover higher rents, but none of that translates into a better experience for the customer.

Really a cool place...but just like everything these days...it's REALLY crowded...and leans to the expensive side.  Too many strollers and tourists...but hey...that's the way it is.  We just stopped for a drink and that was about $40, including tip.   Lots of interesting food options, like pancakes from Clinton St. baking company and sweets from Breads bakery.   I'd go back in a minute...just not on the weekend.
No comment

I really love Time Out in Brooklyn. The place is very cool, beautiful, good people, good music, amazing view to Manhattan and the bridges, incredible food. I give a highlight to Pat LaFrieda. They have THE BEST burger in life. Really! This is one of my favorite places in NY.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has a lot of restaurants in one roof! It looks like a fast food eatery, but with a touch of classy ambiance, not like the ones in the mall. So many choices!! You can't go wrong .. There's a deck where you can sun bathe and enjoy the scenery of Brooklyn Bridge in the east river. But, you can't bring food out the deck.

Newest addition to the market craze.  Bonus points for location near pier 1 and views of the bridges, East River, and the Manhattan skyline.  Lots of trendy food outposts available and the largest seating available in any NYC market we've visited.       Shared Pat LaFrieda, Jerusalem bagel, and do.  Food vendors do not sell beverages ( alcoholic or otherwise) .... you have to order separately at one of two bars. Slightly disappointing outdoor seating options with many parties stalking tables even on a Tuesday. As others have said, bathrooms were not well planned.  Visitors from out of town should be aware 5th floor is the top ( higher visible rooftop space is a private club )
No comment
No comment

Love this place for food and beautiful skyline view. This place has my favorite New York restaurants all under one roof. Babkas from Breads bakery, julians pizza, Clinton st baking company pancakes,avocaderia and so many good food places.  And I love the roof top view, it's easily one of the best views of Manhattan and Brooklyn bridge and the skyline.

What we love to do on a lazy Saturday afternoon is to take the NYC Ferry from pier 11 to dumbo and just wander around. TimeOut Market has anything you would want and more. Either a quick in and out snack or whole meal with friends from out of town. Go upstairs to the top floor where they have David Burke, Nur, Jualiana and the amazing skyline view of Manhattan.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing! If you are needing a cocktail and a great view, check this place out. You cannot beat the view. The cocktails were delicious and refreshing. They have different cuisines, perfect for families and groups. Be prepared to wait a bit but I found that's kind of normal around New York/Brooklyn but you will be waiting with amazing views, great music and a unique group of people! Enjoy!

This review goes to Jacob's Fried Pickles : spotless clean, very nice cookers and staff. The food is absolutely amazing. Comfort food to its best. I've ordered the Honey Fried Chicken & Mac'n Cheese combo and it was super worth it . Price was okay and it comes enough food for 2. Best pickles I have ever had.

This place is great a date or hanging out with your friends! The view on the rooftop is beautiful! The price for food is worth it, I actually think that you're getting more than what you pay for. There's so many restaurants that you can go to visit each time that you go. I will be going again!
No comment
No comment

Rooftop bar was nice.Places with window just fantastic. Aperol spritz,Pinot Grigio in bar great to try.Price normal for view and atmosphere. Pizza margarita with wines.2 times I was there and want more.

I'm sure large crowds could really ruin the experience here, but I had a fabulous time this Wednesday afternoon. The rooftop bar has amazing views (even the outdoor space on the lower level has a top notch view of Manhattan). The food choices are high end but reasonably priced. You'll be tempted to dabble in all the options but you could easily spend $15-20 bucks at each vendor. Roughly $8-10 for a beer and $13-15 for cocktails. The rooftop bar has a separate liquor license from the main level on the ground floor so although you can drink in both areas, you can't travel up and down with your beer. I ate the margarita pizza with pepperoni from Juliana's on the roof and then the Mel's Double Burger at Pat LaFrieda Meat Purveyors on the ground floor - both excellent renditions of the classics that I highly recommend. This place is such a great addition to the DUMBO scene!!
No comment
Cute trendy market in a once empty and sad space. Definitely reinvented with food and stores and the roof has great views.
No comment

I cannot recommend Time Out Market more! As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by so many different kinds of foods, and we wanted to try every single one! This is perfect for groups as well, as there is something for everyone including Thai, Japanese, fried chicken, Mexican, salads, desserts and so much more! Would highly recommend the Thai curry, the honey glaze fried chicken sandwich and the cookie dough. The market can be really busy however (for good reason) and so sometimes it's hard to find a seat, especially for a big group.
Great experience! "Chote Miyan" had incredible Indian food w/ multiple vegan + GF options. The views are one of the finest in the city!
No comment
Had a great time two weeks ago. Great food, great bar and great scenery. A lot to do around that area and you can definitely find parking a few blocks away.
Fish cheeks. $21 for this???? Both the rice and curry are half empty lol. There aren't even any vegetables in the curry... tons of other vendors there I should have tried for cheaper...

The name of this place slips my mind but the tacos were delicious and filled with mouth-watering meat and colourful garnishments. I almost opted for Mediterranean food next door but I'm so glad I tried this stall instead. In addition to their chalkboard menu, be sure to take a look at the small special/daily features menu right in front of the cash register - that's where I ordered mine, which I believe was pulled pork! Even if you don't have tacos, Time Out Market is definitely worth the stop as the outdoor patio features an obstructed view of the Brooklyn Bridge. This was such a reward especially after having crowded at the famous Dumbo photo spot with other tourists. There's also a beautiful bar with a giant water station for you to stay hydrated.
Great selection of food, LOTS of beautiful outdoor seating, but definitely not cheap.
No comment

Stopped by a week or so after they opened. Its a great idea, so many choices to choose from. We stopped at a few places and tried a little of everything. However, it seems like the entirety of Brooklyn were there too. Choose your time to go as it gets very crowded. But, definitely stop in on a hot day to cool off. There's also a roof deck with great views. A fun place, just can be a bit croweded.

Although I should probably rate the individual stalls here, this is a great destination with communal seating and you can grab food from multiple places. Top tip, there's a great terrace on the fifth floor so you can eat in the lea of two bridges.
No comment

I give this place 2 stars for the rooftop view however everything else was underwhelming. Comparing this to the Timeout market in Lisbon it didn't even feel like a food hall. Firstly the downstairs is cramped and dimly lit. Secondly while the food choices are pretty good, the prices are outrageous. The prices are not in line with a food hall. At those prices you may as well goto a proper restaurant and not have to carry around your own food in a plastic tray (which you paid $17+ for 2 tacos or $14 for mac cheese) . I think it's cool to check out once but don't go there for the food.
No comment

I am impressed, Time Out Market New York was definitely superb. Great menu, great people, great ambience and great times. Fried Chicken Sandwich was really incredible, I wanted to order every single thing off their menu, but glad that I went for Fried Chicken Sandwich. The team is very pleasant. I really valued that. Time Out Market New York: Certainly a must try if you are in the area.
Great spot in Dumbo, we walked from the Saturday Dumbo Flea Market.  Sadly only about a third of restaurants are serving food.  We got the Pickles chicken.

Place was packed Saturday night. We couldn't get any drinks first of all half positions from menu are not available and bartenders are not helpful. Food is a lil bit pricey but tastes good. Great view!

I came on opening day evening hours, the place was packed! With so much people I was not able to really look around and be able to enjoy more than one vendor. The lines were long but flowing and the staff were very patient with everyone. From the quick glances that I made there are a good amount of vendors and a lot of unfamiliar dishes to me, with that being said I wasn't so thrilled to try much. One vendor I did try was Jacobs Pickles with their famous Buffalo Chicken Mac & Cheese ($15). It was good, very cheesy and creamy, good about of chicken good amount of heat. I also checked out the bar the bartender helped me out & I choose the J&G drink ($13). It has good flavors but no kick to it, lots of ice & it went down like juice. Pretty disappointing for the price. There's very little outdoor seatings but there's beautiful views out there! The rooftop also has food vendors and a bar, again on this packed evening I couldn't look around much. I'd like to come back possibly on earlier hours and really get the feels of this place.
No comment
No comment
Definitely packed!!bathroom line was nuts but bathroom was clean and alot of things to choose from.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Beautifully designed and a ton of fun. This place is the Chelsea market of Dumbo, although a little smaller. There are maybe 20-30 different vendors with some amazing options. Prices are about $15-20 for a meal which is honestly pretty normal for NYC. I came on a Saturday at noon so it was quite packed but we didn't have any trouble finding seating, although I heard that the bathroom lines were ridiculous. Clinton Street's pancakes are about the best I've ever had, and it's a great place for families, to bring someone from out of town, or just to hang out with friends or casually with a S/O. Would definitely come back to try more options!

This place is an awesome spot to go with a group! Everyone can get exactly what they want with no need to split checks! I had bites at a lot of the booths all amazing! The prices are kind of on point for the area considering you walk out to the rooftop to a gorgeous view of the bk bridge. If your in the area it's a must!

Similar to Chelsea market but a lot nicer. There are lots of food options and some of it is quite fancy.  The "rooftop" space is nice but there isn't a ton of shade so it was a little too hot on an 85 degree day. Also, everyone was trying to get to the real rooftop which is not part of Time Out but a SoHo house members club.
No comment

Ive eaten here a number of times. Dissapointing is the best description! The ambiance is nice and so is the view from the 5th floor. As for the food its mediocre to poor. The pizza is salty and the meat is average. But the food is not its weak point. The service is poor. The servers are not professional or seem happy to be there.  For the price you pay for basic food it's just a waste.  Hopefully Timeout will get vendors that take their businesses serious.

We had the opportunity to get to know the place in 2017 when we visited Lisbon and was delighted. So that's why I was so excited about the market opening in New York. And it is great! Definitely try Pat Lafried Meat Purveyors, the burger is simply perfect, amazing! Fish Cheeks oysters have a special taste with the crispy onions (and they were very fresh!). Try to avoid peak times, so the experience will be better
No comment
No comment

Good food choices but the drinks situation is a mess. You have to go to the bar even for nonalcoholic drinks... water too. And get this: they won't give you a cup of water. They make you buy a $4 mini bottle of Evian. Absolute bull.

Horrible service at Breads Bakery. They have 2 corners in TIme out i tried the small one. While paying with credit card it turnes out the counter also opens as a gate. Because I didn't hear their employee trying to get in and expecting me to move i was basically yelled at by her.  Just because i didn't hear her in that noise because it is saturday brunch time and it was busy with millions of people and ver loud. I just told the guy who was helping at the register that you do not yell at your customers with that rude tone and manor . I like their union sq location. But this one i will never go back.

Waited for over 10 minutes to order at Loco Coco before I decided it was worth the wait to order when there isn't a line. Apparently they don't need the business that badly. The place was as empty as a ghost town and there was no employee in sight.

We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge and then wandered down to the water and then discovered this market. Amazing!    A great place to walk around with plenty of amazing places to eat.   We actually didn't eat at any of them...I'm saving that for another trip, but I highly recommend going there...you don't need to eat as there is shopping as well and it's a great place to take a break.

I very much enjoyed the crispy rice trio with salmon, spicy tuna, and yellowtail from Bessou at Time Out Market. However, the market and seating were spread between the first and fifth floors, the latter being less crowded but with more expensive food options (it also features a view, though partially blocked by a bandstand stage and a bar). The weekend crowd made carrying loaded trays difficult and also led to a scarcity of seating, especially for groups of three or more. I saw quite a few people hoarding spaces even before they obtained their food (maybe a seating host could assist during busy times?). Fortunately, the tables were bussed quickly and efficiently. The line for the restroom was also quite long -- surprising for the fact that the space had two bars and a coffee shop -- though they did have an attendant assisting there. The biggest disappointment was the water filling station; it was an ice water dispenser at the front bar with a sign stating "Please do not fill your water bottle here. Glassware is provided next to the water station. Thank You!" Unfortunately, next to the dispenser was a stack of small, PLASTIC cups (for the environmental and financial cost of the cups, installing a water fountain with a bottle dispenser might seem the better option here). Happy to return again to support the local purveyors here, but will try to visit during off-peak times and with a full water bottle.

This is a 2 star facility for its food options. I'm giving 1 stat for the view and 1 star for Juliana. So glad I don't have to wait in the line for its pizza.Tried 4 spots downstairs and will not go back to any of them.

I had the pleasure  of eating  Jacob's Pickles and the food was amazing. The chicken  was fried and butter lite with the honey glazed over it.  And omg to TTY MAc and Cheese amazing. I was also pleased tHe customer  service.

Great food, so many choices! I was wondering whY didnt i ever visit this place when i went to Dumbo, brooklyn. There is a dessert place out there in front of Little Ada( the shwarma place - is awesome)  and it has some amazing desserts specially the raspberry thing, wish i took a picture but unfortunately forgot to

Omgsh! I love this place! I ate here on my last day in NY and I really wish we had one of these back home. There's so many different restaurants to choose from so it's your one stop shop if your family all wants different things. Can't wait to come back

This one star is not for the market itself, but the downstairs bar. The market is great, we live 5 minutes away, and the food and upstairs bar have been awesome, we go several times a week. However, the downstairs bar we have tried to enjoy several times, to be greeted with rude service, and extremely grumpy bartenders. I understand it can get frustrating having tourists come by a lot, but that is no excuse to have lower service, especially when a glass of wine is $12+. This evening the woman was particularly bad. We stood at the bar for no less than 5 minutes (there was no one else to serve) while she played on her phone, to finally be greeted with disdain that we were there and interrupting her instagramming. Please hire better staff or exaggerate to them the importance of customer service.

Don't bother.  Just got back from there, we had 4 dishes of food from 3 different places.  None good, all overpriced.  Of course, nice location and decent views, but don't go to eat at the food court.
No comment
Yeah, tons of food option but no option for tap water.  We spent money on food but was told by bartender that tap water not available.  Only bottle water for purchase.  Pure money grab.
Such a great spot for any and everyone. Tons of great food options. Spent about $70 for three people ( 1 adult/2kids) desserts included. Great spot for takings instagram worthy pictures
Nice atmosphere and great place for a quick meal. It's one of the spots I would recommend if in visit to NY

So many options! This place made my heart so happy because I love having the option to eat multiple cuisines at once. I want to go back next time I'm in town to try more spots. I tried a spicy curry that was actually spicy ( most dishes I try that are "spicy" don't end up being spicy so this was great) it had such a nice flavor. Also tried some dumplings that were good and some sushi. Everything was great and I will be back for more.

Over priced and completely underwhelming. Beautiful building, cool layout but you can do much better. Ate at Julianna's , do yourself a favour and go to Joes in Manhattan if you want good pizza. Everything here is way too expensive. Perhaps the nights are better here but during the day it feels like a tourist trap

Talk about being a kid in a candy shop. I wanted to eat everything. I've never seen a place with so many tantalizing options. Fun to explore. So many sights and wonderful smells. A great place to visit. Make sure you come with an empty stomach. Don't miss the rooftop bar.

The only reason I give it more than one star is the view. The view is INCREDIBLE! Do NOT waste your time at the bar. The drinks are absolute trash and really overpriced. Severely disappointed in the Summer Spritz and the Smokey Cherry Mule. I ordered a cosmo and they gave me kettle one vodka then charged me $20....I could have gotten a whole bottle of Kettle One Vodka for $15!

so mandy good options and so cute to walk around in. different options for everyone and they're all delicious l! also the upstairs area has a BEAUTIFUL view of the brooklyn bridge that is seriously breathtaking!

Not the best experience. The idea of it is cute, but once you get there, see all the dirty tables, all the lines, and all the people that idea goes away. We saw so many people having to clean their own tables and put the dirty dishes on other tables so that they could have a seat. There's no clear designation for dirty dishes/ trays when you're done with them so customers just end up leaving the table dirty, and there was no one cleaning them up so everything was just accumulated. Took us close to an hour to find a table (it was dirty) and close to another hour to get our food. We tried the Broccoli Gnocchi from Felice Pasta Bar and I would give that dish a 3/5. It was eh and I was still hungry after (my boyfriend couldn't finish the plate, said it was all mush). We then tried the Vegan Quesadilla from BKLYN WILD and that was a 2/5. We both couldn't finish it, it was cold when we got it despite picking it up as soon as the buzzer went off, and it was very bland. The star of the show for us was the Mac and Cheese from Jacob's Pickles. Easiest the best mac and cheese we've all had. 5/5. It was cooked perfectly, had the perfect amount of cheese, and the slightly crunchy layer on top was amazing. Apart from that, you do get a nice view of the river if you go towards the back/ the third floor, but that doesn't really outweigh the unkemptness, crowds, and eh food for me to go back when I'm in town.

This market is very cute but the service at the "time out bar" is absolutely appalling. Views are a 10/10 so it's unfortunate that the bar staff can't be more welcoming and instead make you feel like an actual burden just by being there.
No comment

Perhaps always good to have more options in Dumbo, but the space feels cramped, and prices are Manhattan-sky high, including a cashless payment system that forces a 'tip' on every counter transaction (I hope it will be fixed soon). Feels overall a bit thoughtless and impersonal compared to more local businesses nearby. Some of the stands are good food-wise, considering you're a tourist and haven't figured out the exchange rate yet. It's still their first week, though, and I hope they can fix up their issues because the location is great, and with DUMBO often people's first impression of Brooklyn, it is sad for it to feel more and more like a tourist trap.

I loved my Time Out experience! I was a little nervous going there because it was just before noon on a Sunday and had read that it was going to be insane. It definitely was not (but had picked up quite a bit over the hour that we were there). It was nice to be able to browse through the stalls before choosing what to eat. I went for an old favorite - the margherita from Juliana's (no line at this one but just around the corner, they were already packed!). My niece got the chicken caesar from Jacob's Pickles and that was some of the best fried chicken I've ever had.  I've been to their UWS spot but had never tried that before. I really love the selection of places represented in there as they are a lot of places I already loved and like going to and now are conveniently in one place. And the design and views can't be beat!! Can't wait to go back!

So happy that TOM NY moved into the bottom floor of 55 Water Street.  It was in desperate need for something fun that included food.  Avacadoria was amazing and the perfect kind of lunch.  Can't wait to go back and sample another little shop there.

Spectacular views! Directly above the water, but surrounded by manhattan, Brooklyn and queens bridges. Stunning during the day light hrs from every angle (May to choose from), so I can only imagine when the sun goes down just how much more breathtaking it all becomes. Food was okay, drinks was okay, but within the vicinity of Dumbo it's self you have many options for food, drinks and views that it's literally a win win.  Also, it's pricey $$$, but that generally comes with the territory of being in any prime location. Your are really paying for the rarity, exclusiveness and the poss. It's a kid friendly, tourists and social type environment mid morning- early evening for sure. I will def return when the sun is going down and explore again, because I have a feeling the entire scene changes at night. This place also has a market on the ground level and pretty much takes a full block around. Lots of twists and turn to explore. I'd say check it out for yourself. Pick cooler day if visiting during the day, and bring your selfie-stick .. you will want to Matt the occasion. Enjoy!

This place is incredible with many options to choose from food wise. It is located in dumbo right along the river, with a beautiful walking path, outdoor seating, views of the East river, bridges and Statue of Liberty. There is janes carosol for children to enjoy! The food at time out market is wonderful from Felice pasta to Jacobs pickles and more.... the place is exciting to visit and try various foods to share with friends. There is also shopping in the neighborhood to enjoy as well as a roof top!

Tourist trap alert. Food is generally overpriced. Most meal cost around $20 after tax. We got crab curry from Fish Cheeks which was mostly curry sauce with rice. There was very little crab for the price. Chicken wings was just okay. This was disappointing because we actually love the Fish Cheeks restaurant in Manhattan. Beef udon from Bessou was nothing special for the price and the portion was rather small. The soup was very oily. The mixed green salad from Center Cut with honey mustard sauce was delicious but still overpriced in my opinion. If you are in the area, I would recommend taking a short cab ride to chinatown which offers much better food with good value.
This review is for Fish Cheeks - don't order the crab curry - it's salty as hell! Customer service is severely lacking and food is mediocre.

Expensive and not particularly good food in a nice enough space (I mean, it's the dumbo waterfront Am- hard to mess that up'. I had the fried chicken sandwich from pat lafrieda and it was just ... sad. I'll take Shake Shack's any day. Not to mention fuku's. The new development on the waterfront that this is housed in is also just soulless.
Came here for the first time on a day trip took the ferry ate at ivy stark food was worth the price. Had Mexican street corn.  Carne Asada tacos. Pomegranate guacamole. and seafood Cobb salad

This is basically an enormous food court with a couple of shops. Still trying to figure out if I missed the other stores. I'm basing this review on the food because I really only saw a shop or two. We had food from several different places here and all was delicious. There was even a raw cookie dough place. Call me crazy but that just doesn't sound good to me. Anyway, there is a lot of variety and everything we tried was great!

You have to come here!! We had already eaten dinner but walked this way to explore Dumbo. Highly disappointed we didn't discover this earlier. There is an array of restaurants that ALL looked amazing. We went back for breakfast which was great as well.

Don't bother going to this place if you are female because the queue for the ladies toilets is always so long that you will spend more time queuing than you will enjoying your meal. There are only 3-4 female toilet stools for a food hall of 21 stands and hundreds of people.. do the maths. This place is overcrowded, tables aren't wiped down frequently, overpriced tourist trap.

What an amazing place. The view is simply spectacular and the way they designed it is beautiful. There's so many food choices, definitely can't go wrong. I will definitely be returning- my new favorite place in Brooklyn!

A food lovers paradise. You can almost find the best of the best that NYC has to offer in this market. The view of the city from the rooftop on the second floor is fabulous. The food is great with so many different options. The wine is on point. Definitely recommend.

I ate at felice pasta bar. The entire dish was drowning in oil so I couldn't taste anything else. Pretty disappointed in that. I would go to the market to try something else. I also think they need more non alcoholic beverage choices. I wanted to buy soda and couldn't purchase it anywhere.

After the East River ferry brought us to the waterfront of Brooklyn Bridge Park, TimeOut Market was about a 10min walk from the pier. The venue exceeded my expectations. Compared to other food halls in Manhattan and Brooklyn, there's a different vibe and servicescape after you explore all the various ground floor restaurants including the ones at the 5th floor rooftop. Since our kids wanted pizza, we stayed on the 5th floor where they have a Juliana's, a more scenic view,  indoor/outdoor rooftop seating, the TimeOut Bar and a live DJ playing some nostalgic hits. The beef burger from David Burke Tavern was also very good. For a while the 5th floor was less crowded compared to the hip trendy dark decor ground floor which has more restaurant selections but eventually we saw other guests bringing up their food in the elevator to dine in the more luminscent rooftop area. Cleaning staff also appeared to be on point. I will definitely be going back.

This was exactly what I expected. An adult food court. You get to preview many different flavors and menus all crafted to work in this open seating style environment. Free water for those located everywhere and the staff pick up your plate. I love that you can step outside and enjoy the sun and views all the while the ac is running inside incase you need to cool down. The roof top Terrance has some stunning views.

Overrated and my first and done! Visited here labor day weekend (5pm ish Saturday) take elevator to 5th floor, stand in line for drinks - you must order food (fries do not count), pay for drinks (tiny cup), then go to end of the bar, order food & pay for food separately. Get in line again for a table on the terrace. We waited more or less 30 minutes. It's a small terrace with about 10-12 tables with NO tent or umbrellas from the beaming sun.

I heavily anticipated this markets opening as there are few other restaurant options in DUMBO. However, I am overall disappointed with this time out market. The two floor layout makes it hard to navigate and the identical signage of the vendors makes it hard to find what you are looking for. The restaurant options are decent, but all overpriced. It is disappointing to pay expensive restaurant prices and eat in a food hall. If I wanted to spend 25+ on a single dish I would go to the restaurant for the experience and service.

First if all I went to the time out bar and the bartender she was ok.  The drinks were ok and the location is nice. I asked the bartender for water and after she gave me some she told me where i could get it should I want more. ...really.  I'm paying for drinks and you want me to go get the water while you socialize with your coworkers...uh no...I won't be going back !!! That's not the way to run a bussiness. That bartender needs some etiquette classes. Needless to say I won't be returning. By the way maybe some bartending classes too.

Ambience , food and drinks it was excellent . It was everything perfect except when we have the second round of drink at the rooftop bar this lady bartender it was so rude. I was waiting line and nobody take care my order I'm patiently waiting my turn because I know is Friday the have a lot people but It wasn't  to crowded to be wait a lot. Behind me the guy he order with her , and he notice later I was waiting and he politely say sorry and he ask me if I'm order I said no and he ask her to take the order and she just said I'm waiting the other bartender I'm seriously I'm just waiting someone to take my order and the guy asks me again what I want I said I just want the mojito and the lady bartender said she running out of mint can't make it for me and I can see the have all bunch of mint in from of me .

column3: Schwalbach (am Taunus), Schwalbach am Taunus, Germany
column6: Great variety of food, prices are fine too. Free water which is always great and an amazing view of the Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges. It's freezing inside though...as with many places in NYC.
So loud and busy - I don't know how you can enjoy this over marketed hype. Yeah, views are awesome but prices are silly for basically upscale fast food

In the trend of food halls Time Out has done a great job setting themselves apart. Unlike the other major food halls (i.e. Eataly, Little Spain) they have a vast variety of cuisines from notable restaurants, eateries, bakeries, etc from all over the city. Everything I ate was amazing and the wine list was impressive. They even feature my favorite local winery in Dr Konstantin Frank from the Finger Lakes!
The Thai Seafood option is delicious! I had the veggie green curry and it was so Rick and tasty. I highly recommend it.
Came in at 4 pm on a Sunday, stopped at the 5 th floor bar to get a glass of wine.... bartender rude and short poured our wine glasses....  stay away.

I'm a sucker for a good food hall. The roof is just lovely and if I Hadn't needed to drive home I would have loved to get a drink and just sit looking at the bridge. So many good food choices in going to have to go back several times!

The transformation of DUMBO continues to blow my mind, even so many years after it really took off. There's tons of reasons to go there now and, if you're looking for casual food where everyone can try something different, it's worth the trip. It's a little hard to decide. I tried a few kinds of delicious hummus and other Israeli food because it was the fastest! It's probably smart to find an off-peak time, though, because it can be so overcrowded and the waits can be long. But, we don't have trouble finding seats, even during the busiest weekends. So happy to see even more new life breathed into the historic neighborhood.

Disappointing experience at Little Ada market tonight. I ordered the salad nicoise and asked for no pita. I wasn't sure the person working the counter totally understood my order, so I clarified. A couple of times.  I paid and waited patiently for my order. What arrived looked suspiciously like hummus with some Israeli tabbouleh on top, and despite my specific request to the contrary, came with a large chunk of pita on the side. Reserving judgment so far. I dug in  hoping I would discover some fish inside there nestled among the...hummus. Which would be a strange combination, but I was in a hurry and decided to go with it. Turned out it was a generous order of hummus with Israeli tabbouleh, which was tasty, but definitely not what I ordered, despite my repeated clarifications. I was pressed for time, so I left. If you're open-minded, don't mind playing a wildcard for your meal, and into hummus, by all means, roll the dice with this place. If you're like me and expect to get the meal you ordered after repeated clarifications, move a little further down the road.
Bartender Amy take advantage of costumers who does not speak English. Very bad service.

I brought my friend here from Chelsea to show him that Brooklyn is cool which was kinda a mistake.  The market is  beautiful architecturally but dark inside and some of the vendors are delivering way below par. We first walked into Cecconi's hoping to score a table waterside at 3PM for an afternoon desserts and cappuccino, iced coffee.  The waiter outside in a snooty voice sent us over to the hostess far inside.  The hostess said we don't allow tables just for dessert and coffees.  Really?? at 3 PM on Wednesday afternoon when all the tables are empty?  So we left and decided to get something in the market to take outside since it was a gorgeous day and the bridge and water views were spectacular.  Breads Bakery is nothing like the Manhattan Breads.  No rugelach, no babka by the slice.  I was told that because of the impending Jewish holidays there would be no rugelach???  We  had an apple ganache which was pretty in presentation but way too sweet.  The chocolate chip cookie was dry and ovebaked. Most everything in Time out is overpriced.  Theres an interesting assortment of food vendors but for what is essentially "take out" or self serve cafeteria style its below par service and way overpriced. The tables outside were dirty and we has to pass over a few to find one that was clean. Then we decided to explore "Empire stores" in the same complex.  The stores are only J Crew, West Elm, Feed and a small jewelry vendor.  Not really a great shopping experience either.

CLOSED without posting on line. Arrived and the people at the entrance said mechanical problems forced closing for many days.  When asked why it was not posted on their FB page or on their phone message, they said it was not their jobs.  Time Out should stick to media.  They have no business running retail.

The food is good. It's very noisy and a bit hard to put together a complete meal- like hard to get a salad with main course. Food in one line, drinks in another line etc... View from 5th floor is very nice.

Hm... so this is gonna be kind of a different review from me, I guess. I'm actually not trying to review Time Out Market New York, which in itself, is a very unique food hall that has all the offerings you could ask for. I am actuall trying to review a certain restaraunt in Time Out Market New York called Little Ada, a hummus bar. It's a quaint little place in the market, with quite a variety of options. The staff behind the counter were very kind, and I ordered the Chicken Shwarma. That being said, the prices were EXTREMELY high, a big reason for why I did not give it as many stars as I would have liked. My shwarma cost $16, and despite the amount of food being a little more than a normal shwarma order, it was still not justifiable to be that much. Along with this, the wait time was fairly long, taking around 11 minutes to finish my order while other restaraunts in the market took significantly less time to prepare food. Ultimately, if the food hadn't been so expensive with the wait time being a bit shorter m, I would've definetely given it more stars, but in total, it is a solid restaurant that I do recommend to individuals visiting the market.

Great Location , Great Venue !! We needed this in Brooklyn! Had an amazing night with friends . Food selections were very cool, something for everyone. Bar vibe was awesome , Marisa , our bartender was outstanding ! Super friendly and very professional ! Our new go to place ! Thank you TIME Out !!!

Went to the Brooklyn Bridge this weekend on Saturday around 3 pm. The place was really nice it reminded me of a upscale food court of a mall. I went to the rooftop to order two beers and female bartender with the glasses was only friendly with the white clientele around the bar. When i got to the bar me and my boyfriend were at the end of the bar next to the sign and she looked our way 5x and not even a hello from her. After 10 min of being ignored we came to the area she was in and still not even a smile or a hello its like me and my boy friend were not even there. I got upset cause three white girls came to the same spot i was in and she went up to them introduced herself and set napkins for them and took they order. We were finally helped after the bar was empty and her introduction was Not a hi but what do you want which was very rude to me. I ordered two Brooklyn Lager and left her no tip. She should learn more people skills

Me and my family had a terrible experience at the Time Out Bar in the 5th floor roof area. I was going to order cocktails for my wife, myself, and a friend but for some reason all three bartenders at the time refused to talk to me. They would take order from all people around me but would avoid my attempts to call. I got really frustrated, tried to go to the left, to the right, but I could not have one of them to take my order. 25 minutes later I called my wife and my friend and we all made gestures and called attention of the bar staff which finally talked to us with very annoyed facial expressions. They took our order, made the drinks very fast but they tasted terrible - overly sweetened and very alcoholic. I was so frustrated after that trying to find a reason that I couldn't go back and ask them why they did what they did. Could that be because we're South-Americans and were speaking Portuguese between ourselves? I clearly cannot see the motivation behind this weird and disgusting behavior. I'm not going back to that bar and I would like that all staff who were working there on 7/3/2019 between 7:30pm and 9:00pm read that and rethink the way they treated me and my family.

I'm charged $30 to be condescendingly told it was a cashless establishment and that I was restricted from bringing in food from the Market into another area of the building where my family was already seated. Don't attempt to do better here because this place already serves garbage food from a garbage magazine for garbage people.

It's a great outing! I've been there a few times. It's great for anytime. At lunch we enjoyed taking the delicious food outside and eat at the picnic tables overlooking the water. Saturday night I loved having the dinner outside in the terrace upstairs while we listened to live music and enjoyed the view of the city and the bridge. I love this place!

Overpriced foods, $15 for a small piece of avocado toast from Avocaderia, $8 for a one bite fried rice ball. $19 for a small rice bowl literally finished in five bites from Bessou. And the ramen from Taka is bland. Spent $80 dollars with the wait time from three different vendors. I'd rather use that money to go have a decent meal inside a restaurant and no wait time. Oh the food is not bad, but the whole experience was unpleasant to eat there. It's worse than smorgasbord, at least they give you decent portions there. Not fulfilling at all! Did I mention Bessou gave me the wrong order with 30mins wait time. Never go back there again.
Ate at Center Cut which was pretty good.

I've dealt with many a NY food hall  experiences and have come to expect the same places with like 10 tables to share will everyone come in the city so I came here with pretty low expectations. But you know what, I was dead ass wrong. They have places that are in the city that usually have long lines. Clever right?!  So I went on a day that's freakin gorgeous outside and expected to have to stand while I eat and lose half of my food from people knocking into me. I was wrong again. It wasn't that crowded. I sat down and ate like a human. I went to Jacobs pickles bc I live in Brooklyn and don't have the time to go allll the way up to wherever they are and wait in an endless line. But now I know why there's a line. Their honey chicken biscuit sandwich is so freakin out of line for being so tasty. Like borderline rude. Piles of pickles  and yummy honey and super crispy chicken. Their Mac and cheese was also ridiculous. They set the bar so high for southern food that the line is a dot to all of us. I also had an ice cream sandwich from ice and vice and I wasn't had about it. I'll be coming back every freaking day until I can't fit into my clothes
No comment
beautiful place, tons of food offer, very friendly staff, view from the rooftop is amazing. definitely a destination to check out.

This place is so cool! Go to the rooftop during sunset for a beautiful view of the city. We went on a Saturday night during a holiday weekend and it was very busy, but we easily found a place to sit and eat. Only complaint is the limited bathroom situation.
This place is like paradise. It has a great vibe. People are the best (Brooklyn). The food is amazing. So many options to choose from.

You can't beat the views at this lovely waterfront park establishment.  The design and set up are great too. BUT the food is pretty subpar.  First of all, the booths on the first floor are pretty dirty.  All the vendors could use a lesson in public appearance and sanitary conditions.  food is sloshed and dripped all over.  The food prep areas are a mess.  It's very unappealing.  I tried something from nearly every vendor as we spend 3 days there for the photoville exhibit....the fried veg gyoza from Mr. Taka Ramen which took 25 min to get (reminder this is a take away food court) tasted horrible like over fried dry hard dense dough with a little slimy cabbage inside.  I tried the Fiesta bowl from Bklyn Wild...disappointing vinegary dressing over cold quinoa...so boring.  Everything is about $5-10 to expensive.  Go for the view.  Bring your own food.

They don't have the best selection of foods, but it's a pretty solid place for tourists. Gets packed quickly and it's small. It can be difficult to find a seat. Food takes a pretty long time to come out- I was surprised, but they give you a bell so you can walk around, look at the stores or order other foods while waiting. Pretty cool place to visit at least once. Fyi, make sure you utilize the bathroom before you come because the line can get LONG. Love the West Elm here too! Icecream place near breads is pretty good.

Have only tried 2 places here--Bessou (Japanese homestyle, tried chicken karaage) and Little Ada (hummus bar, tried the fava bean hummus).  Both had tasty food, with Bessou an 8/10 and Little Ada a 7/10 rating in our book.  However, both were close to $20 with the tipping (why a 15-25% tip is needed for your counter pickup is unclear).   Bessou was probably worth it due to the good portion size, but Little Ada definitely NOT for a small serving of hummus (with a sprinkling of asparagus) and small pita bread; I took a look at the same dish from their restaurant and the portion size at Time Out New York is way smaller.

Place was amazing, food was so good. But they only have 4 stalls in the restroom in the men's and women's. With all these dining options and bars it was crazy, lines ridiculous. They should really re-think this!
No comment
Like everything else in Brooklyn... overhyped and overpriced... The chicken at David Burke was subpar at best, was served with shredded lettuce from McDonald's, and took forever to be served.

Overall, we had a great experience at the Time Out Market until we made our way up to the rooftop to grab some drinks at the bar. The bartenders were VERY rude and insulting. I accidentally mispronounced the drink name and the bartender pointed it out to us in a very nasty way. We also had another question about a drink and the bartenders respond was "Wow I guess you guys really can't read". Your job is to know some information about the drinks you are serving! We were buying bottles and the bartender handed us glasses that were dirty and still had lipstick marks on them from previous customers. Don't you know you should wipe off glasses to get rid of extra marks? When we asked them for different glasses the bartender pretended to put our glasses back but still gave us the same glasses with an even bigger attitude. I thought maybe this bartender was having a bad day since the service we received from this person was terrible but when we went back to get some more drinks another bartender treated us just as terrible. If you have the patience to put up with rude, nasty, insulting bartenders then this is a great place. The bartenders don't even look you in the eye or say hi to you. Luckily we were with great company so we looked past all those things but if your going to be rude to customers in the bartending industry then maybe this is not the job for you. The choices in the food court and servers keeping the food court clean were so friendly and helpful! Keep up the great work .. maybe you can spread some cheer up to those bartenders at the rooftop bar.

Great selection of food. My kids had ramen and they loved it. Although the pasta at felice was ok, the cashier was extremely rude when I grabbed another fork. I was paying for my meal and if I needed another fork there was no need to be rude to a paying customer over an extra fork. He should find another line of work where it does not include dealing with customers. There are plenty of selections at the time out market, just stay away from felice.

Wow!  I went with pretty low expectations and was completely blown away!  The chefs truly represent the best of the NYC, there is literally something for everyone and each bite was better than the one before!  Plus the bar upstairs with views of the city!  A great day out, night out, whatever out.  Don't miss it!
No comment

No comment

This place is a hidden gem in the neighborhood, adding it to my fav Malaysian restaurant. Apparently this is the second location of the fish market in seaport location. The Nasi Lemak here is one of the best dishes I've had! Also the pork belly pot is so tasty, definitely will order again for comfort food. Stuffed eggplant is delicious for starter! Will come back again!
The soup here was incredibly salty and spicy without having much flavor to it besides an oily flavor. Do not recommend

Just had an amazing dinner here. We ordered the Yummy Noodles (not pictured), Chow Kueh Teow (not pictured), and the Nasi Lamak and all were delicious. Very authentic. Great customer service and can't wait to try their Beef Rendang.
Food is as good as the original Fishmarket. Fantastic service -- Heather is a gem. Can't wait till they have their full liquor license!

best southeast asian food i've had in the city. authentic and literally made by the owner's mom. friendliest staff. for first timers, recommend the chicken curry, perfectly executed. classics like beef rendang and curry laksa also amazing. gotta go back and try more. also not a bad place to grab a drink.

This place is a must visit. I always have to get Mama's Curry and the fried rice with sausage.. Both are a-ma-zing!! The fried rice is crispy and comes with sauce to dip in if you want to add some heat. Everything here is just mouth-watering great.
We ordered the Curry Laksa, Stuffed Eggplant, and Pork Belly Pot. Everything was delicious, and we're already looking forward to coming back! The staff was also very attentive and friendly.

Great, special (and I assume authentic) food. Ordered the rice, which as prior reviews note, was unique (in a good way), the chow kueh teow, and the nasi lemuk. Recommend all 3. Great service. Well deserved 5 star reviews.
great food and very personal touch. feels like authentic home cooking and you can even get a table as a walk in! great spot, will be coming back
Adore this place and the owners! As tradition, they occasionally give our free sake shots and the food was just as good as the Fidi location.

best fried rice I've ever had. Believe the hype! I haven't been to the original location and like how quiet this one was when I went on a Sunday early evening since I prefer a more relaxed vibe. Service was great! If you can't handle medium-spicy food, ask your server what dishes to avoid
Delicious food, spicy but amazing beef rendeng and crispy fried rice! Fast service and it all pairs well with Asahi.
The Beef Rendang and the Chow Kueh Teow were excellent but the Curry Laksa was outstanding. Excellent service and just an all around great vibe. They've got something special going here.

If you have ever been to the original hole in the wall location in Seaport then you know you can't go wrong here. Rough around the edges inside, but the food more than makes up for it. No hard liquor license yet, but you can expect some free sake shots over Jamison as an alternative.

Never left a yelp review but stumbled upon this hidden gem on Uber Eats and had to talk about how incredibly flavorful all the dishes are! We are very picky about food and this place is 100% worth the rave. We ordered the eggplant, bok choy, lasa, and shrimp fried rice. Everything was amazing but particularly the texture of the fried rice is too good to pass.
No comment

No comment

The appetizers? Incredible. The bread? Nice touch. Wine? Maybe not like the greatest but totally solid. Cocktails? Good. Getting a reservation? Better than most. But skip the pasta. I know it's counterintuitive to skip the pasta at an Italian place but honestly everything else is WAY better and the pasta is just ok. Thank me later

The food was good, nothing amazing or show stopping but enjoyable. The ambiance was lovely and the cocktails were delicious. Service was great.
No comment

This place is so cute and the service is always very accommodating and nice. But the food has been very underwhelming the past few times I've been here. It's a shame because it has so much potential, but it's just not consistent. I did not enjoy the polenta and kale at brunch - nothing but a kale flavor without any of the good parts of polenta. My friend and I could barely eat it. And while the agnolotti was good the first time I had it, when I went back on my birthday, it tasted like it was reheated and lacked flavor.
No comment

About a decade ago when I first moved to Fort Greene I went to La Rina where a jerky host made me vow to never return. I kept that vow even though neighbors were in love with this spot. I just didn't get the fuss. Well last fall I was looking for a dinner close by and the loveliest hostess said we were in luck, and assured us it would only be about 10 minutes for a table to clear in the garden. It was a wonderful dinner with tasty pasta, appetizers, and wine. Friendly staff and romantic ambience. I can't believe what I've been missing.
No comment

A delightful spot for beautifully simple and delicious Italian fare, whether with a group or solo. I started with a glass of vino rosato, followed by the fried zucchini blossoms and ending with the smoked spaghetti. By the end, my lips were coated in olive oil in the best way. A great neighborhood spot to enjoy a meal!
No comment

We made dinner reservation for a table in the back patio (the front patio has less of a secluded feel) on a Friday evening. It's great to dine alfresco! This was the first time I tasted a draft Italian lager; I liked it. After checking out the two red by the glass,  my dining companion preferred the Primo Segno. The Negroni was of course wonderful. The complimentary bread was very delicious!  Of the antipasti we ordered,  the delicata squash and the maitake mushroom were both excellent. The little gem lettuce salad was very fresh, albeit with a tad too much dressing. For pasta, the Clam Tonnarelli with thicker noodles and tastier, creamy sauce stood out better than the Smoked aglio olio.  The generous portion of soft gnocchi tasted superb in a sweetish cheesy squash sauce. The  agnolotti del plum of very flavorful ravioli-like mini pouches of braised meat was also rich and yummy. These pastas were all well-made and masterful interpretations of classic Italian favorites. Aubrielle provided outstanding service.
No comment
No comment

The food and drinks were incredible. The service was even better. Informed the waiter that we wanted to take our time and we respectfully stayed no longer than two hours. Highly recommend the tiramisu
No comment

I'm very torn-- I've had LaRina a few times and while in the past I've loved it, I do feel it has gone down hill. The food is delicious but the service is meh. The breaking point was tonight when we asked for Parmesan cheese, the waiter clearly judged us and then reluctantly brought us some. We already felt quite awkward, when the waiter then bad mouthed us to the chef in Italian right in front of us, not knowing one of us spoke fluent Italian. It made us fully uncomfortable for the remainder of our meal. So uncomfortable to the point where we apologized for ordering the cheese when we left. Everyone is fully entitled to their own opinion but this should never be said in front of a customer. Overall disappointing experience.

Great food (especially the unique hickory-smoked spaghetti aglio e olio) and friendly, knowledgeable servers. I really appreciated that our server warned us that we were ordering too much food, something that servers often fail to do. Even among all the great Italian restaurants in Brooklyn, LaRina really stands out.
No comment
No comment
Really love the atmosphere, the cocktails, the service! Beautiful place, lovely back yard. Very nice pasta too. Four stars only because the pasta was not quite up to the rest of the experience.
No comment

Food was excellent but be prepared for a hefty bill. Three cocktails were $18 each. We ordered prosciutto crudo and Moradella $24 fried artichokes $17 broccolini $16 . Then three pasta courses smoked spaghetti aglio & olio $22, goat cheese ravioli $26, agnolotti del plain braised beef and chicken $25. Each was somewhat small serving but excellent. Dessert Panna cotta $10 and vanilla espresso gelato $12. Plus we had a hard time finding a bottle of red wine under $60. The one the waiter recommended was $72. Do the math that's one pricey pasta meal... for three people. Not sure but I think the bread was free ...
No comment
Their food is mediocre, and they overprice for what it is. Their pasta was actually disappointing. Good vibes, but don't recommend if you are looking for good food.

I had a great lunch at LaRina. I had stayed away because I was so sad that my favorite Clinton Hill restaurant was located in the building. I had been missing some great meals. We sat outside and it was around 35 degrees but they had a covering and heat lamps. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The menu was very appealing and we ordered a dish of the day: pancakes with raspberries and blueberries with home made cream. They were the best I've ever had. The people dining with me loved the coffee. So I went all out and ordered an Affogato and the espresso and gelato were fantastic. There is a little food shop and I plan to go back. I will say that the food is expensive, so it won't be a regular place. It was very charming and as I said the food is very good, great for a special meal.
No comment

This place is PHENOMENAL. Attended dinner here to say "See you in Rome" to my brother who is going to live there for a year, so Italian was fitting. What I loved instantly is the 3 different seating options (inside, outside-front, outside-rear garden) we were in the garden and while a little toasty is provided for me a safer dining experience. All staff were wearing masks and were so kind. We ordered apps for the table and they were delicious. I was amazed that the scallops were inside its natural shell when served and thinly sliced. I didn't try them but my brother and his wife said they were great. Apparently some things on the menu change often so order as much as you can because it may not be there next time. The pasta is made in house and fresh and it shows. I ate a ton of food and walked away still feeling pretty light. They have an extensive wine list, which includes orange wine. As a lover of wine, I'm ashamed I haven't had this wine but when I return that will change. You will definitely need a reservation for this place, they stay pretty busy and I can taste why.
Stopped in for cocktails and to watch the sunset. Amazing drinks, great service, and delicious complimentary bread!

So glad that they have two outdoor patios now. My friends and I were so hungry we ordered individual pastas...then ordered more pasta. The spaghetti e olio is always amazing! Hazelnuts?! They don't do that everywhere. It was my birthday so the pannacotta tasted even better. The salted caramel is always the best part about dinner. Go! Go! Go! The music is also always on point.

Fantastic food. The menu is concise, but it is obviously deliberate. They have just enough variety for anyone's taste, and did those things really well. Staff was amazing even though it was busy on a Friday night. It was our first time at LaRIna, but we will definitely be back!
The food is lovely. So tasty! Their olive oil with bread is on point. They have many different types of seating, like high top table, dining table, backyard, and gazebo.
No comment
No comment

Just excellent food and service compared to the more common American style Italian down the street. Cocktails are too pricey but otherwise we'll be back. Also noticed the same year and bottle of wine down the street was $34 but $60 here. Not a good value. We'll be back, but will stick to water only.
No comment

This was a beautiful and delicious meal! The fresh pasta dishes are creative and so tasty! The smoked spaghetti is a must try as is the tagliatelle with hake. Good wine, creative apps, cheese plates and decadent desserts--such a good find! Definitely try the olive oil cake with passion fruit sauce! Yum. Great outdoor dining set up with cozy booths and heat lamps and a nice backyard garden too!

One of my favorite restaurants. Everything I've ever had here has been delicious. I love the rotating seasonal menu. It means I can return again and again and have something new and tasty. The menu is inventive. The atmosphere is great. Everyone is nice. Good drinks. Reasonably priced. Love it.

Food and service were great! However the place could use a good cleaning. Floors, baseboards , bathroom dirty. They need to pressure wash those floors which is really easy to do and detail the place on a day off.
No comment

Great little place! Felt like the ambiance was cute and they accommodated our group. The appetizers were spectacular - the sweet potato croquettes were amazing!!!! I liked my main entree a little less (smoked cauliflower pasta) but the appetizers killed it for me.

Came here last night to watch the euro final. I thought the game was gonna be shown in the restaurant but we were mistaken and they were playing it in the back patio. We quickly ordered food in anticipation of watching the second half of the game. We ordered the cucumber salad, the fior di zucca chips, the gnudi, and braised beef agnolotti. Considering the game was on things came out at weird times (we didn't mind we understand the situation and we're actually full and needed a break in between). But everything was presented beautifully and tasted fantastic. I especially loved the agnolotti which reminded me of the Neapolitan pasta alla genovese but reimagined. The gnudi were perfectly made and soo cheesy and pillowy almost like a matza ball with the most delicious sauce! I used the table focaccia to fare la scarpetta with it-- amazing. The cucumber salad was very unique. So delicious I completely forgot to take pictures! I love how everything was authentically Italian but creatively executed. Excellent food, service, and national pride! Forza azzurri!!
most fantastic pasta ever--chef silvia is a genius and an icon and i'm so grateful i got to eat here
No comment
No comment
No comment

My wife and I hosted a blessing for our daughter in LaRina's garden, and it was truly perfect. The food was great - from antipasti, a choice of two pastas, then a second course and dessert - everything was delicious. We got a lot of comments from our guests about how good the food was. The service was spectacular as well. Everyone working there was very friendly and easy to work with. LaRina was also great about catering to our guests' dietary restrictions ... we had a vegan, people who are gluten free, etc., and all were well taken care of. Grazie!

No comment

During our visit at larina my boyfriend and I experienced below average service. We came for the lasagna that had been highly reviewed on social media only to find out the item not listed on the menu. We ordered two other pasta dishes as a substitute and were okay with our choices until we noticed our server taking much better care of the guests seated next to us. Our server was extremely short with us and engaged in as minimal conversation as possible.  He advised the table next to use that the lasagna was not on the menu but very popular - he failed to share this information with us. Our service also failed to bring bread to our table but strangely remember to bring it to the other tables in our section. Our server did not refill our water during our meal and ever brought out additional staff when he brought us the check. The additional staff stood around our table until we had paid our bill. 1 stars because the pasta was good, 0 starts for service.

Awesome Italian Food. The patio in the back is great and cozy. Polite and very kind staff. We had great time.
No comment
No comment

We have been ordering delivery from here for all of quarantine and finally went in person and it was even better than we expected and we had really high expectations. They have an amazing wine list and give great recommendations. My husband has been saying it's the best lasagna he's ever had in his life for a year so having it in person was amazing. The bread is amazing and unlimited. The pastas are always fresh and we've never ordered something we didn't like.
LaRina Pastificio & Vino is unbelievable. The price is right. I remember that Octopus was just incredible. The team was extremely courteous and service is impressive. You won't be sorry.

This place has a nice ambiance. The bread and drinks were delicious. However, I ordered the ravioli and the actual pasta was good, but it was swimming in oil. So much so that my face felt oily afterwards and it hurt my stomach. I think it could have been better for being $23.
No comment
Te bread was great! The fish pasta was overly oily and salty. Absolutely disgusting. I've never been able to not finish a bowl of pasta until this restaurant.
No comment
No comment

Unbelievable. Everything we ate was perfect, from the bread at the beginning of the meal to the octopus to the untouchable pasta dish -- we got the wrong one by mistake (no fault of the staff, my boyfriend haphazardly pointed out selection out on the menu so as not to mispronounce, which is not the clearest way to order) and it was SO GOOD that I was thrilled we didn't get our original selection, although I'm sure that would have been delicious too. The staff was so warm and lovely, helpful and elegant yet unpretentious. Answered our questions with eagerness and aplomb and suggested a great wine for us. We were blown away. And the prices were excellent for what we received. Run, don't walk! An absolute hidden gem in Fort Greene.

Beautiful restaurant with very friendly staff. The negroni on tap was AWESOME! Our appetizer was so good I could have ordered three more. If you love a good meat/cheese play, try the prosciutto salad. The runny cheese served with it was the perfect compliment to an awesome dish. Then our pastas were very nice, also. The spaghetti was cooked perfectly al dente. The lasagna was rich and heavenly although lacking salt, in my opinion. This restaurant deserved at least a four star rating until dessert came. The eggplant mousse was bizarre. I know what you're thinking - that sounds TERRIBLE so why did I order it? Well, I was intrigued. But it really missed the mark and was quite unappealing. Crumbly bits of pound cake, peaches and then the grey eggplant mousse....yeah...stick with the homemade pasta.
Our waitress last Sunday around noon was so sweet and very good at her job. The food was very good as well I got the lasagna and it filled my up for the rest of the day.

One of the best meals I've recently had, hands down if talking Italian. Stuffed zucchini flowers were good, but great when paired with the Italian draft beer (birra Antoniana - such a beautiful color too). Hickory smoked spaghetti with olive oil and garlic had beautiful depth and flavor (especially comparing it to my homemade non-smoked version from last night). And the sorbet made from Sicilian citrus took me away to the coast (especially after watching the documentary How to Live to 100 on Amazon Prime). It went amazing with the bubbles of the Italian sparkling water. Perfect destination for a bike ride from Gramercy!!! (Michael at the bar was so pleasant as well)

Delicious pastas and mains, loved the back patio with heat lamps for every table. Service was professional and attentive. Will absolutely return.

I just came back from a night out for my birthday at LaRina. Our waitress was excellent & polite. The food was beautiful. But what totally ruined this special night was the manager coming over to our table and rudely asking us to leave like we'd been there too long. There were many tables in the restaurant free. She wasn't polite in her conversation. She acted like we "should've known" that we needed to go. When I addressed her rudeness she got even more "stank" and said that she didn't think she was rude. Her tone and aggressiveness totally ruined our outing for my birthday. I will never go there again based on that treatment. We spent over $200 at the restaurant, and THAT'S the way we're treated in return? No thanks. The customer is always right. And the worst thing you can do is to make them feel like they aren't welcome to enjoy themselves.

One of the best Italian restaurants I ever ate. Definitely worth a special trip to Brooklyn

I went to this place on Monday for a quick dinner and the place is really nice. Waiters are friendly but a little bit aloof even if the night wasn't that busy. Wine list is good but I expected to find more italian options and no US wines. Pasta was yummy but the portion a little bit small for the price.

This is my favorite spot in the neighborhood. The food is excellent, my favorite is the burrata followed by the smoked spaghetti. They have a nice patio situation, but we love our take out as well. The market is amazing too!

So happy to see LaRina open for delivery and take out right now. The wine selection is amazing, and I can't get enough of the cheese from their market. The smoked spaghetti is my favorite on the menu, so I'm happy that's included on the take out menu! Trying out some of the other market provisions from Italy since I have so much time at home to cook now :) Can't wait to dine in once restaurants open again! Highly recommend this for your local restaurant support dollars right now!

Stopped by around 430 for a cocktail - multiple parties seated at tables in the front but met by a tall man with slick hair in a jacket uneager to accommodate us because diner didn't start til 5. After agreeing that a cheese and meat plate was acceptable as the food requirement we were seated under a lovely heat lamp out front. Staff was entirely friendly and kind except for the same tall man we met at the beginning. After first being given our drinks and food the tall man came back to check in - but then refused to acknowledge us for the next 45 minutes - after our glasses sat empty for half an hour and attempting to politely gain his attention we finally were miraculously able to flag him down to order another round. After a bit another of the lovely staff checked in on us and we decided it was probably a good idea  to order another round rather than wait on the tall man again. 10 minutes after receiving our drinks tall man arrives to tell us that our table is reserved for 7pm (it is 6:50) and that there are benches to the side we can sit at (unheated now after dusk in January). No alternative was offered. No other forewarning. We took our full glasses to the benches where we sat drinking and facing a table under heaters that sat empty the entire time we finished our drinks. Avoid the pale man with slick hair and suit coat - how absurdly prudish. Unfortunate that one person can spoil a whole restaurant.

I've been to the restaurant 3-4 times before Covid and each time the food and wine were great. The lasagna and spring pasta were highlights. The market that they have been running during covid allows you to buy some really nice ingredients. The tiramisu and focaccia we bought recently were some of the best I've ever had.
No comment
Can't stop raving about my experience at LaRina. The staff was extremely knowledgeable, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming and the food was fresh and flavorful. Highly recommend! New local fav.

I can see why this place would get a lot of four and five stars. It's trendy and you think you're getting A+ food. It's not bad by any means, but there are much better Italian places in the area. We had been wanting to try LaRina for quite some time. I'd highly suggest making a reservation as our walk in attempts had failed. I ended up having the spaghetti aglio e olio and my boyfriend got the linguine al ricci di mare. The portions are really small, so would get an app. If you want bread...you have to pay for it, which is pretty absurd. My pasta itself was fine - a little bland but I did like the hot pepper hints. It's not at the top of my list to go back to. I'm glad we tried it though.

Such a cute restaurant! Was looking for a place for brunch, we first went to a restaurant down the street and the wait was about 30min-1hr long so we decided to keep walking and came across this place on yelp! I ordered the frittata which had Brussels sprouts, fried potatoes and mushroom and a side of avocados! Everything was delicious but the frittata needed a little salt! My favorite were the Brussels sprouts! I'd definitely come back  when I visit the east coast again
Food and drinks were delicious. But to be honest, I expect a little more communication and politeness from a manager of a place like that.

I haven't given 5 stars in a while but the BANANA TIRAMISU blew my tastesbuds away! Celery gin gimlet was different and delish. Lemon gigli pasta with duck ragu was satisfying but heavier than expected. The paccheri calamari pasta dish had a divine sauce. And we started with the burrata caprese which tasted as expected.  But again, it was the BANANA TIRAMISU, what a great combo, that put the dining experience over the top.

All around great experience .

Eat outdoors at your own discretion. There were cockroaches in their backyard area and in the front patio area. Waiter handled the situation terribly. He was so nonchalant, killed the bug, then went about his other tasks. No apology from the waiter or asking if we're okay and wanted to move. No one cared to say anything until I was walking out the door and voiced to the manager the lack of care and consideration for their diners. Indoors or outdoors no one wants to dine with roaches. The manager wanted to normalize this by saying "nyc is the dirtiest city in America." That may be true, but I've never dined at a restaurant and had a cockroach crawl across my table. And the waiter not even address it. They offered us free drinks and dessert in the front patio. Still cockroaches were in the front area as well. Hope you guys fix this and treat your customers better for when they are rightfully upset. Ps: I am medically allergic to roaches.

Went for Mother's Day yesterday. What an amazing meal. All the ingredients were fresh and so purposefully placed in every dish. I got the pesto gnoochi. My dad got the tortellini special which was great. The outside patio was beautiful. What a gem. Will definitely return!

Sad soggy food. And an even sadder staff. There are much nicer restaurants in the area with wait staff who want to make you feel comfortable and listen to your concerns. I would not return here after the way I was treated and on top of that how unappetizing the food was anyway.

Bought food from the take out shop and have to say it's so much better than the over salted meals they usually dish up there. Not sure what goes on in their head? But like a lot of other New York restaurants they seem to think salt is good - tell my doctor that and it renders it awful. Take out from the store good. Restaurant cooked bad. What happened to the days when you used to have salt and pepper on the table as opposed to some unqualified chef thinking they know what is best for you
Awesome new addition to ft. Greene! Very authentic Italian food. Really nice interior with laid back feel. Food is amazing. All f it. You can't go wrong.

Charming little spot with real Italians that greet you! The handcrafted pasta is super delicious and the ambiance is very warm and inviting.  Authentic experience and I'd definitely do it all over again.
My standards are high to a fault and this is in my top-5 favorite restaurants

Their specials are my go to!! They have such an amazing menu and the selection of cheese's is always spot on.  I tried things that I would've never tried before thanks to them.  The staff there is always wonderful and if you can get a spot in the backyard its probably the best part of LaRina.

Their store is fantastic and the owner is so sweet! We've tried the mascarpone ravioli and the rigatoni - both were so fresh and delicious. Their pesto trapanese is my new favorite sauce and they have a solid wine selection as well. We tried the La Rina red wine and they sold it at cost. So glad to have a local spot for fresh pasta, sauce and wine!
No comment

I really wanted to like this place. It's a really cute spot and based on reviews I had high expectations. Unfortunately, the best part of the meal was the bread. The octopus starter fell beyond flat. It was incredibly salty and the octopus tasted like it was made days in advance; it was the texture of a pencil eraser.  We shared a few pasta dishes and the only one I'd even consider again was the "nude" special pasta. It was the only one out of the three that was palatable honestly. I'm far from a discerning pasta person, but the dishes were so salty that they couldn't even be eaten. It was like the only thing they used to season anything was salt. Onto dessert where the tiramisu was fair -- I've definitely had better. The Italian "donuts" were awful. While everything else was overpowered by salt, these chocolate filled donuts had an unidentifiable creme that was light brown and appeared to be chocolate but had zero taste.  In any case, I don't know if it was just a bad night for them, but I likely wouldn't recommended and wouldn't return.  I gave the extra star because our server was nice and attentive.
Love this place, it has a great ambiance and helpful, welcoming servers. I usually get the spaghetti aglio e olio, it's delicious. Great wine and desserts too.

Lasagna is amazing, but the service from on particular waitress is abysmal. I ordered focciccia * to start* with a bottle of wine. Then ordered 2 lasagnas. Everything arrived before the bread. Then I reminded her I ordered focaccia and she brought with out olive oil. I the asked her for the check and to wrap food up to go. And she put both lasagnas in one container and placed it on he table with out a bag. It was hilarious and ridiculous. The food here is amazing but her particular service needs a big adjustment!!!
