Food and service are both great. We made reservations and we still had to wait a bit for the table. It was packed. Tight space but with good company any meal is enjoyable. We ordered some appetizers - the burrata and bruschetta were both good. We ordered some white wine for the table which was nice and fruity. For the main course we all ordered different kinds of pasta I enjoyed mine which was the langoustine fusilli, others enjoyed the sea bass in a white lemon sauce, roasted chicken with potatoes. Their lemon cheese cake was my absolute favorite dessert. It was so light and airy. Everyone also enjoyed the tiramisu and cannoli I had a bite of everything and it was fantastic.

What a gem of a Italian restaurant we found this week in NYC! I thought that they had authentic Italian recipes at least from my perspective & fresh ingredients. Loved the bruschetta and Ravioli but do save some space for the incredible Tiramisu dessert that they make directly at your table - make sure your camera is ready! Note that the restaurant has limited seating so get there a little early or call ahead for a reservation - else you'll be in for a wait. The service staff is polite, efficient & quick so you should not be in line for long.

LOVE this place! Super authentic and the service is awesome. This was my first time trying octopus burger which was solid and it came with a great side of potatoes. Id definitely come back.

This restaurant is really cute and there's great service. We came here for lunch and the lunch specials were really great! Select items on the menu, including most of the pastas and some of the appetizers are around $13, basically half off the normal menu price. We ordered the grilled calamari to share and I got the green tagliatelle with wild boar ragu. The calamari was pretty good, it tasted fresh and was well complimented by the guacamole. The pasta was perfectly Al dente and the sauce tasted really rich and meaty, although the wild boar just tasted like normal pork. I really enjoyed the added flavor of the black truffle as well. The servings are really generous, and this place is definitely great for the value if you come for the lunch specials.

Amazing food but long wait even with a reservation. We probably got seated 30 mins after our reservation time. Sat in the park-let which was cozy (maybe too cozy for some people). I ordered the tagliatelle Verdi and it was super good. The boar ragu tasted so well with the pasta and sauce. Everyone enjoyed their food. Decent service. Would highly recommend.

I have to give this place a 1 because it was far from the hype. When you see a place 4.5 and people waiting it must be good. However the food was extremely salty and the salad was loaded with dressing. It didn't even taste good, plus we crammed into a shoebox. It was not good honestly I have had so much better Italian like Don Angie.

The food was really great! I love the pan dishes. The outside seating is beautiful, everything matches. The interior is nice too but small. The staff was also really nice and funny, and even charged my phone!

The ravioli was soo good and filling! The toasted bread that comes with every meal was just perfect for soaking up the amazing ravioli sauce! I tried this place years ago and haven't stopped thinking about this spot since! I finally got to revisit last week and it didn't disappoint. They've expanded their indoor seating out onto the streets and sitting outside was the perfect setting to catch up with friends over pasta and a bottle of white. I would highly recommend the ragu - highlight of the dinner!

Sooo good!! Looks small and random on the outside but on the inside it's homey and cozy, maybe a little cramped. Lovedd both our pastas and the desert was amazing! Our server was great and everything was clean and neat. Some of the best pasta I've had!

I loved it here! The food was immaculate. Even though portions were small, the food was really filling! Love it when deception works in your favor. The only reason I give it four stars was because it took quite a long time (30 minutes) to get us seated (on a Sunday evening) and the service was very slow. We had to ask our waiter repeatedly for our items (bread, water, sauces, etc.). But I will come back! It was delicious and I will chalk it up to just an off day with the service.

Some of the best Italian I've ever had. Maccheroni alla Norma and the caponata/hummus/guacamole trio are both fantastic, especially the caponata.

I had the Tagliatelle Verdi con Ragu' di Cinghiale Aromatizzato alle Erbe e Tartufo. It was great paired with a glass of La Staffa Verdicchio Di Jesi. I recommend booking a reservation the place is small and intimate.

The food here is good, if i am in the neighborhood I would eat here its a no brainer.  Service is great as well, the ambiance depending on what day of the week or time you go is a bit busy and the restaurant itself is small. I try to go when it isn't crowded or too busy.  Many tourists do come here but again its no where near a tourist trap, the food is good and healthy as can be for eating out.

Truly horrible takeaway. The Caesar salad greens were unwashed so there was grit when eaten. Ordered the cacio e pepe, the pasta was fine but there was barely any bottarga to be found, mostly heavy cream. 2 stars for the kind waiters, but 0 for the food.

Service and ambiance was amazing!! Love the cozy outdoor seating and friendly Italian waiters. Cute date night spot. Pasta itself was okay. Nothing too special. Burrata was tasty. Lots of options though and still pretty good!

Sicilian Italian - not the best, probably will not be returning. We sat in the outdoor cabin seating which was pleasantly warm and our server was very nice, but the food was a bit disappointing. We started with the bruschetta of which it's toast was very toasty and didn't have much oil or spices to integrate the vegetables. For mains we ordered the Gnocchi and Linguine - they had a Gnocchi Special with Fish which our server insisted we order and unfortunately the fish had such a fishy flavor which offset the meal. Lastly for dessert ordered the tiramisu (they make it right in front of you!) - but it was pretty bitter and not the best I've had
I would give all stars to meatballs and lasagna! meatballs are full of truffle taste which i looovee. Lasagna is so good, with the right amount of cheese and sauce.
Food is pretty good but I wouldn't say it's one of the best Italian places I've had. Overall it's pretty solid but nothing to write home to mom about

Incredible Italian food in the heart of SoHo,only reason why it doesn't get five stars is because of the limited dietary restrictions the kitchen can accommodate. Don't skip on the appetizers or dessert, you'll want to taste it all. We started with Zucchini fritters, then tried two pasta dishes which were both phenomenal and ended with the cannolis. Everything was incredible!

Great little restaurant with amazing food, ambiance and service. The swordfish and Buffalo Mozzarella, spaghetti with squid ink and pasta with langostino and burrata were all amazing, can't wait to go back!

Just missed the mark. Some dishes were fire like the green pasta and ravioli! But some other dishes that I tried were under seasoned and bland. The swordfish pasta with lemon was straight up just not it. Looked good and insta worthy though & vibes and service were good.

Looked up this place on yelp and I heard a lot of good stuff about it, but nothings true until you tried it but the staff are extremely kind and served us really good food which they recommended us. A guy named PhilP guardone which is the owner and gave me and my family 2 free meals. He told us he had 5 restaurants and you need a lot of passion to do it overall the workers were so kind I would go again.

My daughter insisted that I try Piccola Cucina Osteria and I glad she did.  The service and the food were phenomenal!!  The Sicilian sardine appetizer/salad was absolutely delicious!  The seafood risotto was even better - it was simply terrific!  Great flavors in both dishes!  Great rustic bread to start and I don't know what the spread was that they served with the bread but it was fantastic too!  The place was packed and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves and why not with food that good!!  Some reviewers have said that the seating is tight.....they are not kidding.  It is a small restaurant and seating is very, very cozy - but I would encourage you to look past that and simply enjoy some phenomenal food!!!  A wonderful experience and I would definitely go back!

Came for dinner on Wendsay night. The food was great, wine was delicious too. Very intimate setting and great hospitality. I would have eaten anything off the menu because everything sounds good and I'm sure it is.

Absolutely delicious! From the appetizers to the wine to the mains, we were not disappointed. We had the stuffed calamari (delicious) the grilled meatballs, and the beef bruschetta for appetizer. Everything came out quickly and was super fresh. For dinner I had the octopus burger which I've never had before but decided to try and I was SO pleasantly surprised!! I would 1000% go back again!

Liked the octopus a lot and it was not rubbery! The pasta was okay I was a bit worried because it smelled a bit too fishy to me (wasn't sure if it was because of the hot summer temperatures which made the crawfish seem a bit off).

Overall a very enjoyable experience. The server could have been more attentive, could have actually known something about the $125 bottles of wine I was trying to decide between... but ultimately the food was tasty, the ambiance great, and well we didn't go wrong with the wine (Slovenian white, delicious).
Amazing food. Great quality. Lobster linguine and gnocchi both incredible but the ultimate highlight of the meal was the lemon cheesecake.

The restaurant is really cozy and aesthetically pleasing. The wait staff is fast, attentive, and provide good service. We got the bruschetta with capriccio and the daily special tuna tar tar. BOTH were excellent and very good. For our entrees we got the daily fish (white) which was in some white lemon sauce and a red sauce pasta. The pasta texture was really good but thought the red sauce was just mid ‍. The daily fish was also okay, the sauce was good but the fish itself seemed overworked and dry inside. Might come back, might not.  Not a must try though.
The owner is extremely sweet and the pasta is excellent. Table side tiramisu is also a must! Highly Reccomend!

Bruh this place is not worth the price. Too expansive for the salty semi hard noodles. If it's half the price the. I'll rate a 3.5 star. I just don't understand why people say it's good. Probably never had a good pasta in their life. I mean truffle meatballs? U mean grass and burned burger meat? I don't see truffles anywhere. Watch out for restaurant that use fancy names and ask for a 50% markup. I just ate at the place and the more I think about it the more mad I am. I don't get any comfort from the food I ordered even though I was super hungry. Never coming back here again.

Found this last minute! SO HAPPY I FOUND THIS PLACE! Everything was AMAZING! Everything we ordered was PERFECT! Food came out quick probably because we went around 9:45pm. Bread for the table was fresh and hot! But I also got the bruschetta which was on the same bread but I wasn't complaining! I was a little skeptical at first when I saw the sword fish with mozzarella but that's a MUST HAVE! I would order that again and again! It wasn't heavy just perfect! Lobster linguine was good, only thing I have to say is the pieces of lobster meat I wasn't a big fan I thought they would use fresh meat from the actually lobster but it was still good! The grilled Sea Bass was bomb! And the grilled eggplants and zucchini side was also AMAZING!! I saw that they had canoli on Yelp but I guess it was too late for dessert. They didn't give us a dessert menu nor asked if we wanted any. But overall I think I just found my favorite restaurant in Soho!

A classic place in NYC for authentic Italian food. Fair prices (especially during lunch) but the best part was their special menus. I had their truffle pasta and it was amazing! There were A LOT of truffle shavings on the pasta. This will be on one of my "Must Go To" list.

Ordered the Insalata Greca, all feta and tomato with a few cucumber, no seasoning or dressing. We spend great night the food and service excellent, food very teast we really enjoy the food i highly recommend to vist this place.

Fuckkinnnngggggggggg phenomenal Italian, I went with a friend of the owner and they just kept delivering free meals until our ordered meals came; we were already full. Then the desert on the house came. Marvelous experience!!!
I'd love to come back to try the different cuts of steak, pasta, and the tiramisu!

Absolutely loved this place. I had the lobster pasta and everything was perfectly cooked. Some places get the grilled lobster too overdone but here it was absolutely perfect and the pasta and sauce were perfect too. The waiter was fabulous and very attentive and helpful. Outdoor seating area was super cute too. I am usually a pretty tough critic of Italian food and this place was absolutely one I would go back to again!!

One of the best seafood pasta I have had, the pasta here tastes so good and even though there was really loud music and the environment wasn't upscale or fancy I would come back for more and almost want to try out the entire menu. The pasta here is extremely fresh and the fish as well since I ordered two fish pastas : cappelletti with sea bass and almonds and spaghetti with sea urchin cream and raw fish on top. As a big sushi fan I loved the spaghetti and thought it was an amazing way to combine the two. Im so glad I got to come here randomly and tried their food. It's super delicious.

In a row of restaurants on Spring St. this one is the one you want to have reservations for. My husband and I came here to celebrate our anniversary. It is a cute but tiny little restaurant. We were seated outside in this enclosed section which thankfully had air conditioning. Tables were tiny and very close together. Both the food and service were excellent! We started off the night with a bottle of wine which the waitress & hostess  helped finding one I would like. We had the stuffed calamari and salad as an appetizer. The stuffed calamari was incredible. It was stuffed with lobster and artichoke. It was cooked to perfection might have been grilled. Would totally get that the neck time we come. I was also craving a salad something light and refreshing and that's exactly what it was. It was filled with fruits and nuts but nothing too overpowering. Then for our entrees I had to get their famous linguini pasta which was the showstopper of the night. It was easily the best item on the menu. It came with a half lobster and was delicious. My husband had the shrimp pasta which was also good. For dessert we ordered the tiramisu. To our surprise it was made table side. It was simply the best tiramisu I've ever had. We had espressos to end the night. Overall great meal from start to finish!
Delicious fresh pasta. Tried 3 pastas and they all were exceptional. Not pictured was the cacio e pepe.
Excellent flavors to your taste buds! Highly recommend for all to go! Best value and quality in Manhattan! Must make reservations or come early. Line is long but worth the wait!
No comment

We ordered takeout and loved all the food.  Once we go to the restaurant for the full experience of service, ambiance and food presentation, I am sure I will increase to 5 stars.  The favs were the parppadelli pasta and osso buco raviolis.  The burrata and prosciutto was a huge tasty serving. The cavatelli was underwhelming.

One of my favorite places in Manhattan for delicious, delicious, and authentic Italian food. Between the space itself, the Italian staff and their carelessness, you really feel like you're eating out in Italy. I went recently and took arsenic and fried zucchini flowers to increase my appetite and both were delicious. The pasta is very fresh and comes in their own small pan which I think is very cold. If you order a tiramisu they will put it in front of you! Before the code, the staff used to sing and dance at dinner which was a lot of fun, but unfortunately I don't think they will do it now :(

Very small Italian restaurant in the Bowery/SOHO area. You will not be disappointed!!! My husband and I ordered the squid ink pasta and mixed fish dish and we were so impressed!! The servers are nice and they even saw my tiny note in our reservation about it being my husbands birthday! They played a happy birthday song lol and gave a delicious tiramisu dessert! We kept saying to each other while eating that we'd definitely recommend this place to other people and if we ever came back to NYC we'd definitely come back here.
Cozy and hip restaurant with delicious Italian food. Tried their Cacio E Pepe and Lamb Ragu Pasta. Both were delicious but the ragu was something else. It was out of this world!! Highly recommend!
Maybe that's why I just came from Europe (where I sampled a lot of Italian restaurants), I tasted the food in it ... everything is more salty. I did not enjoy the food, what is it?

I really love this place. It is tiny and tightly packed, so at first you might wonder "how in the world does this all come together", but it really does!  The wait-staff is super professional and long-timers, it has a great social vibe, and the food is delicious. I really love this place!

Loved this restaurant! Got the rice balls, tasty and filled well. Red sauce ball was our favorites. The scampi with red sauce was amazing. Highly recommend to get this dish. Sauce was creamy, flavorful and had nice pieces of fish. The special was pesto gnocchi with branzino pieces. This was good, but had more of a mild flavor if that is want you like.  Overall, place was excellent and so were the staff. Food came out quickly and service was 10/10.
Went here for dinner and this place was great. Amazing food and fantastic service. Highly recommend eating here

maybe I don't appreciate authentic Italian taste but between the two pastas I had it was tasty but not like I needed to eat more and more. The tartare was better than the pasta...I wanted to like everything and might try again but not as good as you would think based on the reviews

Grateful to get a last minute reservation for Thurs night, and the place was packed - busiest restaurant on the street. Very authentic with a lovely rustic feel. We sat outside in an enclosed corner banquette table with pillows, cozy and relaxing. Food was fantastic. We shared burrata, artichokes with avocado (delish), and I had the branzino which was super fresh. I tasted my friend's pasta dishes, all tasted fresh & homemade, and the sauces were excellent. Would definitely go back.
Great food! Great service! Love their wild boar pasta and tiramisu. Highly recommended

Very cute small Italian restaurant. The seats were very tight and close together which was a little uncomfortable during covid. The employees were all very friendly which is hard to find in New York. There was many seafood pasta options but I got the  Maccheroni Alla Norma Con Ricotta Salata. This was a very tasty al dente pasta. The sauce was very flavorful.

Great SoHo Italian option. The staff is incredible and the people watching is second to none. The hostess makes you feel like a family member she has missed for a long time. The food feels very homemade. The places oozes charm.
No comment

I would recommend seating outside if weather permits. Food was delicious and portions were very filling... I definitely underestimated them. Tiramisu was the highlight of our meal as they prepare it in front of you. The server did put a little too much mascarpone though.

Pasta was mediocre and my friend said hers was undercooked. We also got the stuffed calamari and it was pretty bad. Servers seemed pushy and the tables were too cramped together. I probably won't be going back.
No comment
Octopus was nice, but pasta was TOOOO salty. I love pasta and have tried lots of restaurants. But the rate of this place is too high
No comment

I don't live in NYC, but my brother does and brought me here because he loves it. Really great and fresh pastas. I tried the pasta with raw fish, which was super tasty. They also have smaller, cheaper lunch portions for a large portion of their menu, which is a great value and option if you're more price sensitive.
No comment
No comment

My teenage son and I came on a Saturday night around 6:00 and thoroughly enjoyed our meal and overall experience.  All the staff is friendly and professional.  The atmosphere is outstanding - with 3 different seating options.  We had the Sicilian Rise Balls as an appetizer which we loved.  My son had the lobster linguini and I had the Green Tagliatelle in Wild Boar Ragu' with Fresh Herb Aroma Topped with Black Truffle.  Generous portions - neither of us could finish our meal.

Stopped here for lunch on our recent trip to NYC and we were over the moon happy with the quality of food! Service was excellent as well. I was having quite a bit of trouble deciding what to order (everything sounded so good!) and the waiter helped me make a definitive decision. He was right, I loved it!  My pasta had seafood in it.  My boyfriend ordered a more traditional pasta and both of us loved our meals. We sat outdoors and it was very nice.  Paired both dishes with a nice glass of white wine.  We were treated to a dessert to finish the meal off as well, which was a nice surprise! Very authentic Italian. Would definitely recommend.
No comment
No comment

column3: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: Amazing Italian spot. You must make a reservation in advance because this place gets popping and it's not very big inside. You'll probably wait forever if you come without a reservation. cozy / homey vibe with delicious food. Everything I thought it would be !

I loved the tiramisu!!! They make it table side! The service was great. They immediately gave us a seat and it had really nice atmosphere! I wasn't the biggest fan of the vegetables lasagna but everything else was great!
No comment
No comment

Really good and authentic Italian food! The portions are decent, definitely right enough for one person. The pasta was cooked to al dente, with different sauces and flavors. The service was amazing too - got seated right away, very attentive, and followed Covid guidelines for indoor dining (ie temp checks, face masks, plexiglass dividers, minimal capacity, cleanliness). Definitely would go back again for another meal!!!
No comment

Went for a later night bite (9:30pm) and was not disappointed. Friendly and welcoming staff, despite it being a Sunday night. The tomato olive oil they serve with their house bread is INSANELY delicious. Ordered the seared tuna quinoa salad and a side of grilled vegetables, equally flavorful and fresh.
No comment
No comment
We came to this restaurant and were blown  away by the service the food and ambience.  Mario our waiter was phenomenal.  The food was absolute perfection.
We made a reservation so we didn't have to wait when we arrived. The food and service was amazing. One of the best dinners we found!!

Central location in great area off Spring St. We opted for indoor dining but the outdoor seating looked lovely and cute; looks like an equally good option, based on some reviews here. Indoor dining is well spaced with plastic separators between tables. Came here for weekday lunch. Very fair price for quantity and quality of food.  Plus there are daily lunch specials. Got the grilled octopus with burrata and fussolini with langostine. Service was very consistent and attentive. Definitely recommend.
No comment
amazing food, beautiful place, great service. definetly check out if you're looking for authentic italian
Second time dinning here. Outstanding pastas - chewy and not over cooked. Sauces are in heavier side but oh so tasty.  Will be back. Ps loved the tiramisu that's made at table side

Good, massive portion sizes. Comes with delicious bread and dip so thank you. Important to note how massive this piece of grilled octopus!!! Many restaurants skimp or cut the octopus up so you get less. Also order the homemade pasta!

Amazing service but the tables are pushed together way too much (and we're used to squeezing into tiny NYC spaces). You almost can't move your arms because the other people are literally right there. I would maybe go back for the pasta at an off-hour.
No comment

Came in here 30 minutes before closing time on a Sunday night and they gladly offered me a table. The servers were very sweet and polite. The service was spot on. Food came out quickly and very tasty. Got the ricotta ravioli.

Waited 1.5 hours for saturday dinner. The food was honestly not good as I expected. I got the lobster pasta and it was so mid. However, the tiramisu is so authentic and delicious. Would go back for that
No comment
No comment
They were kind enough to sneak my husband and I in to a quaint table when we hadn't made a reservation. Delicious food, infectious atmosphere! would definitely go back.
Cute little Italian restaurant! Very romantic spot and good is amazing! Definitely recommend

My husband and I came here for Valentine's Day dinner, dined in their outdoor heated space. We shared two appetizers, rice balls and zucchini flowers.  The rice ball was good and flavorful.  The fried zucchini flowers were too fried for our liking, the flowers didn't come through.  As for our entrees, I ordered the squid ink pasta which was good.  My husband ordered the wild boar pasta.  Both pasta were cooked perfectly, very flavorful sauce, a bit skimpy on the squid.  Ended our meal with tiramisu.  Very friendly service and staffs.
No comment

Needed something for lunch, this place looked good on Yelp. Went in and was seated quickly but on the road. This was a concern to me but it's all they had. So needless to say it was sit on the chair and table on the road or wait who knows how long until the next seat. The rating is mainly about the food. The pasta I had was amazing, it was a good portion of the lunch special. Where I think they dropped the ball was the menu & the service. The menu was hard to read and overwhelming & the server did not bring out the usual things they provide to anyone who eats there, water & the bread. Had to ask for it since I seen it at a different table. Overall it was a OK lunch.
No comment

adorable restaurant. so intimate and friendly. the staff was super helpful when it came to ordering. really small place, but gives off a great vibe right out of Italy. highly recommend. lobster pasta was incredible and the clam gnocchi may have even topped it.
No comment
No comment

Awesome food and drinks. Portion is huge. The lobster pasta is a bit more salty than I expected, and the lobster flavor is toned down because of the salty sauce. Next time I'll probably order other pasta dish. We particularly enjoyed the grilled octopus. It's very fresh, tender, and works well with the caprese salad. The fritto dish is really big so don't easily order if you don't want to stuff yourself.
No comment
The house salad was amazingly fresh and inventive, but I still dream of the bucatini alla sarde with sardines and raisins. It is briny as hell and delicious.
No comment

Even thought the place was pretty small the restaurant felt nice and intimate without feeling cramped. The bread and olive oil was so delicious. I had the pappardelle with mushroom and it was amazing! Was kinda of watery sauce, so this is great if you don't want something overpoweringly creamy. Great amount of food for one hungry person ! The creme brûlée was by far my favorite part of the meal, so creamy and sweet! Great place for a date !

We tried this restaurant for the first time tonight and I just had to rave about it. I seldom Give 5 stars to anyone bc there is always room to improve. Tonight is their first night to open since pandemic. It's a small locale so make reservations. You start of with sourdough sliced bread with an olive oil dip. We ordered the ricotta and spinach ravioli and the lobster linguine. Both dishes were superb. Each was well balanced with rich flavors. The ravioli was drizzled with a pesto sauce that was fresh and flavorful. It came with a large portion of raviolis btwn 10-12. The lobster linguine was equally delish with bold flavors. We completed the meal with a tiramisu which came in a small jar. Perfect size to share. It was rich with a top layer of premium coffee sprinkled over a light whipped cream followed by moist lady fingers followed by a richer heavier cream. Every server was attentive and created a pleasant evening making this place a 5  I highly recommend giving this place a try.

A special evening, great service and fine food. Our table was in the back near the kitchen it was loud but that added to the experience. Make sure to make reservations, we had a star sighting Whoopi Goldberg 3 tables away from us. I had the pasta with lobster and shrimp , excellent!!! Wife had eggplant entree light and tasty , hit the spot!!!  Lemon cheesecake was perfect and the cannoli fresh and tasty!!! Would definitely recommend!!!
No comment
No comment

There's a reason why it's so hard to get a reservation for this place. It's tiny, pasta sauce was amazing. But I can only give this place three stars. I ordered Linguine all' Astice. Noodles were mixed very well with tomato sauce, but the lobster was not the best I've ever had. My bf got Ravioli, ragu sauce was delish but the ricotta tasted just as ordinary, imo. Because it's so small, the experience is almost not pleasant.

Yummm!! I was craving good Italian food and it was above my expectations. Now, I want to have it everyday. 5 stars for food. 5 stars for  ambiance and 10 stars for service. Pablo was amazing and made our experience unforgettable. He is a great waiter, great photographer and great dancer :) I will miss you Pablo. He is sweet and so is the host!! All amazing. Kitchen was hustling. Please go try it. You wont regret.

LOVE this place! The octopus appetizer and the green tagliatelle with truffle cream were amazing. Big portions and great flavor and pasta texture. The only thing is that the place is super small and tight-- so it gets a little uncomfortable when people are trying to get in and out of their seats. But the food makes it worth it and the prices are great.
No comment
outside seating with AC! Cutest plates and nicest wait staff. Great meal, highly recommend as a walk in or reservation

Great lunch spot on a lazy Sunday afternoon. In addition to the small restaurant seating inside, there are a few sidewalk tables and one of those COVID pop-up booths in the street for additional seating. The food and service were great. We'll be back!

NO STARS. This experience was weird, awkward and rude overall. I went with two of my cousins. We went here for her birthday and were the first to sit down as they open at 5. At first it seemed okay, we ordered our appetizer and received it but didn't like it much so we didn't really eat it. While sitting in the small un spacious outdoor seating area/house there is only a small walk way in and out where the waiters and waitresses stood there watching us, hovering, and talking about us while doing so. They continued to look over my cousin who was facing away from them to look to see if we ate the food and talk about it as if we were not the ones paying for the meal. They continued to do this all night and keep looking over my cousins shoulder FOR WHAT ? They visibility stood behind our table watching and talking about us. Then we had a small cake w us which we put on the table, where we then could see the waiters whispering and then the waitress told the Italian lady in Spanish to go and come over to us as I am Hispanic and can understand Spanish. The lady then came over and very rudely told us their is a $5 cake fee per person if we have our own cake we were a little confused as we were unaware and asked a question in regard to if the fee applies to lighting it which she then rudely said "you didn't even ask and it's already on the table... "so they would already be charging us $5 cake fee per person for even placing it on the table even though we had not lit or cut the cake or anything yet. Fine we said we would pay the fee so we can cut it there. While the cake was in front of the birthday girl the waiter decided to come and take utensils and plates off the table mid the cake being lit already and photographs being taken. They made the atmosphere very awkward as they continued to go out of their way to be rude and whisper and give looks at us even though we were quietly sitting and did not even sing happy birthday. They took all the utensils and plates off the table so we could not even eat the cake and had to ask for them to bring utensils. The experience was awkward and rude. The food to top it off was the worst Italian food I've had by far, I'd prefer an Olive Garden than this so called authentic Italian restaurant. The appetizer bad, ravioli dry, scampi gross ! STAFF HORRIBLE ! I would never go back here again. They only were rude to us and no one else in the restaurant idk if it was our young appearance or not but they were very clearly only rude to our table and no one else's.
No comment

Pasta is the thing to get here however I think everyone is sleeping on the fish options - I got the Carpaccio trio and it was amazing. Also a big fan of the calamari. Prices here are super reasonable for the quality and portion sizes.
Sofia! Great moves keep it up. Best service ever. East side location can learn a thing or two. Great tiramisu.
The food isn't bad but very overrated . The tables are very close to each other . It's very very loud
No comment
This place has amazing pasta! I don't think you can go wrong with the menu. It gets pretty crowded and loud inside but the time I sat outside it was perfect besides the food cooling down super fast.
No comment
No comment
No comment

An excellent choice for classic real italian cuisine not american italian. Ordered the lamb ragu and squid ink pasta and both were phenomenal. Frito misto was one of the crispiest and lightest ones I've ever had and was still crispy when we got it home for takeout. Ribeye was perfect medium rare.

Cool hip cozy place. Food is good but place is tiny. If it's your birthday they do their own way of greeting you with table tapping, blinking lights and a birthday music. Everyone in the restaurant will get encouraged to sing as due to the joyous atmosphere. Worth a try!
Amazing pasta. Great, casual dining. Limited seating, but worth the wait. Will definitely go back
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Real Italian food, and excellent service. The cannoli were superb. I suggest combining with an spresso
This place is so cute as well as the street it sits on. Amazing pasta dishes and drinks. It's tiny and it's sometimes a bit uncomfortable but I don't mind as long as I get to have their food!
Waiters are nice and the vibe is good. I order the lobster pasta and couldn't finish it. The portion is larger than I thought, and the taste is not as surprising.

Wow! Talk about High quality service & food for decent prices! Service was impeccable. The pasta & the  sauce tasted so authentic! The ambience was very intimate for a nice date night. Highly recommend!

You know the pasta will be good when the staff and many guests are speaking Italian. Incredible pasta and very nice lunch deals with the $11 selections. Ordered the tagliatelle with ragu and truffles with a nice glass of wine. Delicious and the staff is so friendly. Will be back before my trip is over.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow! This has got to be one of my favorite Italian spots in the city. We got to dinner around 6pm on a Tuesday, and it was pretty empty. It started getting a little busier around 7pm. The vibe was so quaint and comfortable. The tables were spread apart decently. The staff were all also wearing masks. There was hand sanitizer at every table too. The staff were also so sweet, and explained all of the specials thoroughly along with the vegetarian options for me. We ordered a bottle of wine, Campirossi Primivito, and it was delicious and paired well with our pasta. They gave complimentary bread with an herb infused oil. The bread was so soft and fresh tasting. For my main entree I ordered Maccheroni pasta with eggplant and no ricotta. They did ask if I wanted to substitute the ricotta with something else like another cheese, but I didn't. This was such a great dish! The noodles were interesting- they were long macaroni noodles cooked perfectly. The sauce....omg the sauce was divine! The eggplant added the best flavor. Usually I get some undercooked pieces of eggplant in certain dishes but each and every bite was so consistent. Also, we didn't get rushed out of the restaurant like several other places lately. I cannot wait to come back here!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Absolutely amazing. The staff, including Sandra, really went out of their way to make sure our experience was superb. The food was equally as mind blowing.
Food was delicious and the service was exceptional. Outdoor dining is tucked away in a cozy street away from busy traffic, giving it a cozy and unhurried vibe. Loved the food, loved the service!
No comment

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: ITALIANS DO IT BETTER! I don't know where to start here. This is our favorite place in Manhattan to eat Italian food and have drinks. We were going before the pandemic and came back this Friday after a long time - and it was amazing. They rearranged everything so as to serve to-go drinks and have a couple of tables outside where one can sit and the atmosphere is very nice. They have another restaurant on the perpendicular street (Thompson st) and one can order food there and bring it to the tables on Spring street. We have spent the whole night there and had countless Aperol Spritz, wine and beers and we felt as if we were in a small street in Rome - it was amazing. The servers are all Italian, they are very fast and friendly. We highly recommend to go, for a real Italian experience!!
No comment
The food is very good. However the wine is overpriced and the dining area is a bit snug. But food quality, I'll give it 4.5 stars.

Terrible! Although the food is OK, the customer service is just terrible. The manager was awfully rude and unhelpful. I tried making a reservation for the Soho location, but the website automatically makes your reservation for the Uptown location. As if you couldn't get better Italian food in New York City... please...
No comment
No comment

If the pasta portions are too big, you can ask them to split it in half and they'll put it into smaller pans when serving. The staffs are super friendly and accommodating. I had the lobster linguine - my honest opinion was that it was a tad too salty and way too oily. Fresh lobster was used and flavors were super bold though. Even so, I loved the atmosphere, the staff, and the location. The truffle wild boar pasta was really good and creamy. For dessert, I had the panna cotta, it was a nutty take on regular panna cotta so quite different but loved it. Will be back for sure.
No comment

I don't have much to say, but the food was mouthwatering and completely up to the standards of other reviews. Not only was the food excellent, but the service was great and very speedy with a one on one type of feel. Definitely recommend for a good Italian meal for not to high of a price. (I suggest the cannolis for desert)

Pulpo, pulpo, pulpo!! Don't bother going here if you don't try the pulpo! There's just way too much variety in this restaurant to go down a list of deliciousness but some dishes that stand out for me was the burrata (extremely fresh!) the pulpo (obviously) there was also this ragú they make with like a green pasta i forgot the name but it was a revelation!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Hit this spot after a day of moseying around the city back in September and my goodness was it delicious. The vibes of the restaurant from the upbeat music to the entertainment of the waiter that we had was outstanding. The food was nothing less than authentic Italian (I opted for a shrimp special) and the wine was divine. We definitely return to Piccola Cucina again.

I frequently eat at the east 60th street location for the last 16 months. Their food is EXCELLENT, service superb, front desk and servers are spot on. During these difficult times it is a relief to go into a restaurant that preserves FINE DINING from the past. The grilled calamari is AWESOME[14.95[ lunch special. The pastas are out of this world, all made to order. All dishes are made to order, bread is great. Go there you won't be disappointed. If you are a regular they will make you eat their canolis, on the house !!! If you refuse they bag it up and make you take it home.
No comment

This is me not being an Italian or Sicilian to be exact maybe but I think my standards are high enough thanks to fantastic Italian restaurants all over the city to know if their food is good or not. Nothing stood out. Very average. There's just too many outstanding Italian options out there to come back.
No comment

I discovered this gem about two months before Covid struck and in those two months went four times. This review is really about the entire Piccola group: Osteria, Estiatorio and Uptown. A few months into our shutdown I saw that they were using Caviar for delivery. It was one of the first happy moments we'd had in a while. Since then we have ordered frequently and each meal has been truly great. There are few things more satisfying than a meal of pasta and fish and they do both to perfection. We've tried just about all of the pastas and their simple (relatively) pomodoro is sublime. So is the tagliatelle with a wild boar ragu with black truffles. The branzino is perhaps the best in town. The prices are fair and the portions excellent. Add to that a staff made up of truly nice people and you have a damn near perfect restaurant. Can't wait until we feel safe enough to come back in person. Until then...Piccola Group, thank you so very much!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great Italian food that taste like it was only made for family .Took a friend there that didn't appreciate the passion behind the dish and chose to add hot sauce which they did not have ...Thank God .. I ate wild boar for the first time however it was accidental. Other than that the experience was good. Very small space and cramped as it got busy,I had to squeeze in my seat...Try to go before the dinner rush.

Outstanding! This was my first time here and it was soooo good. I had the ravioli with sausage tomato sauce and rice balls. These rice balls were filled with meaty goodness and it was mostly filling, not rice. So if you're used to softball sized rice balls, you will be disappointed. And I couldn't believe the lunch special, which I didn't even know about beforehand. The app and entree were $25, which two people could have shared very easily. The service was excellent and even though the restaurant is very tiny, it added to the experience. It's a tad loud for a business meeting but I would definitely come back here. And I would absolutely recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my fav Italian places in soho area. Love the $11 lunch special m-f! Such a good deal for the amount of food you get. Tiny space so try to come at off hours or try one of their other locations down the block. Love this place!

This location isn't open right now. Went around the corner to Thompson St. Host is VERY rude. It gave racist. Continued to serve tables instead of seating us (when other servers were available) or asking if we were ready to be seated... answered phones, brought people menus and silverware - all while we stood right there. Food looks great and wanted to try it but won't be back and don't recommend that anyone who looks like me goes here.

Best lunch spot in the whole of New York I love Piccolo Cucina and will continue coming here forever!! Great service and great food I highly recommend Piccolo Cuccina on Spring Thank you Roberto and Misha for great service every time!
No comment
We made a reservation because it's a very small place. But they had other restaurants around the block. If you don't have a reservation you can always go to the other ones.
This place is amazing! A must if you are in lower Manhattan. Super friendly cozy spot!
No comment

This was a wonderful, small restaurant in a nice part of town.  Our service was very attentive and the fresh pasta did not disappoint.  I found the dinner very fairly priced for our overall experience.  The waiters were so much fun, they even led a sing and dance along at one point during our dining experience.  Would recommend a visit here for everyone visiting NYC from out of town for a true NYC welcome.
No comment

What a quaint, wonderful little Italian restaurant! I love how some of the staff here actually speaks Italian. This is a huge plus. Place is small but it is clean with a cozy, tight knit atmosphere feel to it. Our server was friendly and attentive, despite waiting on multiple tables at once and it being packed that evening. Food was delicious, bursting with flavor! Never have I ever tasted something like this before. I am glad I did. Interesting choice of 80s music here. Lots of unique choices on the menu. I recommend trying most of them. Will be back!

The $11 lunch special is to DIE for!!! Finding a deal that good for such high quality, authentic cuisine is so rare in the city. Be warned, this little spot has limited seating and is often quite packed during peak hours so I would highly recommend making a reservation. Every time I return here I have a wonderful culinary experience, and I can't wait for my next meal!!

My friend recommended this place and raved about how good the food here was, after reading the mixed reviews I didn't know what to expect. My first impression upon arriving was wow this place is really small and super packed. We had reservations for 9pm but we decided to wait a little longer in order to sit outside. From the beginning we were greeted by a really friendly host who continuously check up on us throughout the night. The employees do a great job at making you feel welcomed! We ordered the maccorone eggplant pasta and the lobster linguine. The lobster linguine was good but the lobster was just a tad overcook for my preference. The eggplant pasta was delicious! The portions here are huge but I kept eating more of the  eggplant pasta because it was just too good to stop. They brought us complimentary cannolis at the end of the meal. I don't think I've felt this stuffed in my life but it was really worth it because the food was delicious. Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for great Italian that doesn't break the bank.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
One of the better Italian restaurants in town. The pasta tastes good and authentic at the first few bites, but you do get bored of it after 1/2 plate down, because the sauce is quite heavy.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

after arriving here an hour late for reservations we had made at another location, the staff kindly seated us and treated us with extreme kindness throughout the entirety of our meal. i can't speak highly enough of our waiter, who happily provided us with wine (pronto!) and delicious bread. the food itself was some of the best i've ever had. we ordered the tagliatelle verde with boar ragusa and fussilloni scampi of which i ate the entirety of mine and about half of my dinner mate's, taking away any dignity for the sake of the food. the cannolis and espressos at the end tied the experience together and we left happy and full of great food.
No comment

Very tasty. Perfect pasta and sauce. Elevated but homey feeling. If you want Italian food with rich taste and genuinely good cooking then I recommend here after some shopping in the neighborhood. Warm service.

Rounding up from a 3.5 here. This place was tiny and the waiter actually had to move the entire table out to give me room to get into my chair, there was that little space between tables. Let me start off by saying the little pots the pastas come out in are adorable. My friend's ravioli was delicious. My pasta dish w langostine was a little too salty though. And, as this was the second time in a week that I had and didn't like langostine, I've discovered I don't like langostine itself. The preparation itself was fine, just a personal preference. I took the leftovers home and it actually tasted better the second day. Go figure. Anyway, it's a cute spot and I'd come back and try some of their other offerings.

Small hole in the wall place but the food is divine. I also liked that the service was really good. The wait staff go above and beyond to accommodate you if you don't have a reservation. Food is very authentic Italian.

This is place is absolutely AMAZINGGGGG!!! Great service, great food, and overall an incredible experience! They also do the best birthday song! Highly recommend!
Great food,delicious fresh pasta.Very friendly staff and very a nice Italian environment.

The service is spectacular! The waiter actually asked if we wanted to try a different pasta because he saw that we didn't eat the entire portion! The portion sizes are generous. The pasta is made fresh daily and there are seafood specials posted on the board every day. I think, however, because I'm not used to having different styles of pasta, I needed to acquire the taste bud for it; you can tell it's authentic. It's a very comfortable and quaint dining area. I would go again if I'm in the city.

Really good food and service! Kind of small but it's in a great area! Good vibes. Portion size is good and on weekdays, the pasta is only $11!

Cute little Italian place. Friendly Italian waiters and good food. Recommend the sword fish as starter and the pasta with scampi and burrata. Due to the really small venue, we were given a table in the middle which was a bit annoying as waiters kept passing next to us non stop

WOW!!!! the food was amazing I couldn't have asked for  better first night in New York. The atmosphere and the people here are very great and outgoing and made my experience the best. From the time we walked in we felt the love. Now on to the food, if you love pasta then this is a must have. And not to mention the dessert!!! It's just a very authentic restaurant with amazing food!!!

Excellent food here!  Everything we tried was Soo good and we were all full!  I would write more but Yelp keeps kicking me off and I've given up!!!

Small is the first thing you notice. Packed as tight as a train in rush hour. Big personality. Big on taste. Pasta cooked perfectly. Literally from stovetop to table. Pasta comes to table in 0an that is was cooked in. Eggplant Norma is my favorite and as a plant based diner they are happy to remove the dairy. Still awesome! The guys who work here are the best personalities and make the whole vibe fun.
It's a very good restaurant. Ink and lobster linguini are awesome! Strongly recommend!

Small space and hard to get into the seats by the wall. However the food was delicious and well worth the cramped quarters. Everyone's conversation was within an earshot. But the food and service made it all worth it. The tagliatelle verde and cavatelli Ragu were beyond scrumptious. The food in the metal pot also very chic. We came on NYE and it was packed to the brim. But no one seemed to mind. The food and outstanding service will be well worth it

My friend made a rez here on a Wednesday evening and it was packed wall to wall.  It is a TINY spot unlike their larger location on Thompson, but was warm & cozy.  The tables are literally 4 inches apart from one another.  The staff was super friendly and on top of everything during the entire meal.  Our apps came out great and entrees shortly after were delicious!  I don't often eat pasta, but if you do then this for sure is the place to go.  He ordered a lobster pasta & I ordered a meat bolognaise and they split them for us into 2 dishes.  YUMMM!

Amazing start to finish meal during Covid!  service was excellent and the food is simply amazing.  Everything was fresh and served hot.  They serve authentic Italian food offering homemade pastas, nice salads and some very solid wines.
One of my fav lunch spots. You can't beat the $11 lunch special and they have the perfect wine options . Pasta servings are just right

Mamma mia ! Everything is delicious and the are so Nice. A very Small restaurant as the name says but what a good adresse!

Not as great as I was expecting, honestly. We were looking for a quick dinner and just ordered two pastas, one of course being the popular green tagliatelle with wild boar ragu. That one was excellent - unique, flavored well, and great texture. The other was the macaroni with tomato sauce, which I'd recommend skipping. It was a bit too cheesy and the sauce wasn't particularly tasty either. Serving the pastas in their cooking pan is a cute touch, but aside from that, Piccola wasn't anything extraordinary. There's better pasta at lower prices...

DELICIOUS food, warm friendly staff, great prices for what you get, easily 5 stars. Excellent small authentic Italian restaurant. The octopus on burrata was incredible! We got the fisiólini pasta was excellent too. We also got the homemade meatballs which were really good. Great  place and stuff! Very Italian!!! Love it!

The environment is a little crowded but we took the outside table and enjoyed our meal pretty well there.

Proper Italian in NY. It's a great restaurant in a small space that do it big. Homemade pasta really matters. You are brought your food in the pan it was cooked in. Tons of flavor without overdoing it and loosing the Italian heritage. The service was excellent . Manga

The bf took me here for my birthday.  The place is super tiny but we had reservations.  We still had to wait a little for the tables to clear.  The pasta was delicious.  I got the Green Tagliatelle in Wild Boar Ragu and bf got the Lobster Linguine.  I thought the tagliatelle was the winner between the two but bf loved his.  The portions were large and we got the rest to go.  The tagliatelle was still so good as leftovers.  For dessert, we shared the panna cotta. Very light and refreshing.

Quaint little place in SOHO. Cute for a dinner with friends or a romantic date for two. We got a bottle of wine, which the waitstaff suggested to us. The waitstaff was very friendly. Amazing food, the pasta was delicious and the servings were plentiful. I would highly recommend.

Great food and prices, the space can be a little tight and a reservation is definitely needed but the food and service were both astounding. Can't wait to come back on my next trip to NYC. :)

Came here with friends a few weeKs ago. Reservation is absolutely recommended! We ordered three pasta dish and all liked the Cavatelli ragu the best, of course, the squid ink and wild boar pasta at delicious too!

Very good! caught in the rain and stopped - tried their daily specials of grilled octopus appetizer and lobster spaghetti - delicious!  Friendly service, nice atmosphere - will definitely plan to return.

Cozy restaurant with a fantastic menu - everything is delicious, and the price is a steal for such good cooking.

Come here for the $11 lunch specials! Huge portions of homemade pasta served in a pan. My personal favorite is the lobster linguine, which has an extremely rich tomato sauce and generous healings of lobster. The squid ink pasta is also really good along with the lamb ragu pasta.

We sat at a very small table in the middle aisle of the restaurant so we had to deal with people walking by constantly. The server was great and service was prompt. My wife ordered the lobster linguine and it was less spectacular than it sounds so she traded with me and that's what i got to eat. lol. The lobster came in the shell and was difficult to remove the meat with the large fork and no elbow room. It had a bit of a fishy smell to it. I ordered the ravioli and it was very good. We like the wine, we chose to taste 4 different types by ordering by the glass. The barbera was our favorite. We enjoyed the walk to the restaurant and it was certainly packed while other restaurants around had open seating - so don't get me wrong, it was good - just not as good as we had hoped.
Our table was in a weird position where half of my body was exposed to the outside and it was below 20 degrees. Probably why I didn't enjoy my food as much. Worth a try tho.
Went for lunch special so couldn't complain. Got the lamb raging with truffle paste and lobster pasta for 11$ each. However, it's not worth paying the full price.

Lobster one is my favvv!!! Def worth trying!! Will come back again! Also recommend the octopus appetizer!

A friend of mine has been raving about this place, so I decided to check it out. I came on a Friday evening with my best friend who has been looking for a spot that could compete with the food in Sicily. It definitely did! The arancini were to die for. Fresh, with tasty chop meat. The pasta dishes are huge and the prices are undeniably cheap for NYC. This place is fantastic. Make sure to make a reservation, you won't regret it!

The pans they serve their pasta in are a cute little twist, but I don't know if this will become my new go to spot. The place is tiny and we went on Valentine's Day so I think they tried squeezing in more tables where they wouldn't fit. It felt like I was having dinner with my boyfriend and the table next to us. The staff was friendly and even when I was making my reservation and called back a dew times they were always nice. The lobster pasta dish I had was good but my boyfriend's dish was a bit too seasoned. We couldn't finish it and could only take it down with the bread. I'd want to give this place a little less than four stars, not as low as three but yelp doesn't seem to give that option.
Great food and service. It gets busy so definitely make a reservation! The wine bottle prices are reasonable and the music is always upbeat. They are also accommodating for special requests off menu.

By far the best Italian I have had in the city!  I was lucky to get a seat for 1 in this tiny little soho spot. Everything is so fresh and all the pasta is housemade.  I love nothing more than fresh housemade pasta and this place did not disappoint!  I will be adding this to my "must have" meals when I am in the city!

The overall experience is not that good. I still gonna wait for at least 15mins to be seating, even I have the reservation. And also the lobster pasta is also too firm, the food portion is not big enough to serve lol. Not worth to the price. I won't go back for a second time lol. I hope they can offer a better meal to the customer .

Fantastic, authentic Sicilian cuisine. Best grilled octopus I've ever had. Pasta dishes were outstanding. My son ordered a steak which was also excellent. Highly recommend.

Came here because of the rave reviews but was disappointed. The space was extremely small and uncomfortable making it awkward to speak with friends. The food was just ok. My friends pasta was very salty while mine was under seasoned. Won't be back.
No comment

Great little Italian spot. Most, if not all servers seem tone Italian. Very attentive with great service. Great lunch special with lots of options...including lobster pasta. Although I like my pastor a little softer, that's not their fault because I didn't tell them. Just keep in mind they come very al dente. My lobster pasta was delicious. It comes with a tomato base that is not overbearing. Would def return.

This place is a small, quaint, hole in the wall. Staff is largely Italian and you can see the kitchen from your seat. Pasta is served in the pot it's made in--that adds to the overall homey, casual feeling of this place. Feels like we are in Rome! Pasta is made in-house and you can taste the freshness. Service is average. Nothing super special. Had a good experience but not an "out of this world, this place is amazing, home run" type of experience. For what it is, it meets the mark!

This is the best pasta place I've ever tried in NYC. You can tell it's good because they also have a location in Ibiza, so it's international. The pasta is fresh and tastes just like the pasta from Italy. It's a very small, unassuming restaurant (those ones are always the best) and I'm confident recommending this as a restaurant to anybody, tourists or locals alike.

It was really great experience. It is a small authentic place. You have to make a reservation in advance. I went there with my Italian friend. As Italian she said that food is perfect cooked and delicious. Our table was served by Nicola. He is very professional. He explained every detail and helped to choose a dish. I will definitely be back.

This restaurant was phenomenal. Sometimes, when people advertise inexpensive lunch options, the food isn't as good, but it is NYC, and this restaurant had great reviews. My mom and I each had pasta dishes and the portions were large. I loved this orchiette dish with shrimp and a creamy tomato sauce. The restaurant is small, and has an open kitchen, so everything smells delicious when you go inside. I went with my mom and we enjoyed a lovely lunch. The staff was attentive and service was good. They had a variety of Italian wines on the menu, which is always interesting, because it forces you to try something unfamiliar. I enjoyed the white wine I had very much, and the waiter offered great recommendations. This is a great place to stop after a long day of shopping. I would love to eat here again!

I could not decide between a 4 or 5, but I went with 4. My friend and I came here on a Sunday night. It was packed and they were turning people away, but luckily for me I jumped on OpenTable and snagged a reservation that was 45 min away. They sat us early, so we barley had to wait. We both ordered a pasta (lamb ragu and the one with burrata) and shared. We also got the cheapest bottle of red wine. For the price, it is incredible. It is not the best pasta in NYC, but it is delicious and just for the amount of food we got and the price alone, I will be back!
Certainly the best and most authentic Italian I have had in the city! The pasta is homemade and every dish is fresh. Don't skip the cannolis. Bedda!
Very nice restaurant, services are very good.  I had bucatini amatriciana  and black tagliatelle with lobster and porcini mushrooms . Very tasty
No comment

Piccola Cucina is a hidden gem in NYC. Have been here a few times and the food never fails to impress. The pasta and sauce is always extremely fresh and it's a steal given the price! My favorite dish is the Tagliatelle Verdi con Ragu. Would highly recommend this one if you're a big truffle person! I've also had the Taglierini with squid ink sauce and liked this dish as well. The restaurant is quite small but makes for a fun experience. Would be a fun place to celebrate a birthday! They turn on a happy birthday song, the whole restaurant sings, and the chefs start banging pots and pans to the beat of the song.

My absolute favorite spot for a beautiful Covid safe out door dining experience and amazing delivery services for those who do not want to dine out. Food is always hot and amazing every single time. Easily my favorite pasta dish in New York City. Staff is wonderful and caring as well.

Amazing pasta, great ambiance. This place will transport you to Italy. The cannoli is delicious! We will definitely be back.

Piccola Cucina Osteria is quickly becoming my  favorite Italian restaurant for pasta. Yes it's crowded and you're packed tight but who cares when the food is so good. I've been there about 4 times since last summer and can't wait for my next visit. Had the pasta with lobster last time. Yummy!! Love the Panna Cotta also!
Too bad I am not a fan of this restaurant. I tried though. I ordered the sea urchin spaghetti and it was way too salty. The spaghetti was bit under cooked too.
One of the service lady was very very rude. The food was good though. I might return if the service got better. The chef was very nice though. Plates served like a college kids apartment in a pan.

I would come to this place any day if it had a little more space. The tagliatelle with boar ragu and taglierini with squid ink sauce were both superb - great flavors and not too heavy at all! I deducted a star only because this location was really cramped (understandably so since the space is small), to the extent where if I don't tuck my elbows, I feel like I'm poking someone sitting at the next table. That being said, the food was great for the price, and service was very prompt!

Staffs were racist. Yes, we are of Asian descent, but it was very clear that we spoke clear English. Yet when we left the staffs legit said, "konichiwa." Menu was very limited and one of my friend's plate was chipped.

I came in for dinner with my husband, sister in law and her boyfriend for dinner a few weeks ago and had an absolutely fantastic meal! We started with the octopus burrata appetizer special, and each got a different pasta dish for dinner. Everything was absolutely delicious, but I think I won dinner with the calamari orecchiette. We also had the eggplant macaroni, lamb ragu and boar ragu. I would come back here in a heartbeat!
I was extremely offended by the racist waiters mocking us of our native language. Will not come back again.
Went here for a birthday dinner(make reservations!) incredible homemade meals. The wine list was impeccable and so was the service. Make sure to try the cannoli and espresso!

Everything you see on the reviews about this place is true! This place is super authentic and the pastas are the best we have ever tried in both NY area! Didn't disappoint with every single dishes we ordered! Foods were served fresh, fast and hot! Great experience!

A legit GEM. When they give me the free bread and olive oil and vinegar, I knew it is a legit Italian restaurant.
Amazing place! Super cozi and delicious food. Can't be missed if you are in the area.

Great food, quaint atmosphere.  The wine selection was good.  They had plenty of specials to make you want the specials.  Seafood pasta was hands down one of the best I've ever had.  Staff is friendly and attentive.

We came here for a late lunch. We were lucky to find a table for two, as this is a tiny restaurant. We had the spinach and ricotta ravioli, the tomato soup, and the cannoli for dessert. Everything was very delicious. Our waiter was very nice. Couldn't ask for anything more. It's probably better to reserve a table

You walk in to what feels like an Italian kitchen - there's pots of pasta being served. One of my favorite spots to grab Italian in the city, if you're thinking about going please go. They also have a lunch special - $11 for most pastas, can't be beat. Service is always top notch.

This place is phenomenal. I love love love the lobster linguine. It's fresh pasta which is the way pasta should be made. The service is great too! We've been there twice, and every time we really enjoyed our dinner. The place is reservation only. I recommend reserving a week before.

Piccola Cucina is a real Italian Restaurant. The restaurant itself is very small but the atmosphere is amazing, very festive. This is a perfect restaurant for a romantic date or if one is looking for an authentic Italian experience. Amazing.

Excellent food, I recommend the ravioli. Make sure you make a reservation as it's a tiny restaurant.

Amazing home made pasta! The energy of the restaurant is cozy and positive :) they serve their pasta in these cute little pots and the food was incredible!!! Hands down one of my favorite places in the city. A very special place :)

Delicious pans of pasta and fresh appetizers. The food here is so tasty and the staff is so charming. If you want a memorable Italian meal -- this is the place. The place is small so reservations are highly recommended. I had the octopus and seafood pasta. It was so good and surprisingly light. The wait staff/service was attentive and answered questions. I will be coming back.
Amazing food I'm honestly shocked I thought New York didn't have amazing italian food I was wrong and this place proved it i definitely recommend

Absolute must-try for authentic Italian food. The lunch special is $11 for a huge pan of pasta (I usually eat half and just take the rest home with me). Great casual Italian lunch spot. Not the GREATEST pasta I've ever had but it was very good. Got squid ink pasta with seafood (it's not always on the menu ask the server if they have it). Seafood was fresh and the tomato sauce was light and yummy!

Excellent experience here. Small, hole in the wall type feeling, very popular, great staff and excellent food. Our waiter Costa was very friendly and attentive and always made sure our wine glasses were filled. Can't wait to come back!

Will give 0 or negative star if I could. Very rude attitude, didn't honor reservation. We arrived with a reservation. Will not recommend this place. There are way better pasta place in the city. All this place is good at is give you more portion with mediocre quality.

I enjoyed the food here though wouldn't say it's the best Italian I've ever had. The wines were great and I rolled the cute environment and friendly staff.

Excellent value for lunch. Food was very good and portions were no smaller for lunch than for dinner. We each had a pasta dish for eleven dollars each and they were really good. I was so surprised that I left satisfied based on the price of the check. Good and friendly service but I will warn you that the place is very small so if your not into sitting so close to other people than you may not be happy. I would definitely go back for lunch but as far as dinner is concerned I think I've gotten too spoiled and I like my space when I eat and I like to take my time so this place would not serve me well in regards to that.

We were in the city celebrating a birthday! Definitely recommend this place for dinner! They were very accommodating when I had to change a reservation for 2 for a reservation for 4. And even more accommodating when I asked to change that reservation to 6. Given that it's such a small restaurant I was very thankful for that! The food was amazing. All 6 in my party were raving about it. The waitstaff was very attentive and they didn't even have to be reminded that we were celebrating a birthday since we had said that in our initial reservation. I also had never experienced a birthday celebration like theirs, it was a ton of fun (flashing lights and music over the sound system included)! Will definitely visit again!
I love this place! The restaurant is very cozy, it has super tasty pasta, a good vibe and amazing staff. Very affordable and reasonable prices. 100% recommended

We had lunch at this little cute restaurant. We always order arancini for an appetizer if we see on the menu. So we ordered it, which was very good. We loved that it came with fresh salad! Its plate was so fun. It looks like the pasta is homemade. We ordered ravioli, which was delicious (a little bit salty though) and squid ink pasta with calamari. It tasted different from ones at other restaurants for some reason but we enjoyed it. It is random to say this, but the pasta dish tasted like Korean black bean noodle a little bit.
Intimate dining for pasta lovers! What a gem amidst the hustle and bustle of Soho. The boar ragu was my favorite dish, but everything was fresh and served with care.

The pasta is served in such a cool dish! I came here for the $11 special with a friend and it was so delicious! I wish the serving size was a tad bit bigger...(maybe I was super hungry or something)

Been here a couple times. To make it brief this place is tiny but oh-so-warm and inviting! The energy inside is incredible and the food is delicious and fresh. All the pasta is made fresh in house. My absolute favorite is the tagliatelle al ragù with a truffle sauce on top. Amazing! They have a great selection and they are very accommodating. I went there most recently for my best friends birthday and we had a blast. Oh and don't forget to try the arancini (rice balls) soooo good!! Will definitely be back!
Place is cozy and warm. Staff are friendly. I had  the ravioli it tasted good. The place is very very small .  I loved the place. However I didn't feel comfortable setting very close to next tables.

I found this place on yelp, looking for a place to eat before a concert for 4 people.... What a great find!!!! We were all completely amazed from beginning to the end... My BF picked out the wine Montepulciano from Abruzzo and it was amazing... The tapas was so mouth water still amazed by it.... what made the night there was the outbreak of singing with the lights off banging on pots and pans in laughter... astonishing.... By far one of the best places my BF and fam. have ever been in Manhattan..
Wow! This place is incredible! Incredible service, best pasta I've ever had...and incredible vino! Simply amazing.

Had squid ink pasta and lobster cream pasta for the lunch special. It came out in skillets and portion was generous was probably the best lunch deal we found in the city. Our server Erika was super friendly with her Italian accent and made the experience awesome. Highly recommended!

Absolutely fantastic. Extremely fresh and very delicious. We had the Sicilian rice balls, followed by the lobster linguini and to finish it off we had the cannolis. Everything was absolutely amazing and just down right delicious. The place is extremely tiny (can sit at a maximum about 30 people at once) but it just made for a more intimate setting. The staff was great and make sure to make reservations, I'm glad we did because they were completely booked up for the day.

Tables are too cramped. Food mediocre. Service poor. Who serves pasta in pots? Overpriced. Never coming back again.
Very delicious pasta, make a reservation before you go cause they have an extremely limited space!
Great place! Great atmosphere! Complimentary cannoli best pasta in soho  small but cozy and staff is phenomenal
No comment

Trendy and cool pasta spot for a quick and noisy lunch (not in a bad way). They have wine to pair with your pasta. I had the Tagliatelle Verdi with boar Ragu and was delicious. I also tried the Sea Urchin pasta that tasted like the Mediterranean in the best way possible.

The food was good, especially the orange and fennel salad. But the environment was so stressful to me--busy and crowded and loud. I'd recommend trying to go when it's not particularly busy. They gave a great wine list and good food, but catch them at an off-time or sit outside if it's warm enough.
No comment

Went to this restaurant in Ibiza on my honeymoon. My pasta dish there was the best meal I had on my entire honeymoon. With that being said we were very excited to learn that they have locations in our home of NYC. My pasta dish was okay. Cheese did not seem fresh. The staff was semi friendly. Place is very small.

So my husband and I were just there tonight, again.  This place is unbelievable. Yes, the food is great. The service is great. However, here's a tip.The later in the evening you go, the more 'lively' it gets. Tonight, we were dancing in the aisles, people were dancing on their chairs, the servers were dancing with the patrons, it was a party. Everyone was having a great time. Get a reservation, and go. Why are you waiting? Just go. Don't know what to have? Ask your server. They are always right. Between the food, the wine, the music, the dancing, you are guaranteed are great experience. Are you still reading this? Why? You should be making reservations. Adesso!

My husband and I (Italian genuine ) passing this road we were delighted to find favor among young people of this restaurant, the lovely local but especially a delicious cuisine !!!! True Italian cuisine  I made the rounds of Italy between orecchiette (pasta typical of southern Italy ) and squid ink, served as usual in the pans (which I found very genuine) P.s i am sorry for my English

This place is literally my favorite Italian food in the city. Ive been to places all over Arthur Ave and destinations like Parm, but none compare to the freshness and deliciousness of Piccola Cucina. Do not hesitate to eat here if you have the opportunity
I visited for lunch and ordered squid ink pasta and wild boar. Both are amazing. Hospitality is also great! We need to visit again to have other menu.
No comment
OMG! Without words, my first time in NY and my friend he recommended this Restaurant Italian: AMAZING in everything!
No comment
I gotta say this is the best Italian food I've ever had! Service was great too if your in Manhattan and you love Italian this is a must go. Their octopus is great would definitely recommend!

I must admit that I am super picky with my Italian food, but liked this place. It has a nice and cozy atmosphere. The menu selection has something for everybody. However, the food did not blow me away. It is above average in terms of what other Italian restaurants have to offer but is nowhere near the best I've ever had. The pasta dishes lacked seasoning and complexity for my taste. Other patrons in the restaurant seemed to be loving it though, and they have a pretty big following on Yelp. Worth a try.

First things first When you come all the way from LA and have amazing Italian food you must be at the right place! From the ambiance to the food to the service you are definitely at the right location. We had the calamari, bruschetta, pink ravioli, spaghetti, and tiramisu. Everything was absolutely amazing! I will definitely be back!

I would give this place 1/2 star if it would let me and it's not due to the food. It's for the most terrible service I just witnessed and experienced at this place.  In the short dinner service we had here (1hr), my wife and I watched the waiter at the door turn multiple diners away. He said they were fully booked, but certain people (pretty white girls and well dressed pretty people) were either seated immediately, told to wait a few minutes or a phone # was taken for a later table. Towards the end of our meal (just after the  1 hr mark) the waitress came over and said "not that we are rushing you, but we need your table for a group waiting outside (no reservation, well dressed group of 4) we can move you to an inside table or this middle table  (where you literally can be bumped by the wait staff every 5 seconds). Keep in mind, we had reservations. In addition, we witnessed them turn away a group of 4 young men whom the waiter walked to their other less crowded restaurant. Anyway, we moved but I clearly was very upset. So, they gave us our $10 dessert for free. I have been dining in NYC for 25 years, and I never experienced such bad service. Such a shame. It's no wonder you're dropping in trip advisor ratings. I'll make sure to spread the word.

Exploring the area and stopped by during lunch on a whim. Small and cozy which I don't mind but this is not a place for big parties. Ordered the lobster linguine which was delicious - pasta was perfectly cooked, sauce was not too salty or heavy, with a bit of lobster to go with each bite.
