Will definitely be coming back when I'm in the area.

Let me first start off before the haters roll in here but I'm not a big fan of Italian food (it's good don't get me wrong) but this place blew my expectations away. My friend wanted to celebrate her birthday here and made reservations Saturday evening (I highly recommend) as this place is BOOKED to the max. And I can see why--it's like a mini hole in the wall--I know they have other locations. Can we start off with the service--waiters mad cute, charming, and very attentive. Secondly, the food was really good--I usually avoid pasta but this homemade goodness was delicious and so comforting. Started off with these rice ball appetizers which were elegantly presented--not too heavy and prepared just right. Fresh bread on the table was served :) And back to the pasta--names are too long to type out but they let you substitute the type of noodle and my friend and I switched our plates. She had my lamb ragu with mushrooms while I had the eggplant with ricotta. SO GOOD and worth the carb overload :) Finally, they were so cute with surprising her for her birthday--mini cannolis. I usually don't eat them but the filling---WOW. I can't even. The whole staff including the kitchen sang for her :) Feels like family when you dine here--you won't regret it!
No comment

Went to Pick up a drink from them today, and could barely get thru the crowd, so many people without masks. I live around the corner, and its normally very frustrating walking by your restaurant due to the lack of control you have of your patrons outside, not making any room for anyone to walk by. But even worse now when you have people taking up the side walk, no masks, having their dogs on leashes taking up even more space. Please have some common consideration for your neighbors and control the crowd. Learn from other restaurants on the same street who are doing more of an effort to control their patrons.
Small joint. Exceptionally quick service. Absolutely refined pasta dishes that are certain to fill you up!

This could be my new favorite New York restaurant. I went with a group of 6 and had a blast. They played amazing music and we danced, laughed and drank the whole night. On top of the amazing fun atmosphere, the food is unbelievable. This is a New York gem and I can't wait to go back soon.

This place was very hard not to give five stars for and they really deaerve 4.5! Ver authentic, you could be in Italy. We had an appetizer of eggplant parmigiana revisited, fantastic and very innovative. Then we had four pasta plated that all came in the pan. All were delicious at great prices.

Bring a shoe horn because you will need it just to get in the place. Very tiny but friendly and fresh made pastas all served in a deep dish pan, Pastas all around 20$ but very good size and the wines are really good all around 10$. They have very reasonable lunch special during the week but me like an idiot ate on the weekend and paid regular price, Had the lamb and mushroom pasta delicious. Definitely going back.

Best Italian in the city! This place gives you the whole experience. Super tiny, maybe 7 tables so make sure you get a reservation. Wait staff was fantastic and the food was amazing! Fun music and the kitchen and waitstaff is singing and dancing. Great wine selection too.

Piccola Cucina is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in NYC! I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience and a pasta you won't stop craving. I've been many times for their lunch and also for lively dinners and they never disappoint. It's always bustling so I recommend a reservation for dinner or weekend lunches but even the wait is worth it. I've found myself waiting a good long time for the chance to bring a friend to indulge. Highly recommend!

Fabulous food and very nice, attentive service! Husband ordered meatballs as a starter and had the boar tagliatelle for his main. He loved both. I am a vegetarian and had the seasonal mixed salad for a starter (really delicious with tons of goodies... fennel, cherry tomatoes, (pickled?) onions, capers, Greek olives, oranges, radishes, arugula, etc). For my main, I had one of their specials, a porcini mushroom stuffed ravioli with a cacio e peppe sauce. Unbelievably delicious. All of their pasta is homemade, and that's evident. Plus the waitstaff speaks Italian to each other - excellent and packed hole in the wall. Definitely get a reservation, as it's a quaint spot that books up quickly. Snag one of the two tables outside if possible! Highly recommend!

Yum yum yum! Booked this place on OpenTable for lunch because it's near my husband's office and the reviews are so great. And indeed, the reviews don't lie. I had the ravioli, which was absolutely perfect, and my husband loved his meatballs. My only complaint is they don't have iced tea, but most restaurants in Manhattan don't make it right anyway. I definitely highly recommend this place!
This place is a gem. The dishes are classic/standard--not trying to be cheffy, just solid. Great food, great prices, fun vibe and staff. Almost too good to be true in this neighborhood.

Visiting NYC from Chicago, a family of 5 with 3 teenagers. Delicious food! The place itself is very small but staff was very accommodating to our family of 5 for a late night dinner. Ravioli was the best I've ever had. Ambience was fun and energetic. Will definitely be back!
Oh my god, this is the best Italian place I've ever been to in nyc! Atmosphere is very nice and the food is DELICIOUS!!!

The place is a bit tight, but the pasta here is great and the staff is very friendly. I had the boar ragu, which was a little heavy on the truffle but very good, and my wife loved her seafood pasta. Would highly recommend coming here.

I went on a Bumble date here and had so much fun! I got the Cacio e Pepe style pasta and it was some of the most delicious pasta I have ever had! We also split the lobster special pasta (this was a few months ago so it wa
No comment

Delicious meal, lovely service, quaint village location. The tagliatelle and the ravioli were tasty, quite flavorful, and filling.  The wines were a great balance of quality and price, the dessert superb.
No comment

I have no complaints about this osteria.  It was delicious, good quality, authentic and really wonderful service.  If someone has a complaint, it's because know nothing about good Italian food. That's the truth.
very disappointing!! mediocre at best! seafood risotto had one tiny shrimp, two clams, and tasted like canned tuna. i live in manhattan and this place is not cozy.....more like intrusively small
Just had a great night at Piccola Osteria! A true experience, great food, wine! I really recommend it
No comment
Good food and also staffs are wonderful. They are very friendly. I wish they had few more seafood or fish options. I liked their avocado salmon tartare.
Very authentic Neapolitan food, space is very cramped , some what uncomfortable, still would recommend because pastas are very good
Absolutely my favorite restaurant in the city. I bring my friends and family here and they LOVE IT. Best food, environment, service, and wine. Best gluten free pasta I've ever had.
No comment
Small dining area, but the food and service is excellent.  Some of the best pastas in all of SOHO. Also cannot beat the lunch special prices.
You know when an Italian spot is good, when you see Italians eating there. Good location, Hand made noodles, good quality fish, and creative presentation
No comment

The reservation we made for ten people took up half the restaurant, and when we asked to add one more chair, they claimed they couldn't accommodate us. The manager suggested we go to another restaurant, which we did. Space is an issue almost everywhere in NYC, but when you make a reservation and have family in from out-of-town, the expectation is to be met with quality. There was none of that here. If you have more than two people, save yourself time and go to Carbone.
No comment
Absolutely lived up to all of the reviews. Their pasta is divine.  Yeah it's a bit cozy but as long as you are not absolutely claustrophobic it's fine
Definitely come during lunch hours. It's totally worth it, would def come back during weekdays. Just make sure that the pasta that your ordering applies to the lunch specials.

My favorite Italian restaurant in New York (and I'm Italian,so my expectations are pretty high :-)).   I come here every time I miss home, and pasta with seafood. All their food is amazing, ingredient are fresh and high quality, servings are pretty big, the atmosphere is cosy and friendly, and cost is really competitive. You will leave full and happy
It is too small and uncomfortable to enjoy food. I ended up going to the other location.
Super delish! Authentic Italian food. Lovely ambiance.

This place does not actually lives up to its reputation. Heard so much good things, so I got a reservation. The waiters are not so nice. The whole place is cramped with tables and chairs. The actual pasta is somewhat one of a kind because of the sauce, but I find it tastes just normal. In my mind this place is overrated. The only thing that might make me want to go again is the surprisingly low price of their lunch special.

Check this place out recently based on a friends recommendation for lunch. They have a great lunch deal where the majority of their pasta options are only $11. This excludes their seafood risotto and uni spaghetti. I went on the early side of lunch and was the only patron for the majority of my meal. Service was incredibly friendly and I was a low maintenance customer. I was in and out in less than 30 minutes and really enjoyed my lobster linguini.
No comment

When I first walked in I couldn't believe how small the restaurant was but the food was delicious. I had the Lobster Linguine and it was absolutely incredible! Enjoyed ever bite of my meal. This is a hidden gem on Spring Street that I will definitely come back to.
No comment

Wonderful food and atmosphere but you are literally sitting on top of people. Food & wine was great , not so great a past her prime mob wife who was offended when she pushed me to get up and I told her jokingly (because space is tight) we need to coordinate for her to get up. She made a spectacle knowing it is a tiny restaurant where the staff felt compelled to move our group of 4, including birthday girl. So beware of battle axes and prepare for an intimate setting with fantastic food.
The food was good! I liked how the wait staff picked up each others tables to keep a constant flow of service.  The space is a bit tiny, but comfortable for a small party of 2-3. Thanks Domenico!
No comment
No comment

Love this tiny Mom & Pop Italian restaurant in Soho. Perfectly sized portions with some of the most amazing sauce creations. Whether you want to keep it traditional with the wild boar and green tagliatelle *plus truffle* or squid ink pasta you will leave feeling satisfied and craving more. Also very fun spot for birthdays as they turn up the music and put on a little show. I wouldn't come here in groups of 6 or more- more so an intimate date night spot.

Walked out of our hotel a block to this cute Italian restaurant. So quaint and charming. The service and food were great. We had ordered the ravioli and another dish had came out. They corrected so quickly and offered to bring it out. Even when I said we were fine with what was brought to us. Loved the recommendations they made and the experience. So glad we spent our Thanksgiving here!! No Turkey for us.
No comment

My wife and I, we were at the office Christmas party that was thrown at Piccola and I had a great time. It was a bit small but intimate and full of life the waiters are excellent they cater to you and they try to get to know you. Very friendly atmosphere and be prepared for full throttle Italian experience the wine selection is excellent and the food is really good. My wife had The Burrata served with cherry tomatoes and arugula salad, l had Sardines beccafico with fennel and orange very delicious and that was just the starter. I definitely recommend this place in my opinion the price is right(No pun intended) this is a great place to take friends and family to if you decide to go there you will enjoy yourself.

Wonderful, provided you have a reservation. Super small, but very cozy as well. Made a perfect first date. The girl loved it. Food was good. They had a great tasting bottle of wine for $35. Highly reccomend. It's an experience.​

Have been twice (2nd time was on accident because my boyfriend made the reservation and forgot that we didn't like it the first time but we decided to give it another chance)--Food is average at best. This is more so posting about how they said if we left a 5 star review then they would give us a free drink or dessert, so this is a key driver of their great reviews. They were doing it to every table. They also try to cram as many people as possible into the tiny space and you feel very rushed during the whole dining process.

Crowded, noisy, tiny, with excellent food, wine, prices and service. But it's not your typical Italian restaurant. It's Sicilian! You'll love it and you will return. Also, all the hot entrees were served in cooking pots. Very charming and smart.
Food is great (lunch special for $11 is great deal ! ) but restaurant is sooo small . Wines are OK but too expensive  , service is also OK .

The chefs, servers and patrons are singing "Mambo Italiano," wine glasses are full and I am twirling a delicious strand of homemade pasta served atop a lobster shell. That was just one perfect moment from a perfect dining experience. This tiny restaurant has an open kitchen and the chefs truly love their craft. The wine list was impressive and by the glass options were poured from respective bottles table side. The rice ball appetizer is crazy good. The green pappardelle with boar ragu and truffle was one of the best pasta dishes I have ever tasted. Stellar. My lobster linguine was luscious. Skipped dessert but will try it next time. Best of the best Italian.
No comment

Fantastic!! I left feeling full and very happy.  I travel to Italy every year.  Different parts each time and at times I usually end up in the regions I love most.  Luigi and his staff really do it right. The apps and pasta are delicious. What's so funny is I'm born and raised in nyc but One of my hard core Roman clients suggested this place. Home run. Love!

Walked in with high hopes since a friend had recently recommended this restaurant. Made a reservation for 6 which is a big party since there is very limited seating. We were seated immediately but we were also put in the corner of the restaurant where two of the seats were somewhat underneath a shelf(only letting us put our shoulders in and having to angle our head out of the way). The tables are put maybe a foot(at most) apart from each other so it made it a bit hard maneuvering around in our big winter jackets. Once seated, a friend of mine had automatically noticed that one of our plates were chipped. No biggie. We ordered and got our food and I can say that it was mediocre. The pasta was undercooked and in very small portions. It also took awhile to get someone to look at us, for us to ask for the check. We paid and as we were heading out, the staff had said "konnichiwa" and "xiexie". Now we are of asian descent, but I know for a fact we had not spoken a single word in our native language. We found that them saying this was rude and unnecessary. Definitely will be going to other restaurants with better food and better staff.
Great food, good service. Wouldn't mind coming here again. Just walked by and decided to give it a try! You should too!
Amazing fresh pasta dishes and good house wine. Perfect September afternoon with outdoor seating.
Amazing pasta perfectly prepared served in a skillet by hot Italian waiters in the most charming small trattoria.
No comment
Lobster pasta amazing, although the last time the lobster was to well done... the calamari were amazing, the arancini had to much Safran in the risotto for my taste...

Came here with a friend and ordered the scampi burrata fusilli. I was promised the best pasta in NYC however the pasta was sooo undercooked that it was very hard to chew - it felt like I was chewing dough. Also the amount of scampi was somewhat stingy. Basically the dish was one scampi with a large amount of pasta. The sause, on the other hand, was rly tasty and creamy. Customer service is good as well, although it was hard to get in/out since the place is super cramped.

I was born in Sicily and go back every other year for vacation, and this is THE closest one will get to eating Sicilian cuisine here in the US. To be fair, I haven't been to any other Sicilian-only restaurant (usually Italian restaurants have menu items from different regions across Italy) but this brought me back! The only thing missing was the sound of waves lapping at the shore :)
Literally the best hole in the wall Italian restaurant in NYC, not even exaggerating.  Introduced to me by my Italian coworkers, this is as authentic Italian as you can get in NYC.

Best homemade pasta joint I have ever been to. Went here with my boyfriend for my birthday dinner and it ranked so above our expectations! I had the Lasagna al Ragu and he had their special: Lobster Linguine. This place is extremely small and rather cramped but the food makes it so worth it. There are a couple seats in the windows, call ahead for that! Definitely wish to return here.
Wow! Just wow on food. Reservations needed to ensure a seat. Pasta is amazing. Eggplant appetizer is so good.
Food was great and so was the service. Place is really small and noisy but surprisingly pleasant despite the size. It's better for casual, couples dinner, a little less work conversation.
The best pasta in NYC to have. The service is always amazing. Have been going there couple times a month for a while.
Tiny, cozy, intimate and absolutely satisfying with each bite! Great for lunch followed by a walk to the West Village!
Amazing food and atmosphere. Domenico is fantastic and was very welcoming! Feels like your in Italy  Thank you!!

Ok, but that's all. Maybe we're cursed for eating real Italian food in Italy because this just doesn't make it for us... nice atmosphere and food that will probably work just fine for most people. However if you've had real Italian food, don't go or lower your expectations!
No comment
No comment
super nice people and fantastic food! Even remake a small portion of my food because they forgot to pack it the leftover
Wonderful lunch experience.  Food amazing!  Service wonderful!  We only stayed NY for few days and want to come back to this place!
No comment

One of the best Italian restaurants in NYC! The vibe was small and they only have a couple of tables but the food is amazing! We started with the grilled octopus appetizer which was delicious and then my boyfriend got the lobster pasta and I got the ricotta ravioli which was amazing!!! I highly recommend this restaurant for authentic Italian food !!

The freshly made pasta at this place are the best pasta at great value that you can find in NYC. Cooked aldante in a skillet and brought to your table. The caccio e pepe are my favorite but I recommend all the pastas on the menu!

Even though it´s not in little Italy, by far it´s the best italian restaurant i went in NYC. traditional Italian kitchen, small but its really worth it, we had de black spaghetti al pomodoro with shrimp and also the classic lasagna, simply delicious. They also have a reduced menu of wine, but you bet its the best from the best of Italy!

Amazing service and traditional, no frills Sicilian meals. Had my husbands birthday here and it was very well received by the group! It's a small space so definitely arrive on time if you have a reservation. The wild boar pasta and lobster pasta are the best!
Friendly, Tasty, Good. We had Penne pommodoro, Lasagne, bruschetta and some great desserts. Great food. Thanks for the time here. Greetings from Austria,

Delicious food, generous portions, good service and cozy atmosphere. Great for a date in an intimate setting. The octopus starter was amazing and highly recommend everyone to try it. 4 stars because the 3 pasta dishes we got were a bit salty.. and the sauce for the lobster linguini and the seafood pasta special was basically the same.. but besides that, food was authentic and I would come back!
Tony crowded and crazy but delicious. Love the twist they put on classic dishes.   I had lunch but will come back for dinner.

I wanted to like this beyond small restaurant but it was mediocre at best. It's very cramped. Tables are about 6 inches apart. None of the salads come dressed. Difficult to hear wait staff or them you. The white wine was not chilled. The food all lackluster in taste.
No comment

As traditional as you can get outside of Italy. I got the cavatelli with lamb ragu and was so in love. My dad got the ravioli and loved it just as much. His restaurant is beautiful and intimate. You'll feel transported!

There are about a million Italian places in New York City but this one is def worth checking out. This cute little restaurant is in the heart of SoHo. We got the Arancino Catanese for our appetizer and it was deliciousss. For my main course, I got the cavatelli pasta with mushrooms and ragusano cheese and it was served in a skillet which is their trademark thing. The servers were super sweet and made the entire experience that much better. The space is small so I'd keep that in mind if goin in a group.
Great wine and food. They cranked up the music and gave us a little dance party.  Go here with friends and enjoy a lively night finished with cannolis.

I brought my girlfriend here for date night since she's been craving authentic pasta dishes. On this front, it did not disappoint. The squid ink and boar pasta dish were both phenomenal. However, the salad we ordered was subpar--it didn't even have dressing on it. The bread and dip were also average. It was also too tight for us to really relax and have an intimate date setting since the tables had little space between us.

Although the pasta was very good, the service was absolutely terrible. We waited for about 20 minutes before the waiter came over to us. Once he did, we ordered our wine. When the wine came, my wife and I took one sip of it and knew that it had gone bad. Instead of just replacing the wine, the waiter went to the back and made the entire staff try the wine. He then came out and said "I've had this wine many times and there was nothing wrong with it". He must have said this two or three times. He finally gave us a new glass of wine which was a million times better than the wine that had definitely gone bad. The swordfish buffalo muzzarella appetizer was way too fishy for our liking. The place is very tiny and they sat us on top of and in between two other couples. Again, the pasta was very good and the owner was very nice, but was not very impressed with this place whatsoever.
No comment

Fantastic..a bit crowded..you may have to enter or exit through the back window into the croowd waiting to get in but its worth it. Perfect friendly service with amazingly great food..They accidentally tossed out my girl friends leftover risotto she wanted to take so the chef made her a new one! Make sure you reserve!
No comment
No comment

Amazing Italian food. Authentic Sicilian. Truly great. We know Catanese food (as prepared and enjoyed in Catania) and this place is closest to being there that we have ever found anywhere off the island. Try the Pasta a la Norma for example. Very friendly and fun too. Sometimes the music gets turned way up for a traditional Sicilian song, everyone sings, then the volume goes back to normal. Small place as the name clearly states. Seating is close yet comfortable. It is amazing what gets accomplished in this little kitchen. Will return again and again with friends.

Best Italian food in the states I go to Italy every year in Bologna which is known for the pastas and this place is absolutely amazing and the fact that you come watch the chef cock is so fun! Dont miss out on this restaurant!!!

Tiny little restaurant, but let the friendly professional staff take care of you. Good wine selection, great Sicilian menu. A starter of grilled swordfish, buffalo mozzarella, and tomato was extremely good, though I had doubts about the combination. Beautiful dish. Same for the Buccatini con Sarde. Excellent food, ample portions. These people are good.

NOT your typical Italian restaurant. Everything is fresh, made to order & OUTSTANDING. The menu is small but the choices are wonderful. It's also a really fun place--the owner/chef will suddenly break out into song & then encourages the entire restaurant to join in. It's a real hoot. Steve describes it as "the happiest place on earth", but then again, I've heard him say that before about Disney & a couple of other restaurants too

Piccola Cucina reminds me of the tiny restaurants you find across cities in Italy that are proud of their food, their wine, and an unpretentious atmosphere that allows food to shine. It's priced very accessibly, consistently tasty, and cozy in a way that feels authentic.
Loved all of it ! Grate food, loved the place, just what my friends and I were looking for to a nice lunch!!

We went here for Mother's Day lunch today. This place is so small yet it has the most amazing food and even better service!  The people are so nice and they all speak Italian!  I felt like I was in Italy!  Would definitely recommend!! Make reservations and go!!

This place is SO UNDERRATED! Came here on a Sunday night and had the lobster spaghetti which was epic and full of lobster to the point of illness! The people that work there are legends and its very reasonably priced! Come here if you are super hungry and want a massive cheat meal!
Best Italian restaurant in NYC period !!!! The waitress was so nice, the foods was great, nice atmosphere. Thank you
This place is fantastic. The food was amazing. The staff was fun and attentive and it seemed like everyone at the restaurant was having the time of their life. Highly recommend
No comment

Had an amazing experience my first time here. The supervisor was amazing, I came in with no reservations on a date and he sat me down immediately. He was friendly and very informative. The food was amazing, will def come back! The supervisor on shift made me feel welcomed and at home

My friend and I were looking for a restaurant to wrap up our New York vacation and we choose Piccola Cucina Osteria based on the thousands of 5 star reviews. We made a reservation the day before and there was only 5:30 pm and 9:00 pm left so definitely make a reservation to get a table! The restaurant is quite small but intimate and gives off a very homey vibe. The service was wonderful! We first got meatballs to share as an appetizer and they were superb! 10/10 recommend. For the main course, I ordered the Fusilloni di Gragnano and was not disappointed. The portions are pretty big so you really get your money's worth. While we were pretty full and declined dessert but our waiter brought out 2 cannolis on the house and suddenly I wasn't full! They were probably the best cannolis I have ever had and the best way to end of the evening. Would definitely come back again and bring my whole family!

Charming little place with great food. Worth a visit. Burrata. Tomato soup. Delicious. Went back for lunch a second day. Charming and attentive staff, great pasta and wonderful spinach side. Only seats about 30 people, so reserve a spot!!
No comment

This restaurant had an amazing atmosphere and delicious food.  We ate, drank, and had so much fun.  The staff was amazingly attentive and we loved the music.  We could not have picked a better place to celebrate our 20th anniversary.  Thank you for an unforgettable night!!!
We walked in and immediately got a table, staff there were so friendly and attentive. Also the food was amazinggggg!!! Definitely coming back for more!!

Brilliant. What an experience- yes it's tight on seating but the staff make it work well - we didn't feel cramped in any way. We had the arancini which were very tasty and followed with pasta allá sarde (which basically was why we came - loved it in Sicily and so hard to get - outstanding) and the squid ink pasta - very good. Rounded off with an excellent cannoli which was even better than what we had in Sicily. A gem of a place. Book and enjoy!

They threw the best and the most memorable birthday lunch for my sister :) We ordered three appetizers and three entrees for a table of four. Both food and service were amazing. The tight yet cozy space made us feel like we were in Italy, it was so much fun. Highly recommended!!

What a great place! This is an authentic Italian restaurant. The food is delicious, the place is small but cozy and with an awesome vibe. The staff is incredibly friendly and cool. The atmosphere is unique. Perfect place to celebrate a birthday, you can bring your own cake without being charged. This place is really awesome and I will def coming back!
Best Italian in the city and at a reasonable price! My all time go to spot. Need reservations any time of the week.
We had a wonderful dinner... Service was spectacular. Desserts were off the charts appetizer and entrées did not disappoint highly recommended from Kate and Chris

We stumbled upon this little gem while walking around. Atmosphere was was great even though the seating is tight. We started with the tuna tartare which was very refreshing on a hot day. We then had two different pasta dishes that were incredible. Highly recommend!

Had a reservation for 7:30. Showed up at 7:31 and table had been given to someone else. Was told we could wait another ten minutes. Was made a damn fool of by waiting another hour for the table and was not sat until 8:30!! (Side note: if you have epilepsy...do not come here!!! They are constantly flashing the lights to songs.). Don't let the happy birthday songs fool you....the staff here is not friendly, but downright hostile! The restaurant is extremely loud, do not bring anyone over 65 or you will be footing the bill for overpriced pasta and a ruptured eardrum. The portions are good but the pasta is drowning in sauce, otherwise delicious. Appetizers were delicious. Recommend food, not the environment.

My husband and I went here last night for our first night in NY. I have to say it was so delicious! Service was great, atmosphere is so cozy and romantic, food was even better! Definitely not a good place for big parties and definitely recommend calling and making a reservation. Check this place out!
The most fabulous Italian restaurant in all of NYC. I immediately felt thrown back to Italy. The food is outstanding. The staff is very attentive and the chef is a fun and delightful.

The food was very tasty (though very salty) and the portions generous, but it was not worth the poor service and incredibly cramped space. I wanted a second glass of wine but no one would take the order. My coat kept getting knocked off the back of my chair and I had to hold onto my glass. If you're going to risk it, don't take the table in the middle!
No comment

cute space but really small. - food was okay- nothing really wowed me. Had the seafood risotto and lamb pasta. I felt that both dishes needed a little more oopmh in them to make it really stand out and Be memorable. There are so many Italian places in NYC that one can not and should not settle for just okay..

I came were with a group of 6 for an 8:30 reservation.  They ended up not giving us a table until 9 since they didn't save any tables for us.  The server offered prosecco when we were seated to make up for the wait.  I understand why he offered it so quickly, it was very cheap. Our group ordered 4 apps.  The calamari, grilled octopus, eggplant dip, and arancini.  I wish the server would have told us there were only two balls in the order of arancini for 6 people.  However, that being said, all four apps were delicious.  The octopus was so tender and the grilled calamari paired wonderfully with the bed of guacamole.  Not the slightest but chewy.  The entrees were good but not as good as the apps.  My husband got the seafood risotto he describes as OK and I would say the same about my lobster linguini.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is a good time with music and flashing lights throughout the evening.  A fun find but because of the small space I don't recommend going in a big group like we did.

Not just small, tiny, but Delicious! We made reservations for a Saturday for 5 people in a restaurant that only holds 25. Reservations are a must. Rice Balls appetizer was great as was the special that day, octopus. Try the Tomato soup too! Mains are served in a metal frying pan. Average portion size with great flavors from the Tuna steak to the ravioli. Nice wine menu that didn't break the bank. With wine averaged $60pp.

This restaurant is exactly what you would imagine in your head for a small Italian restaurant in Soho. I came here on a Friday night for dinner for 2. We did have a awkward seat in the house (middle of the small dining room) but honestly the waiters were very careful and the service was good given how small the restaurant is. This place is very small so expect to be close to your neighbors but I personally don't mind that. Pasta dishes were cooked perfect al dente and good portion sizes. They do take reservations which is a huge plus in my book. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good plate of pasta in Soho amongst the sea of other restaurants. The wine list is very manageable and won't crush the wallet if your looking for a night out.
No comment
No comment
Pretty fabulous...authentic, great service, felt like being in Italy. Definitely worth a visit!
Great service, fantastic food. Try to make reservations as they're busy. The tagliatelle with truffle and meat is fantastic!
Excellent food it was just delicious! Service is great and friendly. I would recommend this address.

My friends and I had an amazing experience! Food was perfect. Service was perfect. If you like a nice little Italian place that is honestly perfect in every way, DEFINITELY come here. My friends and I will be back again the next time we take the subway to Soho.
Surprisingly hood. Vitello Tonato was very nice. Great people. Good wine. Vary comfortable.

Loved it!! Very tiny place, so better to make a reservation, but as Italian, I can say that the food is real Italian food and it is very delicious! Let them to suggest you the dish of the day and leave some space to try the cannoli! Also the staff is very friendly and kind. Enjoy!
Amazing! The wild boar pasta and eggplant pasta are must try dishes. Service was great. We'll definitely be coming back here!
No comment
Amazing food, looked like I was back in Italy. Extremely recommended to any Italian looking for home and to anyone who is in New York and wants to enjoy real Italian food.
Mediocre, 2nd star is for serving pasta in the pan.

This is my first time to visited here. We ordered many type of dishes. All dishes were amazing and delicious. Service is nice and friendly. This is cozy and good size of Italian restaurant. The chef in here they have good smile and looks busy all the time. My favorite dishes are grilled octopus and calamari, fish, sea food spaghetti, Spanish and mushroom linguine. For dessert cream brulee was so creamy and fresh too. I can't wait to come back here again!!
No comment

A very homey Italian restaurant with great service. I absolutely love everything about the little restaurant (except the waiting maybe. But the waiters are very nice so I didn't hate the waiting)! The food is amazing. Thought the portion might be a bit too much if you are not very hungry... also, the food is well-priced. And if you happen to have people celebrating something, the restaurant becomes so festive. Worth the waiting/come at a less busy hour. Either way you will enjoy an amazing Italian meal.
No comment

Tiny place so don't expect to go with more than a friend or two.  Luckily we thought to make reservations at 6 on a Tuesday because it was still packed! And for good reason. I can only vouch for the tagliatelle with wild boar ragu but it was flavourful, nicely seasoned and perfectly portioned. I would have liked the pasta a little more al dente but it was delicious nonetheless. Plus! The service was very attentive and kind. They worked efficiently despite the lack of space which is pretty impressive.
No comment

Our fav near home. Came here twice this week. I never liked pasta before coming to this place. The downside is that it is super loud. We just ate our meal not talking. It is impossible to hear each other if you don't shout.

Had an absolutely fantastic meal here this evening. An overall great experience, and quality food. Fresh pasta and fresh seafood, in a chill and not super expensive setting. Amazing servers and great service. They were able to accommodate us last minute on a Saturday evening..
My go-to place for good, consistent Italian food. It's a small space and can get pretty loud, but it all adds to the charm of the Italian chef and staff who always seem happy to be there.

Great, as my friend said most Italian places back home are small and close knit staff with basic and home made ingredients, appropriate portions and great selections of wine.  Nothing over advertised and pretentious. Want a great small knit Sunday Brunch, this is the place. It's hard to please a table of 11. Francesco was amazing. We loved and plan to come back and enjoy. Pics of our food as post and had all friends asking, "where we're you?"
What an authentic, quaint experience. Great service, unique foods and flavors that were delicious. I thought I was in Sicily!

A must visit for seafood pasta lovers. Have been here twice and ordered the squid ink pasta twice. It's a decent price (16?) and the squid ink sauce is just superb. Perfectly salty, seafood-tasting, and filled with chunks of squid. The grilled octopus is also so tender and flavorful. The venue itself is too small, but the food renders that irrelevant.
No comment
Amazing! So fresh! So authentic! The best Italian I've had since Italy! This is my second day here in a row.
No comment

Came here for Saturday lunch with a couple of friends and we really appreciated the food and the wine - I had the tagliatelle verdi con ragu, just incredible!! The only issue was that it's a very small restaurant and it was packed. I almost couldn't get in the table they gave us, and the other table was a 2 inches distance from ours. So, it was a little uncomfortable for our friends lunch, but I understand that NY restaurants have to use every inch of its space, so no big deal.
Small, cozy, and delicious food. The staff was great, everyone was very helpful.
No comment

I've been here 3-4 times now; and the food is always delicious and the restaurant staff is always gracious.  Every time we have come here, they have shown us a great time.  Do not forget to order the "eggplant mouse"!
Had meatball appetizer, spaghetti with squid ink calamari and ravioli. Amazing along with great service. Very romantic setting  as well... will come back again
Tasty food, courteous service in lovely-enough ambience. I had the seasonal salad and tagliatelle with black truffle shavings. All was pretty tasty. I'd definitely go back!

On par with L'Artusi. Split a bottle after rooftop drinks and charcuterie in soho. Black truffle veal paparadelle and vodka sauce fusilli with langostine - an absolute MUST. A bit ragey with cooks banging pots. Go on the early side next time... Def will be back here with my Russian bf. Next time won't pass out.
This is a bit of a hidden gem- intimate, quiet and the food is delicious. I would definitely suggest stopping by if you're in the neighborhood.
AMAZING! Super fresh pasta with super friendly staff at very reasonable prices. Pasta a la Norma and lasagna were out of this world. Make sure you try the arancini and cannoli!
Amazing homemade pasta in ink sauce! Will be back for the sardine pasta next time in the city

Very authentic Italian restaurant with a wonderful service. I stopped by for a glass of wine and a little bite and was absolutely amazed by the quality of the food especially considering  the size of the place! I had mozzarella burrata salad and a glass of red wine. So simple but outstanding. Very European atmosphere ( I'm European too). Kind and sweet. If you're planning to go there be prepared to be in a small place with tables close together. If you're an entitled type of person and you think the world spins just around you, you probably  won't  appreciate it, so go somewhere else. I'll happily take your seat. Grazie!

Loved this little Soho restaurant. The food is like homestyle cooking, quality ingredients simply prepared. Pasta is perfectly al dente, crusty bread served with sun dried tomatoes/olive oil was great. But when I say little, I mean little. There are very few tables and they are definitely cheek to jowl tight. And no reservations taken. We were there really early as we had tickets for a nearby show, but even then we got the last table. So either come early or expect to wait outside (no room inside) or go somewhere for a drink.
No comment
The food was amazing.  The deconstructed eggplant parmigiana was to die for. The service was exceptional.  I will be back again this week!
Wonderful Italian restaurant with friendly staff. Reasonably priced menu and a nice wine list. All the food is perfectly prepared and served. GreT place for lunch.
Excellent dinner! I had one of the pasta specials with lobster and was not disappointed. Small place (25 seats), great atmosphere. I will be back!!!
No comment

I was born and raised in Italy and this place is legit when it comes to authentic food. The homemade pasta was perfectly done. I'm thinking of having my son's First Communion here...and my Italian family is SUPER picky when it comes to eating out. Great place!

One of my favorite places to dine in the city. Perfect spot for a nice lunch or dinner. Atmosphere is quaint - a cute little tucked away gem. My husband is from Sicily, and this place does Sicilian perfectly. Lobster linguine is my absolute favorite - with a lovely bottle of rose! The fennel and orange salad is also delish. Can't go wrong. Service is usually on point, but love the fact you are literally in the same room with the chef as your food is being prepared. Exceptional atmosphere & experience. Fun for a long lunch, date night, or even to take friends/family visiting the city. Very authentic & Always a pleasure! Can't wait until our next visit.

Excellent service and delicious meal at this NYC trattoria.  We showed up on a weeknight without reservations and they miraculously found us a spot.  Despite the tight quarters and hopping business the staff  was jovial and kind - it really made the meal.  Portions were the perfect size.  Everyone in our party enjoyed their dishes. Dessert was great too - light cannoli filling and homemade compote on top of creme brûlée.  The perfect way to end the meal.  A little treasure in SoHo.

Great food and service. Everything is fresh and tasty.  Great ingredients  and atmosphere (Italian music and you can see the Italian chef working on the background). A MUST to anyone who enjoy good food.
Green tagliatelle with wild boar and shaved truffles was just unbelievably amazing! Nice service. Seafood risotto was also amazing.
Cozy and friendly atmosphere. Both the pasta and the fish we had were delicious, and the staff was so attentive. Great value for money as well!

The food is just amazing here. As quality/price restaurant, this is the best Italian food you can find in the city. The plates are not expensive and the food is really good. I suggest to go for lunch during the week of you are a in a lunch break since they have really good deals.
The best Pasta I have ever had in this part of the world and lunch prices at $10/plate was righteous! Had the Busiati Alla Norma Con Ricotta Salata.
Favorite little gem in soho. Rustic, fresh food and authentically prepared. Very cozy, great wine, and ideal for a date or small group. Not crazy expensive for the location as well!
Satisfactory Sicilian food. I have found the staff a little unctuous at times. There are three different branches in SoHo, serving different menus; this one (on Spring) is the only one I've tried.

Super good, Italian restaurant! Went there for the first time and I absolutely love it. The service was great and the food, amazing. Even though it wasn't the biggest place, it sure did feel cozy and comfortable. For dessert, I ordered crème brûlée and it was delicious! Totally recommend.

One of the best, authentic places in Manhattan. The waiters are mostly from Italy. Small inside, so it may be a little squishy but the food is fantastic. This isn't one of those stereotypical Italian restaurants with ridiculously huge portions and typical foods. So if that's what you're looking for, this is not the place. But if you want a great neighborhood spot with fresh pastas and a cozy atmosphere, you must try here.

Tiny...9 tables tiny...and perfectly cozy and friendly. Authentic and neighborhoody with plenty of Italian speaking customers.  Boisterous eruptions from time to time made it fun but not cheesy. Just authentic and friendly.  The open kitchen makes you feel part of the action as the two waiters interact with the chef. Wonderful pasta dishes served in stainless pans. Huge fresh salads. The fennel orange salad was fresh crisp and unique. Recommend sharing a salad they are so large. The wild boar ragu was so good I could not leave a bit in the pan despite the very generous serving. Excellent desserts as well. Nice simple wine selection. No cocktails (no space for a bar!).
This is an absolute gem of a restaurant. Everything about the meal here was amazing. The restaurant is very tight on space, but the food more than makes up for it.

Excellent flavors from the wine to rice balls to pasta. Great service. If you don't have wine, you're missing on the taste of Sicilian food. The table next to me only drank water and they missed a great taste opportunity. Sicilian, to me, means family. Excellent place.
Excellent food and service! The pasta was great, the fish outstanding, and could not have wished for a better "birthday" celebration song with flashing lights and singing. Just fantastic.
Great Italian food. Great service. I had an eggplant maccheroni dish with tomato sauce. Maybe too salty but otherwise wonderful. A must try place to eat

Just came back from our Italian vacation and so, so happy to find this gem! Authentic menu, good prices, tiny place! Octopus appetizer and swordfish filled with burrata were the standouts!!! We will definitely be back!
No comment

Small place with great Italian food at reasonable prices.  The service was brisk and accommodating (we were a party of four, walk-in on a Friday night) and the food was outstanding: creamy, fresh burrata and carpaccio for appetizer, and a variety of pastas for dinner, all great (but the special was particularly good).

This place ROCKS. The food, service, and atmosphere completely transported me back to Italy and was the perfect authentic spot I was looking for on our visit to NY. Honestly, I don't think you could go wrong with any dish here but if I had to suggest anything, go for the arracini appetizers -- they're one of my favorite Sicilian foods and I was impressed how delicious there were). Would 11/10 recommend this place. Can't wait to come back!

This was my third dining experience here and I've never had anything other than outstanding experiences. The last trip I had the swordfish appetizer and it was absolutely fantastic and the cavatelli is exceptional.

Very small and authentic. Dishes are variants on traditional recipes with wonderful presentation. Had the grilled octopus with tomatoes, capers and olives, followed up with the tagliatelle cinghiale. Staff spoke Italian (and English) and the place was full of hip Italians on holiday....a good sign!
Most ordinary food ever. Nothing special at all. I could have made this pasta at home without any effort in 10 minutes. Super boring. The waiters are extremely slow.

Great food! Huge portion! We had grilled octopus, salmon tartar, and calamari which was excellent. I had the orrechette with swordfish and eggplant - DELISH! Highly recommend it! Also their wine list is great.

This has been one of our family's go-to places for the last several years. There food has always been excellent and the service--if not perfect--at least attentive and interesting--definitely good enough to make up for the crowded setting. It's slowly transformed from a place, however, where the majority of the tables were speaking Italian to a tourist destination. I'll still give it 3 stars but there's obviously a reason. Last night, we sat with (yes--WITH, as we had tables 6 inches on either side of us) 2 tourists from Japan and 4 from the UK. We had a grigliata mista and polpo, which were both excellent and linguine all'astice, which is usually excellent, but was a bit over cooked this time. What was really disappointing, and killed the night for me, was that as we were finishing up, the table of 2 next to us left and the staff combined that table with another 2. As we were expecting the dessert menu, the waiter instead dropped the check on the table. At the same time, he gave the table of 4 on our other side dessert menus. A quick look at the entrance confirmed my suspicion--there was a party of 6 waiting to be seated and they wanted our 2 seats to add to the 4 next to us. That absolutely sucks! Not being a complainer and wanting to go somewhere with working a/c anyway, I paid the check and we went somewhere else for coffee. Maybe not a bad thing in the grand scheme of things because it'll give us a chance to try some other places for a while.
Amazing! I had the pasta with boar ragu and black truffle. It was perfectly done! Romantic and intimate vibes and great service! Just love it!

As italian, this is probably one of the best places in NYC: the food is fantastic, fresh ingredients and friendly and easy going atmosphere! The only down side is the size of the room, so probably not the best place for a 10 people table!

Went there the other day with a few girlfriends. Bought a bottle of wine and had 5 or so dishes to share. It was all so delicious and tasteful!! Appetizer: burrata and the swordfish wrapped in mozzarella. Main dishes: lobster linguine and the ravioli. Dessert: creme brûlée OMG! Everything was cooked to perfection. Can't wait to bring other people here

Chanced upon this cozy restaurant while making a quick shopping trip to soho. You cannot beat the lunch special of exquisitely prepared pasta dishes for $10! The gentleman who waited on me was prompt with refilling my water and graciously replenished my bread basket (I'm a bread monster!). He recommended the pasta with sardines and pine nuts saying that it is "authentic Sicilian." While I cannot verify that until I get to Sicily, the dish was very delicious and my pasta was cooked perfectly. Unabashedly, I sopped up the rest of the sauce with my bread.

Eh... I wasn't very impressed. The atmosphere was nice and all, but the food left a lot to be desired. I gave it a two because, well it's better than the Olive Garden, but that's about it. The sauce was overly salty, and the pasta was far from freshly made. My Arugula salad, was just bagged Arugula, thrown in a heap on a plate with some cheap cheese thrown on top. There wasn't a dressing on it, and I was offered oil and vinegar later. I really don't know where these reviews are coming from, maybe I went on a very very off night for them.

This place and the management is horrible. The tables and glasses are dirty, the service is very poor and you can tell that the writers are misstreated by the management. I would not recommend this place, not even to the enemies.
Amazing authentic Italian cuisine with incredible service. So impressed.
Amazing flavors. Tight squeeze. Singing cooks.

This has one of my favorite pasta dishes in NYC: fusilli langostinos. The sauce is delicious. Also enjoyed the sardines. The atmosphere of this place can transport you to Italy for a evening. Really appreciated the friendly staff. As walk ins on a Friday night we were treated to a free glass of prosecco while we waited a bit for a table.
No comment
Just fantastic! The service and food are top notch and they have cute Italian servers and chefs. The food is very authentic and I will be back here for sure.
They have 3 branches around Soho and I've been to 2. Food is great, portions amazing!

Excellent. Everything was great. The owner is from Catania and the menu is Sicilian. The restaurant has about 12 tables, a few of which are 2 person only. Started with a mista salad that had arugula, fennel, orange, tomatoes, onion. Taste was excellent and the portion significant. The waiter (all of the staff is Italian) recommended the Spinachi Tagliatelle Cinghiale, which is wild boar ragu with truffles. It was served in the pan it was finished in and it was excellent. Could taste shades of fennel seed, was a bit sweet, a bit spicy. I go to Italy every year, this is what you want from NY Italian food: Very good food, regional specialization and fair price. Entire meal was $26 and I was very full.

To me most Italian restaurants in America are not Italian food. I was surprised to see what Americans think Italian food is, they have no clue what culinary gem Italian food is. This restaurant has the flavors of Italian cuisine I've so long been looking for. The atmosphere is great too. I guess the only way for me to enjoy Italian food is to come to New York. Definitely New York is the foodie paradise. I've already recommended this place to everyone I know because they also didn't know what i was talking about when I would refuse to go to Italian restaurants elsewhere. I ordered the ravioli, they had ricotta inside and were cooked to perfection, they were some tiny meatballs mixed in with the sauce that was the most delicious thing I've ever eaten. I tried the bucatini pasta with truffle from one of out friends and it was delicious. The wine was very good too.
No comment
No comment

i feel like it was only okay??? i never really leave reviews but the restaurant straight up forgot about one of the orders at our table, and we had to ask a few times if it was still coming out. i was sitting under this weird vent that kept dripping all over me, and one of the waiters accidentally spilled beer and it got all up in my hair lmao. like the food was fine, whatever, but the experience itself was just really really weird and i feel like i would not actively seek out this spot again.
No comment
No comment

We ordered the "Green tagliatelle in a wild boar ragù topped with black truffle shavings" and "Cavatelli pasta in lamb ragù with porcini mushrooms and ragusano cheese". Both were absolutely amazing. Our favorite was the tagliatelle.
Shocking really bad food cheap ingredients, bad service, expensive. Don't go there!!! Only immature cooks can call it food!

I'm in love! The food here is amazing! We had the arancini, swordfish and polipo. The swordfish is something you must try, absolutely delicious. You can see that the chef cares about the quality of he food here.

Stumbled on it on a busy summer night with the family. I liked the way they made space. Attentive though busy staff. Interesting menu, good vegetable options. A little different in a pleasant way. Would definitely return.
No comment

So, last night I approached this restaurant in the rain, already filled with trepidation about being part of a large party of commercial real estate people in town for a convention (I'm not a commercial realtor, but I was meeting my uncle and his friends who were all here for this annual event). Anyway, the party size turned out to be 13 or 14 (I lost count when the waiter finally started filling my glass). While I still take issue with the young woman who selected this spot  for a group dinner and must not have seen "hole in the wall," I have to say that I was really impressed with the service. The waitstaff really rose to the occasion and remained pleasant, cheerful and helpful to us and the other restaurant patrons. We shared a selection of appetizers, and highlights included arancini and burrata. My end of the table did not like the involtini (swordfish appetizer) though. I believe we ordered every possible pasta. Prices were surprisingly reasonable (I mean, $25 for lobster linguine with a half lobster in it). I would visit again, but please know I think the staff handled an unexpected large party at the dinner rush commendably, but I don't want to be the person that does that to them again. I think it's much better suited to date night dinner or dinner with a few friends. Space is at a premium.

Maybe it was because it was Monday evening, but at 7pm this place was mostly empty. Tight, uncomfortable seating in a small square room. Service was well-intentioned but our waiter, though he tried, was new and not well trained / familiarized with the menu / preparations. Our food was decent. I started with the fennel and orange salad -- served in a big white bowl, it was crisp, well-chilled and refreshing. For my main I had the pasta alle sarde (penne with Sicilian sardines, pine nuts, sultana raisins & wild fennel) -- this was a nice dish, with the fish flaked into small bits, not too salty, but also not very memorable. Overall, the vibe was pretty listless -- during this visit at least, a more lively, convivial atmosphere would have been welcome.

Tiny place with excellent food choices, well prepared with excellent service. Got there early enough to sit outside. We had the eggplant parm appetizer with the spinach ravioli and sardines and pasta as entrees, both very good. Would love to go back.

This would've gotten 5-stars if they hadn't turned by 22% tip into a 115% tip. When I called to try to fix a "misunderstanding" they said they'd call me back but the manager never did. So, now it feels like dishonest service. Good thing I have my original receipt with the amount and can contest the bill. Too bad for them I won't be recommending to anyone.
Love this place! Good food, atmosphere, portions and service. Need to make a reservation on weekend because it's small.

So tiny, and the tables are so cramped together, it was uncomfortable. To top it off, they turn on the music very loud. The food was just okay. Pasta was overcooked--nothing memorable. I don't care for their gimmick of serving pastas and mains in pots. It's silly, awkward to eat out of, and the pan handles take up precious table space.

The food was incredible and the service was fantastic. We started with the calamari and it was the best, most tender I've had. We had the wild boar ragu pasta and a squid ink special pasta and both were great choices. The wine suggestion was perfect (Sangiovese, lighter red wine) and the panacotta was so light and creamy. This is one of the best restaurants in NYC!

Food was amazing especially their lunch specials! All pasta dishes are 10$ I had the spinach and ricotta ravioli with a sausage sauce it was delicious, only complaint is how small it is, not much room for large groups

Really?  How does this place have such high ratings?  I tried once, thought I might be missing something, so went back again since I'm local, and it was even worse!    First time, we both had pasta (me the lobster linguine), it was fine but lobster over cooked, pasta drenched in sauce and nothing special.  Second time I made the mistake of getting an arugula salad that I could've made better at home.  I was expecting something at least a little interesting -  "dressing" balsamic and olive oil that you pour on yourself, which I love, but don't need to pay $12 while expecting something interesting.   Then the steak was fine.   And my friends fish dish, mediocre  and a bit dry.  Service is very pleasant though.
No comment
It's not easy to find the Sicilian classic, pasta alle sarde, in New York City.  Bravo, Piccola Cucina!
No comment
I am italian and this Is One of the few places where I really feel home. Food is awesome, stuff is great! 10$ lunch deal. It's been the place of most of my lunch breaks. I will miss it.

Amazing Sicilian food. The lobster and linguini was excellent. The deconstructed eggplant parm appetizer by far the most innovated and delicious I every had. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. They recommended a wine "Terramora" which wasn't listed on the wine list and it was amazing and didn't break the bank at $44.00. I was tempted to bring one home it was so good. I putting it on my top 10 list!.

I think I found love in the form of lobster linguine and charming Italian servers. The restaurant is small, but is lively and welcoming; therefore, try to make a reservation. The food is to die for, I don't think I have tasted such good pasta in ages. The portions are huge and my boyfriend could not finish his lamb ragu and ended up packing it home. We had wine, a starter and shared a dessert. I would 100% recommend visiting this restaurant, I will be back!

Great place, cool village restaurant with excellent food and service.  Prices are very reasonable and a nice selection of Italian wines. The tight squeeze is acceptable as friendly people more than willing to strike up conversations

I wish I had more positive to say. The restaurant was unbearably crowded; tables just inches from each other. I was afraid I was going to accidently set my sweater on fire trying to squeeze into my seat (I am not a big person by any measure). The volume was set on "11" and exacerbated by singing and pot and glass banging by the staff. In a less cacophonous environment the noise may have added to a sense of celebration, instead it was just ear splitting and painful. Absolutely no room to wait for our table (we were about 10 minutes early for our reservation) on a night with sub-zero temperatures. We ended up at standing leaning over people already seated, along with two other hapless folks also waiting. Removing a few tables would do a lot for the crowding.  The whole thing was sensory overload for my companion and we ended up taking our food to go in order to extract ourselves as quickly as possible. The food was passable enough when we managed to eat it lukewarm at home.

Took J and his parents here for early dinner. We ordered 1 appetizer to share and 4 entrees. Somehow, they gave J and his father their entrees first, then J's mom and me the appetizer to share a few min later. Our entrees didn't show up till J and dad are already done with food. That was terrible timing. I could only assume they can't cook 4 entrees at a time :(
Incredible pasta, amazing wine, friendly staff and cozy location. Love that they deliver too!! Highly recommend. 10/10.

Without a shadow of a doubt, the most incredible heaven you can hope to dine at. The food is excellent and the staff are attentive and kind. The atmosphere is joyous and the overall experience is truly unforgettable.

I can't recommend this place enough! Hands down the best Italian spot in NYC! Food is amazing, wine is excellent, super friendly and funny staff (Luigi is the best;). Just love love love this place!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Beautiful little restaurant with a killer tiramisu (must try). Pasta's are great too. Portions were just right, service was great, and very affordable also. Highly recommended.
Pretty nice food!! And I love their desert wine so much. The price of lunch menu is very affordable.
Foon was fresh right from the kitchen.  Delicious flavors true authentic Italian restaurant.  Wait staff was good.  I will definitely go back next time I'm in NY.
really good food and ambiance.  place is a bit small but that's what adds to the charm.  be prepared to wait a few minutes but the food and service are worth the wait.

This is one of the best italian restaurant of the city: the food is almost better here than in Italy!! I have to admit that the service is a bit slow, but it s worthy to wait! If you come here, try the homemade Ravioli, the antipasti misti and the cannoli... Amazing!

Happened on this restaurant at noon today.  It is tiny, and my friend and I were not quite sure.  But we decided to try it, and What A Find!   The lovely open doors on a perfect Fall day made it seem particularly charming, but I bet it is totally cozy on a winter day, too.  The staff is extremely attentive, and very informative.  And the food -- based on my one experience, mind you -- is superb.  Said food was the tagliatelle with squid ink and calamari: the best rendition of this dish that I've ever had.  But everything on the menu looked good, and the appetizers also looked really inventive.  Finally, their pricing is excellent for the neighborhood.

Don't be seduced by the flashiness of the Dutch across the street.   Piccolo Cucina is the real deal.   As the name suggests it is rather piccolo (small).  But the food is the real deal.  Real Sicilians are cooking and serving the food here.  The bruschetta alone is to die for.  it only gets better from there. great fresh food. do it!
Fantastic food.... Arancini are the best I've had.... And I've lived in Sicili for a long time.

Really really intimate space, but lively and fun.  Good food, solid service, and terrific location.   Lots of reasonably priced wine options.  Hard to understand how you can get a meal this good for this price in this location,  but I don't need to understand,  just enjoy.  Would very much recommend the arancini and the tagliatelle cinghiale.

While the food was quite good and reasonably priced the service was terrible. We were corrected for our (correct) pronunciation of menu items by the wait staff, was without cutlery at one point and our drinks and water were never refilled in a timely manner. I could perhaps overlook the slow service if the restaurant was a large one or understaffed. But for such a small space the rude and slow service is simply unforgivable.
Definitely misjudged this place the first time I came. It is the most authentic Italian food I've had in NYC

We made reservations as a party of 12. The restaurant is quite small but accommodated us. The service as well as food turned out very well.  We had a good sampling of the menu.  The pastas were all homemade.  The food had good flavor, not too salty, nor under-seasoned.  The entire party enjoyed each of their dishes and left full and satisfied.

Piccola Cucina is THE Italian restaurant. To begin I have to say that I am Italian and I've been living in the city for around 3 years. Who knows NYC also knows that it's full of "Italian" restaurants. However probably a quarter of them are real Italian. Piccola Cucina is one of them. The food is amazing. I can feel the quality and the freshness of the ingredient and I can tell that they are coming straight from Italy. Luigi (the Chef) has the ability to connect tradition and innovation and create amazing courses. The burrata fritta is an example (if you stop by you have to try it). The "pasta" is also great. This is one of the few restaurants in NYC where I order risotto alla marinara. To complete the picture, all the team work very well. The service is great. Even if the place is pretty small, they are able to fit people in a way that doesn't hurt anybody. It seems to be part of a traditional Italian sunday lunch. If you are around, I definitively recommend Piccola Cucina. I can say that this restaurant is definitively in my top 3 list of restaurants in NYC.

This was my first dinner at Piccola Cucina, and the food was great! I had the Lobster Linguine, a glass of Rose, and finished with the Panna Cotta for desert. There were some cons to the experience: we had a reservation at 7:15 but we had to wait about 30 minutes until we were seated, and the restaurant is very small. Nonetheless, I was able to get over these things quite quickly because the food was spectacular. I had the lobster linguine and my partner had the green tagliatelle in wild boar ragu, both of which were very delicious! The service was very quick and the presentation was undoubtedly unique, as the dishes were served in pots. We skipped the appetizers but shared the raspberry and pistachio panna cotta, which was presented nicely in a deconstructed fashion--we did everything short of licking the plate. For two entrees, one glass of wine, and one panna cotta, the check was about $70 before tax and tip, so it was a bit pricier than expected, but $25 for the lobster linguine was a good deal and it left me very satisfied. To conclude, the food was amazing and the menu was quite diverse, so I'll no doubt be returning to Piccola Cucina!

My boyfriend and I tried Piccola for the first time last night and we are so glad we did! The pasta was delicious and cooked perfectly. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive. At one point the staff was actually slightly over attentive (which I would take over under attentive any day) which led to taking away our appetizer a little sooner than we wanted. Not a big deal and we didn't think much of it - but then when they realized what had happened, they went completely above and beyond to make up for that tiny error. The chef put together a new appetizer to go and came over to give it to us and apologize. The host and waiter came over to apologize and he understood what went wrong exactly, almost word for word to what we were thinking ourselves. And to top it off they gave us cannolis on the house - which were also delicious. We have dined at many different Italian restaurants in the city and some have made worse mistakes than this, but no other restaurants have gone to these lengths to make sure we walked out happy. This would have been a great night off of the food alone but the incredible staff is what made it one of our new favorite spots in New York. We will definitely be back!

Yet again I have to give a shout out to this restaurant - not just for the food which is consistently spectacular - but for the amazing service that tonight went so above and beyond that I almost cannot find the words.  When we arrived for our 7:30 reservation, the waiters had a quick pow wow because I was uncharacteristically walking with a cane and they were worried that I would not be comfortable at the table that had held for us.  I was completely taken aback and so touched at their concern and thoughtfulness.  And then Alfio and Misa went even further, checking to see if there might be any changes in my dietary restrictions (which amazingly they remembered down to the last detail). It's so trite to say this - but these guys - and the other wonderful staff whose names I do not know - really make their customers feel like family - such a warm and personal welcome - not only to us but to everybody who walks in. This is THE place in NYC as far as we are concerned - for regular dinners, special occasions - everything. Thank you, Piccola Cucina Osteria staff- you REALLY get it right every time!

First time at this tiny Sicilian restaurant on Thursday and thoroughly enjoyed the food. Four of us shared some starters of meatballs, swordfish-wrapped mozzarella and octopus with beans. All great. Italian friend with us recommended sardine pasta as our main, which was really great with the sardines almost turned into a ragu over the pasta (very different to plain grilled sardines I am used to from Portuguese cooking). Would definitely go back.
No comment
New opening, pretty relaxing decor. Food is also delicious- great deal on the lunch specials!

We arrived on time for our 9pm reservations for 2 and were told it would be a 10 to 15 min wait, however the restaurant is so small that there is literally no place to wait but outside in the cold. After waiting for 10 min outside, 4 people walked up to the restaurant without reservations and were told if would be a 10 min wait. 5 min later they sat the table of 4 and told us it would be another 5 minutes. We were in complete shock that they would sit a party without a reservation ahead of us, especially since every table in the restaurant is a 2 top that they push together to accommodate larger parties. The host could care less, so we left.

TINY and cramped with uncomfortable chairs. If the table next to you is a group,of four, you can't hear  the waiter speak.  No place but the floor to put your coat.   But the food is very good.   Too bad you can't relax and enjoy it.
From the very first taste, I knew we were going to absolutely love this place.  The food and wine were great, and the service was excellent.
Local reflects the beautiful new york past years, very good and friendly service, you well-deserved 4 stars

Entrees the size of appetizers, people next to us ordered the same dish, they were twice as large. Maybe we got stiffed because we didn't order drinks or we didn't measure up as desired customers. Avoid this tourist trap

Went here for dinner with a bunch of old Italian fellows, some of whom had parents who had emigrated from Italy.  So even if you can't trust my opinion, you can definitely trust theirs, and we were all impressed by this cozy restaurant.  We started with a few appetizers: salad, which was pretty ordinary, squid, which was delicious, and sardines.  At the time I wasn't blown away by the sardines, but I've been craving their flavor ever since, so they must have been good.  My dinner-mates were especially taken with them.  I had the fish of the day, branzino, as my entree, and it was delicious, though it was a fairly small portion and the most expensive entree on the menu ($25).  The other guests ordered the meat selection of the day (chicken, sausage, etc.), the ravioli in lamb ragu, and a sardine pasta dish, and after trying a little of everything, I can say that there wasn't one dish I wouldn't order again.  It was also pretty reasonably priced (entrees started at about $14).  My Italian friends plan on making it their dinner place of choice, and they won't have to twist my arm to tag along.

Some hits and some misses - the gumbo and rice with octopus were both pretty salty, and the yellowtail crudo could've used a little more seasoning on the fish itself instead of on top of it. The favorite of the night was the corn dumplings! Super interesting and different

Food was pretty good! Everything was unique and flavorful. The corn dumplings were delicious. Overall, everything was really good but it was super expensive for small portions. Would consider going back for a special occasion.
No comment

Mokyo - the sister restaurant to thursday kitchen - is phenomenal. The service was extremely friendly and attentive. We were seated right away for our reservation on a Saturday evening. There is a spacious room in the back of the restaurant with beautiful, rustic decor. Our waiter suggested ordering 2-3 plates per person - each plate was shared with the table. We had the corn dumplings, beef tartar, wagyu oxtail spring roll, scallop (served with a yummy creamy purée), gumbo, and noodle (best one) - and we loved every single dish. Each dish is small but the food was fresh, flavorful and beautifully plated. Overall, great service and food, will return!

Corn dumplings were actually super good! This might've been our favorite of the tapas. It was creamy and savory and the corn flavor was mild but complemented the truffle. Other favorites were the gumbo and the noodle. Drinks wise I really liked the lychee cocktail. They put the cocktails in bags that glowed which was a fun spin.

I LOVE Mokyo. Tho was my second trip there. All of the food is phenomenal. The corn dumplings are my favorite things on the menu. The noodles were delicious but a tad spicy for me (admittedly not a spice guy) but still delicious. Recommend you get 2-3 plates per person and share

LOVE this spot! Every dish is so delicious and unique. Especially love the oxtail spring rolls, lobster roll, and yellowtail crudo.

The cutest spot with each dish intricately prepared. Would definitely recommend the cauliflower and corn dumplings- my top 2 favorites of the night!
Go here and get at least 2 orders of the corn dumplings!!! We got complimentary sake when we sat, server gave great recs and place was lively and full but not too loud!

Delicious shareable plates - we liked everything we ordered - lobster roll, noodles, ribs, rice with octopus, desserts, etc. They also start you off with free sake and the cocktails were good too.

I came here on New Year's Eve and wow the service was phenomenal!  The food was delicious, our favorite was probably the mini lobster rolls.  The drinks were also very good.  Will recommend this place to friends and will try to come back soon!

I love Korean food. This place had such amazing tapas styled plates that I was able to share with my friend. The drinks were AMAZING and came in cute little pouches. I love Korean food but I don't think that I would go there again, just because I don't really like fancy food as much. Which is what I felt from this place. I'm super happy I tried it and heard good stuff about the sister restaurant that I think I would try next!!

Went to dinner there with my son based on a recommendation from someone on my flight to Manhattan. So glad I went there. We had the corn dumplings and 5 out of 5, beef tartare 4.5 out of 5, yellowtail crudo 4 out of 5, lobed roll 4.5 out of 5, gumbo 4.5 out of 5, rice with octopus 5 out of 5, and lastly injeolmi mousse 4.5 out of 5.  Top 5 best meals in the past year.

Mokyo is the sister restaurant to Thursday Kitchen, but I definitely enjoyed Thursday Kitchen more.  The food here was delicious, but the portions are extremely small for the price.  I know they serve tapas, but I think I could have used a little more in each plate.  The best dish here was the Octopus with Rice.  That is definitely a must get, and the most worth it.  The ribs are also very good - fall off the bone, juicy, and flavorful.  The corn dumplings are sweet and creamy with a little citrusy kick to them - delicious!  Every dish is very creative and delicious.  I just wish the portions were a bit bigger.  Definitely come here if you want just a snack, not a meal.

Super similar to their sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen. A different menu offered with a slightly different spin on fusion. My favorites were the corn dumplings and wagyu

Really cute spot, come with friends and share a bunch of things, or a cute spot for a date night! They have cocktails in capri sun bags. The mango lychee was really good! Also they give welcome sake shots which is a nice touch. For food def do the oxtail spring rolls and cauliflower, both were amazing. Noddles are good, and we got the scallops which were also amazing! Would def come back to try more of the menu.

Everything was so inventive and delicious. The corn dumplings and jambalaya were incredible. Cocktails were delicious and great value too.
