There is no debate when it comes to Mokyo. Not only did i thoroughly enjoy my meal but i RETURNED BACK a week later because I could not stop thinking about the truffle corn dumplings and oxtail spring rolls. Those are by far the 2 best menu items. I also got the rice and octopus which was incredible. I typically don't enjoy octopus but I enjoyed this so much I got it again on my return. The plantains were just average but I am confident they were the only "average" thing about the menu. The steak was incredible as well: juicy and served medium rare. I can't wait to return back to Mokyo because the food is to die for and the ambiance just makes the experience that much better.

Came with a party of 5 and we decided to order everything on the menu. Our server started us off with a round of complimentary sake shots, and they were also gracious enough to accommodate an extra person (we had made the resy for 4). All the dishes were great, but some standouts were the Cauliflower, Corn Dumpling, Lobster Roll, Scallop, and Noodle!

A bit disappointed in MOKYO. Their sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen, is better in my opinion. The dishes at MOKYO are overpriced for what they are worth. Their hints of Korean flavor are miniscule. Walk-ins have to sit at the bar even when tables are empty.
No comment

Mokyo is a gem! It is a sister restaurant from Thursday kitchen which is one of my favorite restaurants. They have some similar menu items and new ones as well. It would be a little bit better if it had more different items than Thursday but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu

Really cute and fun experience! The small plates were great and super tasty - loved the little lobster rolls and the corn dumplings. The cocktails were also so fun and cute. My only complaint is that the portions were so small - we unfortunately left a little hungry!

Nice service and decor. The food was a bit of a hit or miss. We ordered 8 dishes for the 3 of us. I enjoyed the corn dumplings, scallops and wagyu steak. The yellowtail, plantains, spring rolls and lobster rolls were ok. The steak was too chewy and we had to spit it out. Overall it was a nice experience but way overpriced for the quality and quantity. Not likely to return

Must try everything in the menu! The tastes, flavors and presentation makes you feel like you're at a Michelin restaurant! Also the service was wonderful! 10/10 will definitely come back soon!
No comment

Really excited to see so many modern Korean places pop up around the city, and Mokyo lived up to the hype! Out of what we ordered, the corn dumplings, oxtail spring roll, and cauliflower were the standouts. I was tempted to get another order of the corn dumplings - they weren't what I expected and unlike anything I've tried before, but the combination of the savory corn and parmigiano with the truffle salsa was a touch of genius. We also got the rice with octopus which I thought I'd love since I'm a huge congee/juk fan but found a bit bland. The injeolmi mousse was honestly one of the best restaurant desserts I've had -- definitely don't skip it, it was a perfect ending to the meal.
No comment
Sister restaurant of Thursday kitchen. Quaint eating environment with friendly staff and free sake. Food was great and came quick, was expecting a bit more for the price but would come back again
No comment

The entrance of the restaurant looks small but they actually have plenty of space in the back. We ordered the spring roll, octopus with rice, and corn dumpling and honestly it's enough for two people. The corn dumpling tastes similar to Thursday Kitchen's edamame dumplings but my favorite dish has to be the octopus with rice. It is flavorful and the rice is well prepared. 10/10 would come back to try the tartare and scallops

One of the best meals I've ever had. I would give recommendations for what to order but we honestly tried so much and it was all spectacular. I'll make this place a regular visit when I'm in New York. Try it asap

Everything tasted so good. Vibes were great and staff was attentive. We got seated quickly. Make sure you make a reservation.

The food was fine but doesn't stand out. The inside dining was very noisy so it isn't a good spot if you're looking for a place to chat and catch up w friends.

Best Korean food I've ever had. In a city with a ton of Korean options Mokyo stands out. Everything on the menu is good, the service is great, and the vibe hits the mark. Do not miss this.

Absolutely phenomenal!! It's been a long time since I've had a meal that was this exceptional. We ordered 5 different dishes and EVERY dish was amazing. Even Michelin star restaurants aren't able to manage that. Now, i have to try Thursday Kitchen.

Fantastic little place for tapas style Korean inspired dishes. Reservations are recommended. The kitchen turns out amazing dishes including the ribs, corn dumplings (2 orders please), hamachi, etc. the pop rocks mascarpone ice cream is super fun to eat as well.

No comment

They give you a complimentary shot of sake before you even order! We are two two tiny girls and we ordered 5 dishes and we were pretty stuffed. The order of tasty dishes was 1) octopus rice 2) scallops 3) ribs 4) gumbo 5) beef tartare. We also ordered the hazelnut mousse and it was amazing. Overall, the presentation and taste was on point. It was about $200 in total. Service was attentive and food came out fairly quickly. Would recommend and dine again!
No comment

Wow, this place was incredible! My husband and I are still in conversation days later about how fantastic the food was. From arrival, our expectations were far exceeded. Everyone working here was kind and the service was superb. We tried a bunch of different dishes from the menu and liked everything but one dish (the cauliflower was kind of basic). The server recommended 2-3 per person and he was definitely right. Each dish was a small tasting and had its own distinct flavor profile. The corn dumplings were complex and delicious. The texture was smooth and it just had such a wonderful umami taste. The beet tostada was also interesting and had so many different textures in each bite. The food on the menu seemed simple, but each bite was so much more complex than it appeared. I can't wait to return on my next visit to the East Village!

Quality, creative, and delicious Korean fusion dishes. We really enjoyed all the dishes we ordered including dessert. The octopus rice was especially wonderful with melt in your mouth octopus. Service was attentive.

An amazing Korean fusion small plate restaurant, Mokyo, the sister restaurant of Thursday Kitchen, presents an elevated experience of comfort Korean fusion. Everything on their menu was excellent, but standouts include the lobster roll, corn dumplings, and octopus rice. Would def nut again

Portion are small but it's essentially Thursday Kitchen 2.0. If you're familiar with their first restaurant then you'll enjoy Mokyo too. The food is good and the drinks are fun (if you get the adult capri-sun soju cocktails). Restaurant is small, not as dark as Thursday Kitchen and not as loud. Food is good but nothing was out of this world.
No comment

Thursday and Mokyo both have me at a chokehold. They're both so good and I always have trouble deciding which one to go to. If I can have a subscription to come once a month or two a month I definitely would. Corn and edamame dumplings by far my favorites. Only thing I would consider for space is expanding!

The food was very good. There are definitely a lot of unique flavors. The corn dumplings, The noodles and the cauliflower were my favorite. do not try their cocktails. They don't have a liquor license so many of the drinks are unusual. The vibe is good. The wait staff was nice but a little bit hard to understand. The water was refilled every few minutes. I do think it's a little too pricey for the portion size.
The food is to die for. I love this place and have been twice. Definitely make reservations cause they are fairly busy.

Cozy, clean find on St. Marks. Korean traditional flavors mixed with a modern spin and it works!! Each tapas/dish was carefully crafted and prepared. The food was excellent and surprisingly filling. We had three people and seven plates. Our favorites were: corn dumplings, octopus and rice, and sweet plantain katsu. Service and servers are so excellent!! Definitely recommend it!

this korean fusion restaurant is very delicious. each plate was very unique and full of flavor.

I finally got to try mokyo after wanting to go for so long. I am a huge fan of Thursday's kitchen so when mokyo opened up, I had no doubt that it would be amazing as well. The food was so delicious and everything that I expected. We had a total of 6 dishes between two of us( they are small tapa style dishes) and we finished every last bite. We left full and content. My favorite was definitely the pork jowl. It was super tender and had a buttery texture. The corn dumplings reminded me of Thursday's kitchens truffled Mac and cheese which is my favorite dish from Thursday's so that was amazing. The mini lobster rolls and the gumbo also did not disappoint. Other than the amazing food, our server Sophie was such a joy to be around and gave us the best experience. Bernard also took great care of us. I would definitely recommend and will be bringing all of my friend back!
No comment
No comment

Super fun spot with some amazingly creative and tasty dishes! The menu is all small plates, so it's a fun spot for a date and an even more fun spot to dine with a group. Then you get to try more! The restaurant is lively, making it a fun spot for a weekend night. Our waiter was incredibly kind, guiding us through the menu and checking in between dishes. The drinks were served in giant adult Capri sun pouches with a light on the bottom, which amused us to no end. On top of the silly but cute presentation, the drinks were great! I recommend the pure strawberry and the mojito. But the stars of the night were there dishes, specifically the cauliflower, oxtail spring roll, Berkshire rib, and noodle dishes. I would also recommend the sweet plantain and and crudo. The beet tostada was good, but I'd be fine skipping it, and the pink lady apple was the least favorite of the bunch. But overall, every member of our party had a different favorite dish- the mark of a great night enjoyed by all!

Got a couple of different tapas here and the lychee reach rich. I'm normally not a huge fan of cocktails but the lychee drink was really good and was served in a transparent pouch with a small light inside, which was fun. The tapas themselves were pretty overpriced in my opinion. The server said 2-3 tapas is reasonable per person but I was not really full after 3 and I have a smaller appetite than most people. The ambiance was also nothing to write home about in my opinion - I thought it was too loud to hear the people I was eating with. This would have been ok had the prices been a bit more reasonable.
No comment
No comment

This place is absolutely divine. I took a friend here for an early dinner and we left feeling full and happy. We were catching up after several months of distance and having a delightful meal to pair with our reunion was bliss. I cannot recommend the corn dumplings enough. I also think the noodle are not to be missed. My friend has an allergy to nuts so the waiter explained what dishes had nuts before we ordered. Unfortunately the noodles are made with a peanut sauce, so I got them all to myself. The service and the food were perfect. Phenomenal experience.

Mokyo is the sister restaurant of Thursday Kitchen. We came here on a Wednesday night and were able to be seated quickly. The menu is very similar to Thursday Kitchen as in it's all tapas but with very different flavors. The chef is the same in both locations and she's so talented. We ordered 6 dishes to share between two people and we were stuffed! Everything was delicious but I think the gumbo was my favorite. I loved the corn dumplings as well, its taste was nothing like I've ever had before but in a good way. Bernard took care of us that night and he is amazing! Such great customer service. He even gave us some sake tastings. Great food, great cocktails as always and great company. What more can I ask for? 100% recommend for a date night or even to catch up with some friends. They do have a larger table now that indoor dining is available.
No comment
No comment

Managed to get a walk in 2-ppl table on a Sat night - a bit lucky in fact as the place quickly get more crowded. Very unique Korean fusion food with wild ingredients that surprise your palate. Loved the pork jowl - the strong taste is balanced so well with the squash. The oxtail spring roll is an exciting creation of a modern comfort food. Would love to come again.

Get the corn dumplings with truffle salsa verde! That was the favorite dish of the evening among our group of 6 along with the oxtail spring rolls and noodles. Everything tasted great but those were our faves. Appreciated the creativity in the dishes and wonderful balance in flavors. Not only was the food delicious but the service was top notch by our server Sofia. Will definitely be returning and hoping they always have those corn dumplings on the menu!
No comment

Inventive and exciting small plates with diverse flavors. Everything I ordered was delicious especially the empanadas, but again, you can't go wrong. The consuls were also delicious especially their twist on a French 75.

Delicious small plates, but they are each pretty small so do expect to order about 3 plates per person at least, so it'll be a bit pricey. And expect a wait during the usual busy times.

The service was impeccable and the food was exquisite. I would definitely recommend getting the pork jowl, its a must have if youre in the area :) They take reservations through resy, theyre typically always booked so make sure to reserve ahead of time. Everyone at Mokyo was incredibly friendly and the entire restaurant was so clean. They give you a shot of sake as a palate stimulator and it made everything all the more tasty :)

Had an early dinner here yesterday. It's tapas style so my boyfriend and I ordered 6 plates to share. We got the yellowtail crudo, oxtail spring rolls, gumbo, lobster rolls, pork jowl, and the rice with octopus. Everything was delicious but my favorite was the rice with octopus, that is a must get. Our waiter was very kind and explained all the dishes as they came out. He also gave us complimentary sake shots, which was a nice touch. We also ordered the lychee mango and blah blah blue cocktails. The lychee mango is the most popular but I preferred the blah blah blue. Cant wait to come here again to try the other dishes and have the rice with octopus again!

Had a wonderful dinner here. The drinks are super fun and delicious - they come in pouches with light bulbs. The server recommended 2-3 dishes per person for sharing and two of us got 5. Every dish is outstanding. My favorites are the steak and grilled octopus on rice, both very well seasoned and cooked to perfection. The corn dumplings have a very interesting texture - the filling tastes like corn soup. The cauliflower is also good - sweet, sour, and sticky. The only thing to note is that for the price point, the portion size is small. If you come hungry or have a bigger appetite, you may need to order more.
The food was great. We tried the spring rolls, dumplings, and steak. The dumpling was the best one with amazing taste. Overall, a bit pricey though.

Cute little Korean tapas spot in the east village. Interesting menu with creative flavors! The corn dumplings were very savory, and you can definitely taste the truffle in the silky filling.  The oxtail spring roll was one of my favorite items and a must order! The steak was just okay, nothing really amazing to scream about. The yellowtail crudo had an interesting sauce that reminded me of the dipping sauce for viet summer rolls lol and the lobster rolls were really tiny (2 bites max) but good. My other favorite dish was the rice with octopus, really flavorful and the octopus was cooked perfectly and not chewy at all! Expect to order 2 to 3 plates per person, as the the portions aren't that big, as expected for tapas.  Definitely make reservations because it's pretty popular, and was poppin even on a snowey Friday night. One last comment, the tables are pretty closely situated together, so keep that in mind.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing quality food. It's an Asian tapas place so expect small portions, can get pricey if you're eating to be satitated but quality really was top notch. The octopus was probably my favorite, but thought everything here was delicious. Highly recommended

I've always been the biggest fan of Thursday Kitchen so it's safe to say I was incredibly excited to try everything Mokyo had to offer. Dined on Friday and ordered the hits: corn dumplings, pork jowl, steak, rice and octopus, noodles, the lobster roll, and finished with the mousse for dessert. The clear stars for us were the corn dumplings and the pork jowl - perfection. You can't go wrong with this menu, go with friends so you can try it alllllll. Can't wait to run back. Also, shout out to the staff as the service was incredible. They stopped by to explain every dish and give us tips on how to best enjoy it and we really appreciated the level of detail and attentiveness.
No comment

Please go. Just don't even read this review or anyone else's review because everyone has different palates and taste preferences but literally. Just go. Check out Mokyo. From the food to service, everything was delightful and wonderful. I can't believe how delicious every dish was. Each dish came out at a great pace and the server explained every dish in detail. My friends and I shared the oxtail spring rolls, yellowtail crudo, scallops, CAULIFLOWER, corn dumplings, octopus and rice, and Berkshire ribs. Oh my. Each dish had such a complex flavor profile. The corn dumplings evolved in my mouth - at first I thought too creamy, but it became nutty, savory, sweet - all in one bite. The scallops were cooked PERFECTLY. I hate over-cooked scallops but these ones were amazing. The cauliflower was the star because the bite was crisp - both inside and outside. Every component on that dish served it's purpose and I couldn't get enough of it. My friend loved the octopus and rice - to the extent that she said she would ask for it as a last meal. Gosh, so proud of what chef Kay has achieved and the marriage between Korean and Spanish cuisine. Please go support.
No comment
One of the best places I've eaten since the pandemic. I found this place on TIK TOK!!!! We were the first guests there today sat outside. You must try everything LOL!
No comment
No comment

This place is one of my all-time favorites in the city! The aesthetic is simple, clean, but manages to be comfortable and chic. The service here is fabulous as well.  I really can't say enough good things.  I've had several things on the menu and standouts are the dumplings, crudo, and octopus rice dish.  The house sake is smooth and guests get a sample when they're seated.  A great touch!
No comment

Cute date spot with small plates and decent selection of drinks. I liked the spring rolls and the mousse. The cocktail drinks came in pouches which was interesting. It's also conveniently located near Saint Marks!

Absolutely loved our meal! I wish we could have dumplings from the Mokyo Every  day  and I mean it. We actually ordered a second plate after tasting the first one. Loved the Noodle as well, it was spicy but just the right amount of spicy

Such a fun restaurant to visit now that things are opening back up. Great for a casual friends hangout or even something more special. My group of 4 was able to order almost everything on the menu. Our favorites were the lobster roll, plantains and corn dumplings. But you really can't go wrong here. The service was also so patient and accommodating! Restaurants like MOKYO are what makes New York so wonderful.

Mokyo is an absolutely outstanding dining experience. We had 12 different tapas off the menu and every one of them was simply delicious. Incredibly creative tastes, beautifully plated. And the service was off-the-charts excellent (thank you, Daniel!!) To deliver such an end-to-end experience - so amazing at so many levels, such attention to detail, all while making it look effortless - is truly special. This place is a gem. I felt lucky to have found it and will most definitely be back.
No comment

No comment
No comment

Great food and great service. We originally had a rezzie for Thursday Kitchen but due to my lactose allergy we couldn't eat much of the food. When we came to MOKYO, the waiter walked us through every dish, telling us the ingredients and what substitutions we could make - which we could do for almost every dish. Despite coming with no reservation, which I would recommend, they were able to seat the two of us for 1.5 hours, which was enough time. Pork jowl was the star, with it being just as described by the waiter - crispy on the outside and soft and chewy (and very fatty) on the inside. Personally, a close second for me the was the gumbo - super flavorful, not really sure how to describe it though so you just have to believe me! Cauliflower kind of tasted just like marinated chicken wings, so would skip on ordering this. The rice was super soft, as was the octopus. You couldn't really taste that it was octopus but the dish was still worth getting. Spring rolls were crunchy with a great sauce on the side. Our meal came out to $80 for 2 people, so if you have a budget - be careful since it's easy to order a lot given they are tapas and everything is pretty good. Despite the price, I do think it's worth coming here, even if only once!

When I heard the news that Cuomo is shutting down indoor dining once again, I immediately booked a table at Mokyo. This place was on my "must-eat" list. And this is my first time dining here. I must say, if they served their dishes in oversized dishes and charge double the price, they can easily get a Michelin Star. Really Michelin-Star quality food at very fair price!

This place is awesome! Super cozy vibe, very LES style layout and decor. The cocktails come in cute bags with light up cubes and are delicious. The service is wonderful and the food is sooo tasty. We got the spring rolls ( so good), corn dumplings ( very rich and very good) the noodles and the ribs. All the food was so flavorful and our server took great care of us, we even got a little welcome shot! Highly recommend this place, make sure to book a reservation ahead of time!
No comment

one of the cutest restaurants i've been to in the city! fav dishes were the lobster time and oxtail spring rolls (not pcitured) drinks were really pretty and a little on the stronger side. even if you come with just two people, you can get ~5 dishes. i'd def come back to try their other items like the dumplings which look really good! best part was the amazing service-the waitress (or maybe she was the owner) was super genuine and was patient when she was explaining her recommendations.
No comment
Can get expensive if you are ordering to be full at the end of the meal. Recommend the corn dumplings and steak. Food was extremely good!

Great food and great service at the right price. I actually enjoy every dish on this menu and love the pace/flow here. Some favorites are the ribs, lobster rolls, oxtail and dumplings but as I said, you can't go wrong with anything.
No comment
No comment
UPDATE: went back to Mokyo for Valentine's Day.  Ordered the pork jowel - MUST have, the dish is divine
No comment

I think Mokyo might be my favorite Korean restaurant in all of NYC! We ordered 5 dishes and at the end were debating which one we liked the most (hint: they were all absolutely delicious but it was the corn dumplings for me). They do have a strict reservation policy, but the food just doesn't disappoint. Highly recommend this place to anyone who wants a punch of flavor with every bite!
Was able to taste multiple dishes, all very flavorful. Friendly staff, cozy vibe, great food & drinks.
No comment
No comment

Amazing food, cocktails and friendly staff! The corn dumplings are a must have! They burst open in your mouth, and the truffle accent flavors were divine. I also loved the plantains and yellow-tail sashimi. So delicious and excellent. If you like spicy things, get the cauliflower. It seriously tasted like spicy Buffalo crispy chicken. Perfect temperature and texture. The lychee-mango cocktail  brought back memories drinking Capri Sun, served glowing from inside oh and I forgot the shot of sake they brought to welcome me. So fun.
No comment

This is by far my favorite restaurant, the customer service and the food is absolutely amazing. Without a reservation they sat my friend and I down during a busy dinner time AND where able to give us a bigger table when our third friend arrived. They proceeded to give us complimentary sake shots and complimentary shots of their nicest vodka. The food here is something I have never tasted before, I literally cannot get enough. If I could give this place 11 stars I would.

Delicious food, refreshing drinks and amazing service make Mokyo worth a visit! We ended up coming here because the sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen, had a 2 hour walk-in waiting list. So glad we did! Ordered a grapefruit beer - fresh draft Sapporo mixed with grapefruit for only $6. We also ordered the corn dumplings, spicy noodles and octopus with rice, which was plenty for two people. The service was really polite and excellent too, and I appreciated that the servers explained each dish as they set it down. Happened to come here on the night of the flash storm, and they even quickly reconfigured the umbrellas to help us stay as dry as possible. I want to come back and try everything else on the menu!

I had a dream the other night about the corn dumplings here and honestly I don't even like dumplings in general that much. Or corn. Low key and intimate atmosphere added to the experience. Every item on the menu is  you cannot go wrong. Go with the server recommendations. Complimentary sip of sake at the beginning of the meal too, nice. Try Thursday kitchen too right around the block if you love this place!

This place was absolutely delicious!!! When we ordered we asked the waitress what the best dishes were and she suggested the lobster roll, corn dumplings, and pork jowl and they did not disappointed! Each of those dishes were so flavorful and tasty it was like an explosion of goodness in my mouth with each bite. The corn dumplings were incredibly unique in their flavor profile, it is hard to describe. The sauce was slightly sour and balanced well with the starchy flavor of the corn filling inside the dumpling. The pork jowl was so soft, it practically melted in your mouth, and was incredibly well seasoned. The lobster roll was my personal favorite as the bread was so soft and the lobster was perfectly cooked with a wonderful sauce to top it off. The other items we ordered were definitely not as good as the first three. The plantain katsu was boring compare to those other dishes and it just didn't have as much flavor. The pistachio sauce definitely helped with the flavor but overall it was not as good. The oxtail spring rolls were fairly average and the sauce didn't add much flavoring to it. The meat was very soft and cooked well but it lacked seasoning in my opinion. My least favorite item was the gumbo as I just didn't liked the seasoning and it tasted the most generic to me. I enjoyed the pop rocks dessert though as the ice cream wasn't too sweet but had a thick texture that paired well with the fun pop rocks. Overall, I would definitely order those first three dishes, maybe even a couple of each because they will impress.
This is one of my favorite places in NYC! The servings are small but every dish is so tasty. Highly recommend!
Pretty good food. Some dishes were overly salty. Service was a bit slow. Drinks were kind of gimmicky.
No comment

this place is great! great service and atmosphere too. personal favorites were the beef tartare, lobster roll, steak (not pictured), and yellowtail crudo. the mousse also tasted great -- was a bit hesitant to order it because i expected it to be too sweet for my taste, but i'm glad i tried it. we ordered 7 dishes for two, so the costs added up. however, all the dishes were well-presented and tasted great. we also ordered two drinks, and the little light-emitting device put in the drinks made taking pictures much more fun. would recommend this place!

The food here is delicious! I came one time when they first opened and the food has improved drastically since then. All the dishes we ordered were really good (oxtail spring rolls, fried cauliflower, steak, pork jowl) and all memorable on their own. I'll definitely be back!
No comment

This spot is great and offers decent food. The service is awesome the Korean host patiently introduced us the food. However, food portion is surprisingly small, smaller than all we thought. So you'd better have that in mind before you order. Overall, I really like the lobster roll it's stunningly amazing! Must order!  ($50-70 per person if you wanna leave with a full stomach)

No comment

Possibly my favorite restaurant in the entire city. It's even better than Thursday Kitchen which I thought would be unbeatable. The food is like no other you will ever eat anywhere else. Every single dish we had was phenomenal.

Lovely spot with attentive service. All the dishes we ordered were amazing, no complaints. My favorite would have to be the super tender and flavorful pork jowl. Every other dish was great too, butternut squash toast with the steak was really smooth and buttery, corn dumplings were creamy and delicious, lobster roll had amazing flavor, and the spring rolls were perfectly crispy. Dishes are small so I would recommend at least 5 dishes to share for two people.

Went for a post-date snack and drink, and I loved it. They have a large menu of sake and soju; we ordered a carafe of sake ($22). The small-plate style was super conducive to sharing food. We had these fusion dumplings ("corn dumplings" on menu) that seemingly combined Korean and Tuscan cuisine (the dumplings had truffles and parmesan cheese). I then went again for a proper dinner and it did not disappoint. We ordered 6 plates for 3 people, which was perfect portion-wise. Oxtail spring roll, lobster roll, gumbo, and pork jowl were divine and highly creative. Octopus and wagyu were okay and not super exciting.

Great food and great dinner date location. Tapas - small portions, told to order 2-3 per person. Small portions and it being slightly pricy matches the slightly upscale atmosphere. Corn dumplings: A+ creamy, milky, and complimented perfectly with truffle flavor. Would definitely order again. Pork Jowl and steak: both were cooked well with excellent flavor. Chicken: average, powerful sriracha flavor, worth skipping. Noodles: not chewy, flavor okay, do not recommend. Had fun cocktails, including a lychee drink and a mojito. On the sweeter side which I actually enjoyed.
Love this Korean tapas-style restaurant.  Amazing, flavorful, and creative creations!

Mediocre and a rip off. It's the kind of place where they serve 20 cents worth of plantain for $12. Literally 6 slices of plantain! I left hungry and got a second dinner in the east village after ordering everything on the menu with a party of 4.
Love this place. Fantastic food. Fantastic service. This restaurant is now on my rotation of places that i will happily visit monthly.

Fantastic restaurant. I've previously been to Thursday Kitchen and was thrilled to be able to get a seat at Mokyo. I went with a party of four and it was an amazing time. Their plates are simply explosions of flavor and brilliantly created. The attention to detail and service is top-notch. Definitely gives off Michelin star-rated atmosphere. Hope they can keep up their consistency with the food and service being exceptional. Look at their menu before hand, order all the tapas, fun drinks and lastly, have a blast.

Yooo! This place is SOOO dank, some of the best quality food I've had, such a fun atmosphere and such good service, Sophia was our server and she was amazing  like I'm not kidding I fully wanted her to stop working and just come eat dinner with us, such a eccentric person who seemed to be just so herself. she made dining here just that much better. Give that girl a raise

phenomenal food and service. in two weeks i've gone three times and find every opportunity to go again. the environment is boisterous yet intimate and the servers are so hospitable. i always have an amazing time. when you're eating, all you want to do is close your eyes and take it all in.

Came here for my friend's birthday and had a grand time. We all got soju shots on the house since we were returning customers. The service were on point and each dish was so interesting, but with familiar Asian flavors. You won't go wrong with anything, but the truffle dishes are especially great!

Second time dining here and I can't wait to fo back! The corn dumplings are sooo good I could eat 3 bowls of just these - the combination of a creamy truffly dumpling in the cilantro sauce is outstanding. The Rice w/ Octopus and the Noodles w/ Brazilian nuts were delicious too.
Straight up one of the best spots in all of NYC. The food is amazing and the wait staff is wonderful. Huge thank you to Bernard and David for making my dinners here amazing
No comment

The service was amazing, each dish was unique and delicious, and the outdoor seating was cozy and warm. Highlights were the oxtail spring rolls, the cauliflower, the corn dumplings, and the octopus. Hurry out to support this local business! We will be back!
No comment

This place is truly excellent! All of the dishes are innovative and delicious, the service is impeccable and considering how good the food is, the prices are reasonable. You must get the corn dumplings, yellowtail, pork jowls and pop rocks dessert (best dessert I've ever had at an Asian restaurant)! Oxtail spring rolls, steak and lobster rolls were also great. We can't wait to try the sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen now.

Absolutely delicious. Ordered about half the menu and one dish was more impressive than the next. We especially loved the lobster rolls (incredibly flavorful) and the corn dumplings. Mushroom and cabbage was on point. Noodle dish was a party in our mouth.  Service was also friendly and super attentive. Don't miss out!

Got delivery, and the items were OK to our taste. Most of the dishes- Gumbo and octopus rice, were a bit too sweet for our taste. Would like the texture of octopus to be firmer. pork jowl was fatty, but that's probably what pork jowl usually is. Oxtail spring roll was heavy and salty. Dumplings were interesting but filling was mono textured. Maybe this kind of food can only really be truly enjoyed it in person at the restaurant.

If I had to choose between Thursday Kitchen or Mokyo, I would pick Mokyo everyday. The food here is carefully thought out and just hands down delicious. I was able to order everything on the menu, except for the persimmon and gumbo (they were out of the gumbo). I would highly recommend the noodles, corn dumplings, and korean steak. The mushrooms weren't my favorite, but still fairly decent.
No comment
Incredible food! Each dish is so unique. The dumplings and yellowtail were the best and must try!

Ordered the pork jowl, corn dumplings, gumbo, potato crisps and calamari. The pork jowl in particular was really good -- it literally melts in your mouth!! Would definitely get this if ordering here for the first time. The potato crisps were also a hit. Very attentive staff. Also I accidentally forgot my credit card on the table when I left, and a helpful staff ran after me for more than a block to return it. Was super grateful and wished I had thanked him more, but he ran back to the restaurant in a flash. Great place!

The food here was amazing! Came here on a Saturday night without reservations and we were seated inside. Our waiter, Bernard was friendly and helped us decide on how many dishes to order for my fiance and I since these plates were small. We got the Lychee Soda, Oxtail Spring Roll, Corn Dumplings, Rice with Octopus, Pork Jowl, Noodle and the Wagyu Steak. Of all the dishes we ordered, we both really liked the Corn Dumplings, Rice with Octopus and the Noodle. Will definitely come back!
No comment

Sort of disappointed :( My table ordered one of everything (except for the fish) and we only really enjoyed the pork jowl (absolutely delicious!). The other dishes were alright in our opinion. Cauliflower was drenched in the sauce (way too strong), steak had no sear, the rice with octopus was super salty and we couldn't finish it, etc. Portion sizes were really small for the price. Also I didn't like how there was such a long waiting period between getting served each dish - for a while we thought we were finished with our food since nothing came for ~15 mins but then 4 plates suddenly made their way through, so I wish they could've all been served at the same time/with not that long of a waiting period. The indoor seating area was also very hot and the water they served had no ice lol. Also, we had a birthday cake and they said it was $3/pp for the cake fee but when they took it out they didn't provide us with plates, forks, or cut it (which is usually the standard if you're paying the cake fee?) In the end I don't believe they charged us but I feel like if you're not "serving" the cake then $3/pp as a cake fee (esp for a large party) seems a bit much for simply keeping it in the fridge. Other than the food and service, the waiters were very nice and the drinks were good! For 6 people we spent $400 including tax and tip - so like $67 per person :( Not worth especially when everyone was still hungry in the end.
No comment

The service here was absolutely top notch, expect great service, comfortable atmosphere and chats with the waiters. Food was exceptional as well. Highly recommend if you have a small party and looking for a great small bite restaurant!
No comment

I love Thursday Kitchen and Mokyo did not disappoint. We especially enjoyed the corn dumplings and the beef tartare. It's fun and affordable! Don't skimp on dessert, the "pop rocks" dessert was surprisingly delicious and delicate. No reservations, so come early - we only waited for less than an hour

I went with my boyfriend on the weekend and omg I have to come back.  The food and the vibe is perfect for a night out with a couple of drinks. I got a little bit of everything on the menu like the dumplings and the beef tartar. I will definitely be back!

Literally Thursday Kitchen part 2 !!! Amazing flavors in every bite ! Corn dumplings , spring rolls , melt in your mouth steak , gumbo, duck fried rice ..... nothing is bad ! This place is phenomenal and I am so happy we have another option besides Thursday kitchen !

Now they do soft opening Tuesday through Sunday Pm 6:30-9:30 in heart of saint marks place. We went to last night and most of dishes are so amazing. Pretty presentation and great quality of foods. I'm a huge fan of Thursday Kitchen so I had high expectations but they never disappointed me. Similar tapas concept but so much different flavors of foods. Nice customer service and the servers knows about foods very well. I suggest visit them asap when they do soft opening because they will be busy very soon !!

I never give Yelp reviews, but this place is amazing.  Food is on point and the staff are the kindest in the industry.  Ambience is great and it is a hidden gem in the neighborhood.  Me being a selfish guy would like to keep this place a hidden gem, but everyone should have a chance to come here

Went here with a couple of friends last night and was pleasantly surprised by the meal. It's a small plates restaurant so we ordered about 12 dishes for the group. My favorites were the truffle dumplings and lobster rolls. Overall the flavors were really good but the dishes were quite small. I was surprised that we ordered 12 and I was stuffed. Definitely worth a try though!

Went here for a friend's birthday since we love Thursday Kitchen and we were intrigued by its new sister restaurant. Beautiful and unpretentious interior design, lots of small tables ideal for couples and small groups. Everything we tried was delicious and exciting. The big stand outs for me were the corn dumplings, scallop ceviche & injeolmi hazelnut dessert. Cocktails were refreshing and garnished served with the cutest tiny clothespin. Would highly recommend!
Such a wonderful experience with an innovative menu and excellent friendly service. Everything we ate was fantastic and unique. Highly highly recommend

We ordered the dumplings, ceviche, ox tail spring rolls, chicken, fried rice, steak, and lobster rolls, everything was amazing. Heard about this spot while dining at their sister restaurant Thursday Kitchen, it's safe to say I'm in love with the whole family at this point. Highly recommended for date night

Enjoyed my meal here last night! Everything was presentable and tasty. My favorites were the Korean steak and pork jowl. My friend and I were moderately full after ordering 5 dishes. Will be back to try more.
Great place for drinks small plates and good vibes. The hosts and staff will really take care of you. Highly recommend!
Went last Friday night and had a great experience. Both the food and service was truly amazing! Oxtail egg rolls and pork jowl with zucchini were my favorites
No comment
I had an amazing time! The food was better than heaven. Yaani I dont believe in gd but if heaven existed it would be better for sure.

This spot was just perfect!  Our server Bernard was beyond amazing!  He was so knowledgeable and informative and we felt like we were at 11 Madison.  His recommendations were spot on.  The corn dumplings were a flavor explosion, the peach salad was divine and the steak was amazing as well.  We tried the Seoul Soju and it's very rare and it was really unusual and special.  This place is a must try!

If I could, I'd give Mokyo 10 stars! My roommate and I lucked out and moved very close to this lovely Korean tapas restaurant, where the food and service are always impeccable. As a Korean I'm used to very traditional Korean dishes, Mokyo, however, never ceases to amaze with their contemporary spin on Korean flavors. We've become regulars now and have never received a bad meal. The steak, cauliflower, octopus risotto, and pop rocks dessert are some of our favorites, though you can't go wrong with any dish on the menu!  The service is amazing -- the staff are very attentive and extremely kind. We love Mokyo! 11/10 recommend.
Truly spectacular meal with great service and creative small plates. Our favorites were the corn dumplings, oxtail spring rolls and octopus fried rice.

This is going to be my new favorite restaurant in Saint Mark's! My friend and I had dinner here last night for their soft opening. We ordered 9 dishes, and everything we ordered was incredible. The food was unique, creative and incredibly delicious. Plus, the service was friendly, professional and really helpful. Definitely will go back again.
No comment

Holy moly this place is delicious. I had high expectations knowing how good Thursday Kitchen is and it did not disappoint. The pork was one of the best things I have ever eaten. The dumplings were incredible of course. The lamb as well is not to be missed.

Excellent neighborhood restaurant with a wide variety of options. The corn dumplings and the Taiwanese noodles were standout dishes followed by a perfectly cooked hanger steak and duck fried rice. The lamb and chicken both have potential but were unremarkable. Sally the waitress and David the manager split duties bring out dishes and explaining them in great detail. Charming EV location and worth a visit!

Was very excited to try this is new sister restaurant of Thursday Kitchen in East Village with my friends however sadly it didn't live up to the hype. One of us got there early to put our name down and the host said 45 min and logged us in on his ipad. Which was interesting because there were tables open. Then once we all arrived we checked back with the host again and we saw his ipad just had our name and a timer next to it showing how much time our of 45 min its been. So we were waiting for an ipad timer instead of which tables we're clearing up. We were sat at a table that we'd been starring at since we walked in that was free the entire time. The menu was great and the idea of small korean tapas is fun but I don't recommend going there with a big appetite. We had 9 plates between the 3 of us and were still hungry. The plates we're delicious though... Some of our favorites were steak, duck rice, and dumplings. Atmosphere wasn't anything special..

Great place - we had the Korean steak, the noodles, the mushrooms, the lobster roll and the lamp chops. Everything was just the right portion and delicious. Very friendly staff and great service. Would recommend
A sister restaurant of Thursday kitchen, mokyo delivers on food. The dishes are unique. The corn dumplings are amazing. Keep going back often. Definitely recommend!

I give the food 4.5-5 Stars, and the atmosphere was nice. I would give it 5 Stars except for one issue, which me and my wife have experienced on rare occasion, which has forced us to just walk out. We walk into an entirely empty restaurant and we're taken to the smallest table by the door or the bathroom. Last night we went to Cremini's for the first time. No complaints with the food. Also, my wife is fluent Italian, lived in Italy, and made small talk with the owner when we walked in. He takes us to small table right by the front door and adjacent to a table with the only other 2 people in the restaurant. There was a table behind that against the wall, better situated and more comfortable with a padded bench. It was not like it was a table for 10. It was for 3 people. I asked for that table, and he said no, that was for 3 people. I looked around the restaurant. There are about 8 tables and a bar. There is one person at the bar and two at another table. I asked again but he said no, so we were hungry and stayed. Firstly in was a Monday night, about 6 PM, early for most restaurants, and probably the slowest night of the week. I am 6 ft 5 inches tall and 300 lbs, built like a football linebacker, so I am just not comfortable at a small table. Dinner was good, but during the hour or so we were there, not one other person came in to sit at any of the other empty tables. One guy came in to pick up a take out orders and since we were right by the door, he stood there for a few minutes waiting for his order, with his crotch and backside inches from where I was eating. Really not so smart on the owners part because if we would have had the more comfortable table, I would have come back to this restaurant. But there are so many good Italian restaurants just in Downtown Brooklyn and walking distance from our apartment in Dumbo, that there is no need to make the effort. We wanted to try this place, so we took our car out of the parking lot, drove there and had to drive around a bit to find a parking spot. Food is #1 in a restaurant, but being comfortable is just about as important. You go out to a nice restaurant like this for the overall experience, not just the food. Otherwise you might as well just get takeout. And if you're going to spend about $100 for dinner, you'd like it to be a good experience all around.

I have had this spot on my bookmarks forever and finally and very last minute we made it out to give it a try and I loved it. It's not pretentious fussy place it's like going to someone's lovely welcoming house with great wines, great food, great service and great environment. It's hard to find authentic well prepared Italian food in NYC. Believe it or not. This is regional Italian from Le Marche and they offer dishes I have not seen on any menu in NYC to date. There is one dish you see on many menus and that is a cacio pepe which more often than not disappoints me. But the cacio pepe here is excellent. I have not had a cacio pepe this good since I was in Rome, in an non tourist restaurant, with local friends. Nothing is rushed here so go enjoy some wine, aperitivo and a relaxing environment and you will be a happy camper. Can't wait to repeat our visit.

Service was friendly enough though it was the owners. The pasta was very pasty from the flour and overcooked.  The cacciopepe was a disappointment they used ground pepper and not the cracked pepper. Always looking for a good cacciopepe and this was not one of them.
No comment
Excellent food and delicious flavors. Very authentic Italian food. I go to Italy often and can say that Cremini's is equal to the best of eating in comparison. Loved it.
No comment
No comment
Cute little Italian restaurant! The owners are so nice and you can tell the food is made with love. The espresso is also very smooth- bought the Nutella cortado and I would come back just for that.
A gem in this part of Brooklyn. Cosy interior and sit down garden in the back. The stuffed olives are incredible
Second visit was somehow even better. top 2 restaurant in the area. Rigatoni all'Arrrabbiata was delicious. Spice level was real for pasta.

column3: Sant Pere, Santa Caterina i la Ribera-Born, Barcelona, Spain
column6: Still great.  This place is unique and special.  So worth the trip. Try the olives, the burger, the stuffed gnocchi , and especially the wine from Le Marche region .
No comment
No comment
The care and love and passion the owners of this business put into their food and ambiance in unmatched. Get the ascolana olives and please order Elena's burger.
Terrific.  Reminds me of great  meals I've had in Venice and Florence.  Authentic and terrific service by really nice people.  Definitely need to come back soon!
No comment
No comment
Beautiful food run by a very cool couple from Italy. A regular spot, and never disappoints.
The Nutella Banana Bread, alone, was absolutely ridiculously amazing! Squid Ink Burrata Pasta was also delicious!!

We were warmly greeted by the owners when we walked in. Due to COVID, the restaurant did such a good job with distancing all the tables that I thought the restaurant was a pastry shop! They have more seating in the back that can't be seen from the entrance. We got the fried stuffed olives which we haven't seen before! We dove into their spritz drink menu - delicious. The pasta - joy in your mouth. Dessert - a perfect sweet ending.  The owners were attentive, kind, and you could tell they put their heart and soul into each dish. The already savory dishes became more delicious due to the warm interaction. Thank you for a lovely evening!

Great meal all around. The fried olives were incredible. I loved them all but the cod fish was out of this world. Great burger on a soft pretzel bun. The pasta ball tasted so good and I wish I had the recipe for the sauce. The staff was friendly and made sure we felt welcomed. Can't wait to go back - again and again!

I can't believe we found a place that serves authentic Italian olive all'ascolana and that delivers an amazing aperitivo as well. The quality of the ingredients is just amazing and it's impossible to be disappointed. We wanted to tried everything so we got classic and truffle olives, tagliere with 3 meats and 3 cheese, crescia and cacio e pepe. Everything was delicious. The owners are great and super gentle. We'll definitely be back!
No comment
I'm still eating my dinner and couldn't wait to add to all the five star reviews. The food and atmosphere are perfect. Our hosts and chefs are perfect. Please enjoy this restaurant if you haven't.

Do you want to feel like you've been taken on a trip to Italy without leaving Brooklyn... then you must stop into Cremini's when in Carroll Gardens. I'm in love with this place and I can't wait to come back! Highly recommend!

Just discovered this gem. A great neighborhood vibe with a magical garden. I was in Italy recently and Cremini's transported me back to the motherland. We ordered the special Arrabbiata pasta which had the perfect amount of kick, tang and richness. Grazie Elena and Richardo!!
Really cute restaurant with such sweet owners/chef. It was totally empty, not sure why it was so quiet that we had the place to ourselves. The food, desserts, and drinks were all outstanding!

Amazing from top to bottom. The staff I cannot put into words how incredible they are. I suggest getting the rose spritz it's extremely refreshing, the stuffed olives are amazing as well. I've been here 4 times in the last 2 weeks.
No comment

This meal was so so delicious. Handmade pastas and an incredible wine selection. The homemade lasagna the best my husband has ever had. The squid ink pasta had a perfect chewiness mixed with a beautiful burrata and ripe tomatoes-- the perfect balance of flavor. We are coming back ASAP.
Very unfriendly and sad vibes inside. Seems like a front for something. Very strong smell of disinfectant. I wouldn't recommend for the pastry or the atmosphere.
No comment
The rigatoni arriabatta may the most perfect level and flavor of heat I've ever had, in any cuisine. Wish I lived around the block.
No comment

I'm so sad to write this review. People leave such great reviews for this place and I was so excited to try but their Pasta Le Marche was reheated with microwave and middle was not warmed up enough... I should have ordered something else probably. From this one sad experience, unfortunately I wouldn't come back to this restaurant nor recommend this place to my friends and family.

My daughter is a regular here, and always raves about this place. So with that, I knew the one placed I needed to eat was Cremini's. With the start of my cocktail, I knew I was in for a treat. The fried stuff olives is something I would ever think was real but it was a tasty surprise with ever Olive I picked. The dinner was sublime, I had the fried lasagne and my guest had the burgers (we were told it was a 20/30 min wait to cook) and we could have waited longer and I wouldn't be mad. Needless to say, come here for a relaxing dinner, good company from the staff and flavors that you can't even explain. In summary, run... don't walk to Creminis.
FGreat lasagna. Loved the cremini dessert. Food is quite rich and filling. The owners are very sweet and personable. Cozy spot to have a nice meal.
No comment
No comment

Wow, Cremini's was really awesome. The location is great, just a little hard to find. Everything I've tried here was yummy. Workers are super friendly. They're accommodating, respectful and always on their game. Found Cremini's with the help of yelp and would return any time.
An excellent dining experience. Everything we had was superb. All the pastas are homemade and delicious. This is one of the best restaurants I've been to in many years
Loved this place! Got an order of the spicy olives stuffed with meat, number 1 sandwich and two desserts. Will definitely come back soon! I love how varied the menu is.
No comment
No comment
Amazing food! Everything was great from start to finish. The burger was out of this world! Drinks were good too. I found this place impressive and really enjoyed it. Can't wait to go back!
Their custard cream is so good, our favorite flavors are pistachio and classic, chocolate and coffee are ok. The coffee is also good.
No comment

If you're looking for your neighborhood "spot", look no further. We loved the authentic Marche region food - Polpette Le Marche is amazing (I could have a bowl of just the sauce), best porchetta I've ever had (imported from Spain), who doesn't want stuffed olives, and fried custard need I say more. Also the wine (Lacrima de Morro) atmosphere, and hosts! Elena and Ricardo were so welcoming and accommodating and we had a beautiful conversation about Spain and Maine :)
Elena was so sweet. The food was out of this world! I felt like I walked into someone's home in Italy and I an honored guest. Thank you so much

We came with a large party for a Christmas party and we had a blast. The food is delicious and Riccardo and Elena are wonderful hosts. The stuffed olives are to die for and so is every item in their menu, from cremini to fried tagliatelle and tiramisu. The food is as authentic as it gets, a lot of memories from my summer in marche came back... excellent, excellent, excellent.

Wonderful spot in Carroll Gardens for Italian cuisine from the Le Marche region. Owners Elena and Riccardo welcomed us, like long time friends. Linguini with black truffles, perfect. Polpette (fried balls of fettuccine in a rich tomato and beef sauce), so satisfying. Italian wines pair perfectly with the meal. Finished things off with tiramisu and espresso. Looking forward to returning to this neighborhood gem.

My husband and I strolled in to satisfy my sweet tooth and we were so impressed. Ricardo and Elena (I hope I'm not spelling their names wrong) were so personable. The tiramisu and coffee were great. The tiramisu was homemade but their personalities made the spot a location that we'd surely revisit.

Went there on a miserable evening, raining, damp, and cold with 2 friends.  We were the only 4 people in the restaurant and in dire need of some "comfort food".   Couldn't have come to a better place.  The Ascolana olives, in several varieties that were on the menu, provided a solid foundation for the polpette and the special on that night, lasagne.  Elena and Riccardo went out of their way to make us feel as though we were in somebody's home.   We didn't pace ourselves very well, too many olives in the beginning, so we never got to the desserts.  But there is always next time !
We tried a bag of the amaretto cookies and they were delicious!! The people who worked their were so nice. I recommend visiting if you're in the area!
Amazing food.  Love this kind of small neighborhood and authentic restaurants in Carroll Gardens.  We were missing something like this.  Happy to have this place few blocks away from home.
No comment

We were looking for a place for dinner after shopping and decided to give this restaurant a try. The full restaurant was not open at the time when we inquired at the hotel reception (restaurant is inside the hotel) but we could order from the bar area. We ordered the salmon with mashed sweet potatoes and black lentils, as well as the turkey burger melt. The food was average and the service was fine. For me the best part of my meal was the cold Brooklyn lager.
No comment

If you want a nice laid back hotel lounge with great cocktails and good food in the Downtown Area of Brooklyn you should try Black Walnut. Their cocktails were potent but still flavorful and fresh. I ordered the Rosita and smaller the Coffee Cocktail which was super delicious. It is made with Vanilla Absolut, Baileys, Kabul's, and Espresso. This was simply a heavenly dessert drink. My burger was made to perfection and their homemade potato chips had the perfect crisp and Cajun seasoning. I'll definitely come back to try other food and drinks.

We came here from another hotel to get some breakfast. We ordered mostly eggs and it took 45 min for it to arrive while the place was mostly empty. The eggs were just ok. The lack of service here just made it hard to come back.
No comment

No comment

Great place to watch football. They've got the NFL Sunday Ticket package and bottomless mimosas or bloody mary's, why would you go anywhere else? Nice game day specials on both food and drink; $1 wings, $2 tacos and beyond. Buckets of craft beers, or just grab a light domestic, really is up to you. Projector and game day audio for the prime matchups, can't go wrong! Check out Black Walnut next time you're looking for a place to watch some football!
No comment
No comment

Came here for brunch with my boyfriend one random weekend. It wasn't too packed. The food was pretty tasty. We came with a PulsD voucher for unlimited mimosas. Mimosas are mimosas-not much to screw up there but the food was good. I ordered the country sausage dish and my boyfriend got the chicken and corn Jalepeno waffles which weren't bad as I thought they were going to be. All in all. Food was good but there was only 1 waiter so service was a bit lagged. I didn't mind too much but that clearly upset other people who came after.

This is a restaurant in the Hilton hotel in downtown Brooklyn.  They have a small but tasty menu the drink are good. There is a sitting area near the window with fireplace and TV. I've never seen this place crowded so it is a good place to have a drink and talk. The flatbread is very tasty and and deviled eggs are good.
No comment
The staff here is awesome ! The service is great, The food is high quality. And also thanks to the bartender for my cocktail .
Chicken and waffles yum. Jalapeño corn waffle yum yum.  Spicy honey? Yes please. This place is a hidden gem on the first floor of the Hilton hotel.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Gabriel, the bartender is super chill! Nice friendly conversation, in a chic, brand new Hilton in Downtown Brooklyn! I had to do a conference call, and the space beside the bar with comfy chairs & couches, was the perfect, quiet space! Hey also have tv's by the bar & lounge to keep up with sports and/or news, plus a large dining room, which looks like it can accommodate good sized groups! Although, I did not eat, I hear their food is top notch, originating from the masters of Wilma Jean & their other locations (Carroll Gardens). It has since been bought out by Hilton, but apparently holds similar standards/menu, and still has some sort of affiliation.
Food is so good. The bartender Tori was extremely helpful and attentive. We will definitely visit the Black Walnut again.

No comment

I come to Brooklyn a lot for work & usually when I travel for work I don't stay in the hotel. That's not the case when I come here though. I enjoy the food and drinks and Taury is definitely my favorite bartender!

Would definitely not recommend this place for breakfast. Hot coffee tasted a bit burnt, oatmeal was primarily heavy cream, and it just wasn't worth the price. It gets the job done if you're staying here, but otherwise it's just like any other mid level hotel breakfast.

Came in the have a drink along with my co- worker. The drink was amazing I had the prickly pear marg it was delish. The environment had a nice fresh clean feel to it. Our bartender Racheal was so sweet and kind. Had a great time!!!!
I absolutely love The Black Walnut! The food the is amazing! The staff here are wonderful. The bartenders are well versed with there selection of drinks. Taury, Rachel, and AZ are the greatest!
Very good cocktails with great execution. I recommend fried smashed potatoes and arancini. The bartender Jordano was awesome and very personable.
No comment
Great service! Unpretentious feel. Shishito pepper sunchocke app and beef tartar so yummy! Spaeztke and burger amazing. The hot chocolate rum dessert so delicious! Def worth a try!!  Xoxo
Breakfast was wonderful and tasty. The waiter was very helpful. My eggs sunny side up was perfect and the home fries were very crispy. Coffee was hot!

The saving grace of this restaurant was our Uzbeki server, AZ who cared a great deal about our experience. However, the original chef is no longer here which is why I suggested this to my family in the first plce. The dishes are bland and uninteresting. Just overpriced hotel cuisine.
Simple menu, excellent food preparation, friendly waiters... I would definitely recommend it for visitors and locals alike!

Soooo, I arrived at the hotel at 10:40. Was told they were serving until 11. Was hoping to simply get a cocktail but when I went to the bar at 10:50, I was told they had last call already. Not traveler friendly. Also, I've been in Midwest towns that stay open longer that this area. Am I even in NYC???

I like this place!  Food is good, fresh and tasty  but don't expect much for service, it's like nonexistent hotel service.    The place is contemporary and clean but bring good company with you because the place is empty which i don't mind.   My manhattan was made well and they serve delicious local made pie.  Overall a great neighborhood stop for a bite with a friend.
No comment
Nonexistent service tops off a very expensive hotel menu experience.  Don't go there!  Anywhere would be better.

I've been coming here for a few months and I must say it just keeps getting better and better from the food to the drinks. Whatever they're doing, keep doing it!! The staff is amazing and Tory is usually my go to girl behind the bar!!!

I was a guest at the Hilton hotel in which this restaurant resides and sat at the Black Walnut bar for a solo dinner. I was expecting the typical, mediocre to disappointing hotel restaurant fare. Instead I had the most refined and  delicious meal I have had in months. I'll be back for sure, whether I'm staying at the Hilton or not.
No comment

Amazing food and staff! As former BK locals, my wife and I stayed at the Brooklyn Hilton and and invited a bunch of friends to meet at the bar. The bartender was on point, but the best part was the food. Chef Tony Tardio is a wizard, and a serious up and comer in the NY restaurant scene. I've been following Tony around for a few years and this time decided to order a bunch of apps as our group was busy mingling. We ordered about eight plates, which were all amazing but three dishes in particular stood out--the Short Rib Grilled Cheese, Nacho Arancini, and the Salmon Tartare. Each were out if this world and a must have if you have the chance to visit! On. Side note, the scene at the bar was surprisingly happening, with a good looking mix of trendy locals and tourists. Great spot, and hats off to the chef!
kind of a weird place to eat in a neighborhood surrounded by tons of great options. Not sure who'd want to eat at a pretty sterile environment inside a hilton hotel.

Wow this place is amazing. I went there with an hour left before closing but the staff never made us feel like we needed to rush and leave. I ordered a tequila based drink with passionfruit. For app we got the elote and chicharrones. The corn was delicious but definitely not a big enough portion. the chicharrones were good but the pepita dip was really what made it. portion was also small though, 2-3 chunks. For meal, I ordered the carne asada tacos and they were amazing! so tasty. the tortilla was slightly crunchy with a nice layer of melted cheese. The meat was deliciously flavored. I also added some of the pepita dip and it brought a tasty balanced smokey kick. The staff was very nice and helpful. Im dreaming of going back again soon.

No comment

What a hidden gem! Been meaning to come here but wasn't expecting much. I kinda thought it was just a bar that served food it's hard to tell from the outside. Everything was so on point! We got the tuna tostadas, fish tacos and vegan chorizo potato tacos (the vegan "chorizo" was actually mushroom based was excellent). We'll be back looking forward to trying more things.
No comment
This is one of the most amazing experiences of Mexican cuisine with an amazing view of nyc! LOVE IT!!
Delicious margaritas!!!! Very well made. Nice ambiance, still a fairly new place but hospitality is great here
Great food, service and ambiance. The tacos are great. Drinks are really tasty. Don't miss the ahi tuna tostada, carne asada tacos and the guac. Bonus, there's a cool lounge downstairs on weekends!
Getting our drink on and eat on. We samples everything guacamole, elote, fish, steak tacos, chicken milanesa, truffle fries and the most delicious arugula  thanks Gigi for accommodating us

If you're looking to transport yourself to a different culture for an evening, look no further than this exquisite Mexican restaurant. From the moment you walk in, the festive atmosphere and warm welcome puts you right at ease. The flavorful enchiladas and spicy tacos can only be matched by the stunning presentation of the food. Don't even get me started on the refreshing and fruity margaritas! The friendly wait staff further enhances the experience, providing impeccable service. All in all, one of the best Mexican restaurants I have come across!

Great new spot near domino park!  Beautiful interior, very fun atmosphere, delicious food & drinks - the goat cheese balls were a stand out dish, definite must try!  Great service & friendly staff :) excited to come back and try the rest of the menu!
Fantastic neighborhood place - warm and welcoming....tamales are amazing....can't wait to come back and try more...

Xolo is a very welcome addition to the Domino Park neighborhood! The food is thoughtful, creative, and delicious. The cocktails look great - I love the Watermelon-Jalapeno Margarita so much, I've never ordered anything else - and the staff is so friendly! I would absolutely recommend the Fried Goat Cheese, the Stuffed Poblano, and any of the tacos. Don't miss their AMAZING desserts!
This is our new go-to Mexican spot in the neighborhood! Excellent, high-quality food; tasty drinks; great service and ambiance. Everyone should eat at Xolo!
No comment

Great food and service. Food is amazing the combination of flavors it was on point. A great place to enjoy good food and spend a great evening with friends. Love the location and the amazing view of the Williamsburg Bridge and the city lights makes this restaurant/bar the perfect spot.

This place is a gem! Wonderful food, staff, and space (including separate bar downstairs). We had the watermelon mezcal margaritas, breakfast tacos, flautas and it was all lovely! Staff was super courteous and inviting. 10/10 will be returning.

I absolutely love this restaurant. The staff is friendly and very welcoming from the second you step inside. The food is delicious and well portioned. The non happy hour margaritas are divine and perfectly prepared with more than enough tequila.  Love it! The only con is the happy hour margaritas lack enough tequila. The bar downstairs, Bar Milagros is a nice space and fun. The drinks are all good and strong. This restaurant and bar are definitely a great addition to the neighborhood. I will keep going back!!!
Great food! Great Cocktails! Go go go!!! Nice place, nice people. Fun time. We will be back for sure!
Their food is excellent, their vibe and service is also amazing!  We had an amazing time and will definitely come back!

Amazing service. We went for happy hour, the deals were good. Oyster selection is great. I will definitely visit again!

I'm really shocked this place has so little reviews. I took my husband here yesterday Saturday night for his birthday. It has been sooo long since we had good quality service like this. Granted the waitress was busy, but she was such a sweetheart. She smiled a lot and made us feel comfortable. The hostess was very kind too and helped out, which is rare because I don't usually see them do that. She knew about all the drinks and the menu, offered me the Buena Vista cocktail and I enjoyed it. The food was good! The seafood were all fresh. Oysters were delicious. And omg the pan con tomate. We tried this in Spain before and loved it! It was just as good here. The space was really small and I really didn't like the high bar tables, but hey Bar Crudo right? Give this place a try!

I had to update my review to a 1 STAR and I will NEVER be going to Bar Crudo again - even for just oysters. I took my boyfriend and his family for his 30th birthday because of how much he loves oysters and I had faith in crudo and decided to give  it another chance HORRIBLE MISTAKE!!!! The staff COMPLETELY ignored our table of 6 - not to mention they sat us by the door (a big party who will be paying a big check?!!??) and we all froze. To top it off - there was a hair wrapped around one of our guests lobster cabonara - GET THIS - they offered to replace the disgusting hairy meal with a new one - nice right? WRONG because THEY CHARGED US FOR THE MEAL!!!! And continued to IGNORE OUR TABLE! DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT BOTHER WITH THIS SPOT. SOOOOO NOT WORTH IT FOR MEDIOCRE HAIRY FOOD AND HORRIBLE SERVICE/ATTITUDE !!!

My friends and I came here for our friends birthday and her goodbye trip. The waiters were very sweet and nice. Food was good, the drinks were really good. rice was on the dry, but everything else was good. There raw bar of oysters was really good, got about 48 oysters. We did make reservations when we came.

I was actually pretty surprised by how empty this place was during happy hour. I made a Resy reservation for 6 people at 5:15pm for happy hour on a Wednesday and it wasn't necessary as all since the place only had a couple of other guests. The service was amazing. Our group got a couple of rounds of drinks, poutine, mussels, and a three dozen $1.50 oysters. The food was good and the vibes were chill. I wouldn't say this is a standout place but certainly a good place to enjoy happy hour.

My absolute favorite spot in park slope for drinks and food, love ceviche and seafood here, and just when I thought it couldn't get any better - I tried Brazilian cheese bread and omg I'm in trouble. I've been back a couple of times already just for that warm fluffy cheesy heaven and had to order a second portion today it was that good!!
No comment

Came here for our anniversary, and everything was outstanding. We ate the Brazilian cheese bread, scallop ceviche, escargot, and grilled fish and chips. The latter two dishes were really standouts. The team also provided us with a glass of wine on the house in honor of our anniversary, a gesture that was very much appreciated. We'll be back, and soon!

No comment

Great seafood place! The shrimp appetizer was very good, the shrimp actually had a seafood-y taste. We ordered the paella with lobster. All of the seafood was cooked perfectly! Except the lobster was so tender it didn't have any texture. I thought the rice was too salty. The service was great, to the point where someone came to our table 6-7 times to refill our water which was unnecessary. Highly recommend the cucumber cocktail and change of seasons cocktail

I usually don't leave bad reviews but I ordered some stuff by Door Dash.  The seafood pasta $34 and ceviche $18.  Everything tasted great so I can't complain about that but the portion size for the ceviche is ridiculously small for $18.  And the seafood pasta was pretty expensive considering there were only 2 clams in there and one of them was unopened.  Plenty of mussels though.  The oysters I have to say are very good.

Nice seafood spot in Brooklyn! Food is a little on the pricier side but I was overall happy with the quality. Cocktails were kind of meh though. I had the seafood paella which was smaller than I thought it'd be; great flavors and they don't skimp on the seafood though. My sister had the octopus which was delicious and really tender; that being said, the portion size was pretty small. Oysters are decent, nothing particularly noteworthy.

Great place for oysters and drinks....bartender Wayne is amazing... shrimp dish and crab cakes are Ok.... we will be back for happy hour oysters..

We came by because I'm a ceviche fanatic but they portion just wasn't big enough for my tummy . My date wasn't pleased with the portion they served the paella either . It was however tasty, and the staff was friendly . I think I would give it another try, just not when we're hungry .

Really great service and had a wonderful meal! We ordered the tuna ceviche and it was really fresh, ask for extra plantain chips. The seafood paella had all sorts of treasures in it and was fun to eat. The highlight of the meal was the fish and chips. I loved that instead they serve the fish as a grilled branzino. It's so flavorful and delicious and I love the grilled taste. The fries were also seasoned so well didn't even need the ketchup. Would definitely recommend trying!
All the food was delicious. Wonderful location in Brooklyn, super chill with a great happy hour menu ( oysters!) Strongly recommend the ceviche and empanadas but everything was amazing.
Mediocre and overpriced. Staff was attentive but the food was lacking in flavor. Oyster happy hour would be the only reason I go back.

For the last few days I had been craving oysters and was about to make the trek to sheepshead to dine at one of my fav spots for oysters. But I was in need of a different atmosphere and remembered I had this place saved for quite a bit. Glad I did! Walked into this cozy lil spot and was greeted by smiles and a friendly staff. Sat down and got the ball rolling. Jessica who is probably one of the best servers I've ever met new the menu and told me exactly what to get. Started with the Passion Pisco which was really good but I couldn't get past the frothy egg thing so I had Prosecco after. The oysters which are their signature oysters were really good and we had about 24... they were perfect in size. Crab cakes were moist and crispy. I always find people over salt crab cakes to grab flavor and this was not the case. They were perfect. The poutine was for for 2 and I absolutely loved the devil eggs. I enjoyed the carrot cake but it had a weird bitter taste. Still demolished it.. everything was great and the staff continuously checked up on us and I mean the whole staff not just our server Jessica. We got there exactly at the start of dinner which was empty and by the time we left there was def a crowd. Will be back again!!!!
What a great happy hour spot. The staff was so friendly and nice. My fave was the ricotta app.
No comment

No comment

I noticed too late people weren't finishing their cocktails and once I got mine it was apparent why. My cocktail, Diego, was super underwhelming with no flavor profile. It left me wanting even a scent of flavor. The oyster shooter didn't come in a shot but a small goblet cup filled with a tremendous amount of underwhelming liquid (I had no spoons so fished out the egg/oyster with a fork. It was challenging yet the best and only good thing about that). The poached octopus was keeping up with the theme of just being edible. They reminded me of canned octopus. Not the budget/affordable kind but the pricy kind (definitely use the lemon, it adds much needed flavor). The snails are to die for! Hands down in the top of best creative take on escargot I have had thus far, brava  (stars for this and the excellent service). The paella was also just meh. The rice was slightly over cooked but the mussels, clam and squid were nicely cooked (not chewy at all) however the shrimp and chorizo were quite tough. Overall I'm glad I get to tick this one off my list of eateries but it is not a go to joint for seafood.
